36// Standard combined includes:
37#include <algorithm>
38#include <array>
39#include <cctype>

41#include <cmath>

45#include <cwchar>
46#include <exception>
47#include <fstream>

53#include <locale>
54#include <map>
55#include <memory>
56#include <numeric>
57#include <set>
58#include <sstream>
59#include <stdexcept>

62#include <type_traits>

66#define CLI11_VERSION_MAJOR 2
67#define CLI11_VERSION_MINOR 3
68#define CLI11_VERSION_PATCH 2
69#define CLI11_VERSION "2.3.2"
70
71// The following version macro is very similar to the one in pybind11
72#if !(defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
73#if __cplusplus >= 201402L
74#define CLI11_CPP14
75#if __cplusplus >= 201703L
76#define CLI11_CPP17
77#if __cplusplus > 201703L
78#define CLI11_CPP20
79#endif
80#endif
81#endif
82#elif defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L
83// MSVC sets _MSVC_LANG rather than __cplusplus (supposedly until the standard is fully implemented)
84// Unless you use the /Zc:__cplusplus flag on Visual Studio 2017 15.7 Preview 3 or newer
85#if _MSVC_LANG >= 201402L
86#define CLI11_CPP14
87#if _MSVC_LANG > 201402L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
88#define CLI11_CPP17
89#if _MSVC_LANG > 201703L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
90#define CLI11_CPP20
91#endif
92#endif
93#endif
94#endif
95
96#if defined(CLI11_CPP14)
97#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) [[deprecated(reason)]]
98#elif defined(_MSC_VER)
99#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __declspec(deprecated(reason))
100#else
101#define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __attribute__((deprecated(reason)))
102#endif
103
104// GCC < 10 doesn't ignore this in unevaluated contexts
105#if !defined(CLI11_CPP17) || (defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__llvm__) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && __GNUC__ < 10 && __GNUC__ > 4)
106#define CLI11_NODISCARD
107#else
108#define CLI11_NODISCARD [[nodiscard]]
109#endif
110
111/** detection of rtti */
112#ifndef CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI
113#if (defined(_HAS_STATIC_RTTI) && _HAS_STATIC_RTTI)
114#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
115#elif defined(__cpp_rtti)
116#if (defined(_CPPRTTI) && _CPPRTTI == 0)
117#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
118#else
119#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 0
120#endif
121#elif (defined(__GCC_RTTI) && __GXX_RTTI)
122#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 0
123#else
124#define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
125#endif
126#endif
127
128/** <filesystem> availability */
129#if defined CLI11_CPP17 && defined __has_include && !defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
130#if __has_include(<filesystem>)
131// Filesystem cannot be used if targeting macOS < 10.15
132#if defined __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED && __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
133#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
134#elif defined(__wasi__)
135// As of wasi-sdk-14, filesystem is not implemented
136#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
137#else
138#include <filesystem>
139#if defined __cpp_lib_filesystem && __cpp_lib_filesystem >= 201703
140#if defined _GLIBCXX_RELEASE && _GLIBCXX_RELEASE >= 9
141#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
142#elif defined(__GLIBCXX__)
143// if we are using gcc and Version <9 default to no filesystem
144#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
145#else
146#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
147#endif
148#else
149#define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
150#endif
151#endif
152#endif
153#endif
154
155/** <codecvt> availability */
156#if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__llvm__) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && __GNUC__ < 5
157#define CLI11_HAS_CODECVT 0
158#else
159#define CLI11_HAS_CODECVT 1
160#include <codecvt>
161#endif
162
163/** disable deprecations */
164#if defined(__GNUC__) // GCC or clang
165#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("GCC diagnostic push")
166#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("GCC diagnostic pop")
167
168#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_IGNORE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wdeprecated-declarations\"")
169
170#elif defined(_MSC_VER)
171#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH __pragma(warning(push))
172#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_POP __pragma(warning(pop))
173
174#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_IGNORE_DEPRECATED __pragma(warning(disable : 4996))
175
176#else
177#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH
178#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
179
180#define CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_IGNORE_DEPRECATED
181
182#endif
183
184/** Inline macro **/
185#ifdef CLI11_COMPILE
186#define CLI11_INLINE
187#else
188#define CLI11_INLINE inline
189#endif
190
191#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
192#include <filesystem> // NOLINT(build/include)
193#else
194#include <sys/stat.h>
195#include <sys/types.h>
196#endif
197
198#ifdef CLI11_CPP17
199#include <string_view>
200#endif // CLI11_CPP17
201
202#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
203#include <filesystem>
204#include <string_view> // NOLINT(build/include)
205#endif // CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
206
207#if defined(_WIN32)
208#if !(defined(_AMD64_) || defined(_X86_) || defined(_ARM_))
209#if defined(__amd64__) || defined(__amd64) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__x86_64) || defined(_M_X64) || defined(_M_AMD64)
210#define _AMD64_
211#elif defined(i386) || defined(__i386) || defined(__i386__) || defined(__i386__) || defined(_M_IX86)
212#define _X86_
213#elif defined(__arm__) || defined(_M_ARM) || defined(_M_ARMT)
214#define _ARM_
215#endif
216#endif

218// first
219#ifndef NOMINMAX
220// if NOMINMAX is already defined we don't want to mess with that either way
221#define NOMINMAX
222#include <windef.h>
223#undef NOMINMAX
224#else
225#include <windef.h>
226#endif
227
228// second
229#include <winbase.h>
230// third
231#include <processthreadsapi.h>
232#include <shellapi.h>

234#elif defined(__APPLE__)
235#include <crt_externs.h>
236#endif

238namespace CLI {
239
240 /// Convert a wide string to a narrow string.
241 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(const std::wstring& str);
242 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(const wchar_t* str);
243 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(const wchar_t* str, std::size_t size);
244
245 /// Convert a narrow string to a wide string.
246 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(const std::string& str);
247 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(const char* str);
248 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(const char* str, std::size_t size);
249
250#ifdef CLI11_CPP17
251 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(std::wstring_view str);
252 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(std::string_view str);
253#endif // CLI11_CPP17
254
255#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
256 /// Convert a char-string to a native path correctly.
257 CLI11_INLINE std::filesystem::path to_path(std::string_view str);
258#endif // CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
259
260 namespace detail {
261
262#if !CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
263 /// Attempt to set one of the acceptable unicode locales for conversion
264 CLI11_INLINE void set_unicode_locale() {
265 static const std::array<const char*, 3> unicode_locales{{"C.UTF-8", "en_US.UTF-8", ".UTF-8"}};
266
267 for (const auto& locale_name : unicode_locales) {
268 if (std::setlocale(LC_ALL, locale_name) != nullptr) {
269 return;
270 }
271 }
272 throw std::runtime_error("CLI::narrow: could not set locale to C.UTF-8");
273 }
274
275 template <typename F>
276 struct scope_guard_t {
277 F closure;
278
279 explicit scope_guard_t(F closure_)
280 : closure(closure_) {
281 }
282 ~scope_guard_t() {
283 closure();
284 }
285 };
286
287 template <typename F>
288 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE scope_guard_t<F> scope_guard(F&& closure) {
289 return scope_guard_t<F>{std::forward<F>(closure)};
290 }
291
292#endif // !CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
293
294 CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH
295 CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_IGNORE_DEPRECATED
296
297 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow_impl(const wchar_t* str, std::size_t str_size) {
298#if CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
299#ifdef _WIN32
300 return std::wstring_convert<std::codecvt_utf8_utf16<wchar_t>>().to_bytes(str, str + str_size);
301
302#else
303 return std::wstring_convert<std::codecvt_utf8<wchar_t>>().to_bytes(str, str + str_size);
304
305#endif // _WIN32
306#else // CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
307 (void) str_size;
308 std::mbstate_t state = std::mbstate_t();
309 const wchar_t* it = str;
310
311 std::string old_locale = std::setlocale(LC_ALL, nullptr);
312 auto sg = scope_guard([&] {
313 std::setlocale(LC_ALL, old_locale.c_str());
314 });
315 set_unicode_locale();
316
317 std::size_t new_size = std::wcsrtombs(nullptr, &it, 0, &state);
318 if (new_size == static_cast<std::size_t>(-1)) {
319 throw std::runtime_error("CLI::narrow: conversion error in std::wcsrtombs at offset " + std::to_string(it - str));
320 }
321 std::string result(new_size, '\0');
322 std::wcsrtombs(const_cast<char*>(result.data()), &str, new_size, &state);
323
324 return result;
325
326#endif // CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
327 }
328
329 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen_impl(const char* str, std::size_t str_size) {
330#if CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
331#ifdef _WIN32
332 return std::wstring_convert<std::codecvt_utf8_utf16<wchar_t>>().from_bytes(str, str + str_size);
333
334#else
335 return std::wstring_convert<std::codecvt_utf8<wchar_t>>().from_bytes(str, str + str_size);
336
337#endif // _WIN32
338#else // CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
339 (void) str_size;
340 std::mbstate_t state = std::mbstate_t();
341 const char* it = str;
342
343 std::string old_locale = std::setlocale(LC_ALL, nullptr);
344 auto sg = scope_guard([&] {
345 std::setlocale(LC_ALL, old_locale.c_str());
346 });
347 set_unicode_locale();
348
349 std::size_t new_size = std::mbsrtowcs(nullptr, &it, 0, &state);
350 if (new_size == static_cast<std::size_t>(-1)) {
351 throw std::runtime_error("CLI::widen: conversion error in std::mbsrtowcs at offset " + std::to_string(it - str));
352 }
353 std::wstring result(new_size, L'\0');
354 std::mbsrtowcs(const_cast<wchar_t*>(result.data()), &str, new_size, &state);
355
356 return result;
357
358#endif // CLI11_HAS_CODECVT
359 }
360
361 CLI11_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
362
363 } // namespace detail
364
365 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(const wchar_t* str, std::size_t str_size) {
366 return detail::narrow_impl(str, str_size);
367 }
368 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(const std::wstring& str) {
369 return detail::narrow_impl(str.data(), str.size());
370 }
371 // Flawfinder: ignore
372 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(const wchar_t* str) {
373 return detail::narrow_impl(str, std::wcslen(str));
374 }
375
376 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(const char* str, std::size_t str_size) {
377 return detail::widen_impl(str, str_size);
378 }
379 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(const std::string& str) {
380 return detail::widen_impl(str.data(), str.size());
381 }
382 // Flawfinder: ignore
383 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(const char* str) {
384 return detail::widen_impl(str, std::strlen(str));
385 }
386
387#ifdef CLI11_CPP17
388 CLI11_INLINE std::string narrow(std::wstring_view str) {
389 return detail::narrow_impl(str.data(), str.size());
390 }
391 CLI11_INLINE std::wstring widen(std::string_view str) {
392 return detail::widen_impl(str.data(), str.size());
393 }
394#endif // CLI11_CPP17
395
396#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
397 CLI11_INLINE std::filesystem::path to_path(std::string_view str) {
398 return std::filesystem::path{
399#ifdef _WIN32
400 widen(str)
401#else
402 str
403#endif // _WIN32
404 };
405 }
406#endif // CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
407
408 /// argc as passed in to this executable.
409 CLI11_INLINE int argc();
410
411 /// argv as passed in to this executable, converted to utf-8 on Windows.
412 CLI11_INLINE const char* const* argv();
413
414 namespace detail {
415
416#ifdef __APPLE__
417 // Copy argc and argv as early as possible to avoid modification
418 static const std::vector<const char*> static_args = [] {
419 static const std::vector<std::string> static_args_as_strings = [] {
420 std::vector<std::string> args_as_strings;
421 int argc = *_NSGetArgc();
422 char** argv = *_NSGetArgv();
423
424 args_as_strings.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(argc));
425 for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(argc); i++) {
426 args_as_strings.push_back(argv[i]);
427 }
428
429 return args_as_strings;
430 }();
431
432 std::vector<const char*> static_args_result;
433 static_args_result.reserve(static_args_as_strings.size());
434
435 for (const auto& arg : static_args_as_strings) {
436 static_args_result.push_back(arg.data());
437 }
438
439 return static_args_result;
440 }();
441#endif
442
443 /// Command-line arguments, as passed in to this executable, converted to utf-8 on Windows.
444 CLI11_INLINE const std::vector<const char*>& args() {
445 // This function uses initialization via lambdas extensively to take advantage of the thread safety of static
446 // variable initialization [stmt.dcl.3]
447
448#ifdef _WIN32
449 static const std::vector<const char*> static_args = [] {
450 static const std::vector<std::string> static_args_as_strings = [] {
451 // On Windows, take arguments from GetCommandLineW and convert them to utf-8.
452 std::vector<std::string> args_as_strings;
453 int argc = 0;
454
455 auto deleter = [](wchar_t** ptr) {
456 LocalFree(ptr);
457 };
458 // NOLINTBEGIN(*-avoid-c-arrays)
459 auto wargv = std::unique_ptr<wchar_t*[], decltype(deleter)>(CommandLineToArgvW(GetCommandLineW(), &argc), deleter);
460 // NOLINTEND(*-avoid-c-arrays)
461
462 if (wargv == nullptr) {
463 throw std::runtime_error("CommandLineToArgvW failed with code " + std::to_string(GetLastError()));
464 }
465
466 args_as_strings.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(argc));
467 for (size_t i = 0; i < static_cast<size_t>(argc); ++i) {
468 args_as_strings.push_back(narrow(wargv[i]));
469 }
470
471 return args_as_strings;
472 }();
473
474 std::vector<const char*> static_args_result;
475 static_args_result.reserve(static_args_as_strings.size());
476
477 for (const auto& arg : static_args_as_strings) {
478 static_args_result.push_back(arg.data());
479 }
480
481 return static_args_result;
482 }();
483
484 return static_args;
485
486#elif defined(__APPLE__)
487
488 return static_args;
489
490#else
491 static const std::vector<const char*> static_args = [] {
492 static const std::vector<char> static_cmdline = [] {
493 // On posix, retrieve arguments from /proc/self/cmdline, separated by null terminators.
494 std::vector<char> cmdline;
495
496 auto deleter = [](FILE* f) {
497 std::fclose(f);
498 };
499 std::unique_ptr<FILE, decltype(deleter)> const fp_unique(std::fopen("/proc/self/cmdline", "r"), deleter);
500 FILE* fp = fp_unique.get();
501 if (!fp) {
502 throw std::runtime_error("could not open /proc/self/cmdline for reading"); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
503 }
504
505 size_t size = 0;
506 while (std::feof(fp) == 0) {
507 cmdline.resize(size + 128);
508 size += std::fread(cmdline.data() + size, 1, 128, fp);
509
510 if (std::ferror(fp) != 0) {
511 throw std::runtime_error("error during reading /proc/self/cmdline"); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
512 }
513 }
514 cmdline.resize(size);
515
516 return cmdline;
517 }();
518
519 std::size_t const argc = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::count(static_cmdline.begin(), static_cmdline.end(), '\0'));
520 std::vector<const char*> static_args_result;
521 static_args_result.reserve(argc);
522
523 for (auto it = static_cmdline.begin(); it != static_cmdline.end(); it = std::find(it, static_cmdline.end(), '\0') + 1) {
524 static_args_result.push_back(static_cmdline.data() + (it - static_cmdline.begin()));
525 }
526
527 return static_args_result;
528 }();
529
530 return static_args;
531#endif
532 }
533
534 } // namespace detail
535
536 CLI11_INLINE const char* const* argv() {
537 return detail::args().data();
538 }
539 CLI11_INLINE int argc() {
540 return static_cast<int>(detail::args().size());
541 }
542
543 /// Include the items in this namespace to get free conversion of enums to/from streams.
544 /// (This is available inside CLI as well, so CLI11 will use this without a using statement).
545 namespace enums {
546
547 /// output streaming for enumerations
548 template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type>
549 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& in, const T& item) {
550 // make sure this is out of the detail namespace otherwise it won't be found when needed
551 return in << static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(item);
552 }
553
554 } // namespace enums
555
556 /// Export to CLI namespace
557 using enums::operator<<;
558
559 namespace detail {
560 /// a constant defining an expected max vector size defined to be a big number that could be multiplied by 4 and not
561 /// produce overflow for some expected uses
562 constexpr int expected_max_vector_size{1 << 29};
563 // Based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/236129/split-a-string-in-c
564 /// Split a string by a delim
565 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& s, char delim);
566
567 /// Simple function to join a string
568 template <typename T>
569 std::string join(const T& v, std::string delim = ",") {
570 std::ostringstream s;
571 auto beg = std::begin(v);
572 auto end = std::end(v);
573 if (beg != end)
574 s << *beg++;
575 while (beg != end) {
576 s << delim << *beg++;
577 }
578 return s.str();
579 }
580
581 /// Simple function to join a string from processed elements
582 template <typename T,
583 typename Callable,
584 typename = typename std::enable_if<!std::is_constructible<std::string, Callable>::value>::type>
585 std::string join(const T& v, Callable func, std::string delim = ",") {
586 std::ostringstream s;
587 auto beg = std::begin(v);
588 auto end = std::end(v);
589 auto loc = s.tellp();
590 while (beg != end) {
591 auto nloc = s.tellp();
592 if (nloc > loc) {
593 s << delim;
594 loc = nloc;
595 }
596 s << func(*beg++);
597 }
598 return s.str();
599 }
600
601 /// Join a string in reverse order
602 template <typename T>
603 std::string rjoin(const T& v, std::string delim = ",") {
604 std::ostringstream s;
605 for (std::size_t start = 0; start < v.size(); start++) {
606 if (start > 0)
607 s << delim;
608 s << v[v.size() - start - 1];
609 }
610 return s.str();
611 }
612
613 // Based roughly on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25829143/c-trim-whitespace-from-a-string
614
615 /// Trim whitespace from left of string
616 CLI11_INLINE std::string& ltrim(std::string& str);
617
618 /// Trim anything from left of string
619 CLI11_INLINE std::string& ltrim(std::string& str, const std::string& filter);
620
621 /// Trim whitespace from right of string
622 CLI11_INLINE std::string& rtrim(std::string& str);
623
624 /// Trim anything from right of string
625 CLI11_INLINE std::string& rtrim(std::string& str, const std::string& filter);
626
627 /// Trim whitespace from string
628 inline std::string& trim(std::string& str) {
629 return ltrim(rtrim(str));
630 }
631
632 /// Trim anything from string
633 inline std::string& trim(std::string& str, const std::string filter) {
634 return ltrim(rtrim(str, filter), filter);
635 }
636
637 /// Make a copy of the string and then trim it
638 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string& str) {
639 std::string s = str;
640 return trim(s);
641 }
642
643 /// remove quotes at the front and back of a string either '"' or '\''
644 CLI11_INLINE std::string& remove_quotes(std::string& str);
645
646 /// Add a leader to the beginning of all new lines (nothing is added
647 /// at the start of the first line). `"; "` would be for ini files
648 ///
649 /// Can't use Regex, or this would be a subs.
650 CLI11_INLINE std::string fix_newlines(const std::string& leader, std::string input);
651
652 /// Make a copy of the string and then trim it, any filter string can be used (any char in string is filtered)
653 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string& str, const std::string& filter) {
654 std::string s = str;
655 return trim(s, filter);
656 }
657 /// Print a two part "help" string
658 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream& format_help(std::ostream& out, std::string name, const std::string& description, std::size_t wid);
659
660 /// Print subcommand aliases
661 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream& format_aliases(std::ostream& out, const std::vector<std::string>& aliases, std::size_t wid);
662
663 /// Verify the first character of an option
664 /// - is a trigger character, ! has special meaning and new lines would just be annoying to deal with
665 template <typename T>
666 bool valid_first_char(T c) {
667 return ((c != '-') && (c != '!') && (c != ' ') && c != '\n');
668 }
669
670 /// Verify following characters of an option
671 template <typename T>
672 bool valid_later_char(T c) {
673 // = and : are value separators, { has special meaning for option defaults,
674 // and \n would just be annoying to deal with in many places allowing space here has too much potential for
675 // inadvertent entry errors and bugs
676 return ((c != '=') && (c != ':') && (c != '{') && (c != ' ') && c != '\n');
677 }
678
679 /// Verify an option/subcommand name
680 CLI11_INLINE bool valid_name_string(const std::string& str);
681
682 /// Verify an app name
683 inline bool valid_alias_name_string(const std::string& str) {
684 static const std::string badChars(std::string("\n") + '\0');
685 return (str.find_first_of(badChars) == std::string::npos);
686 }
687
688 /// check if a string is a container segment separator (empty or "%%")
689 inline bool is_separator(const std::string& str) {
690 static const std::string sep("%%");
691 return (str.empty() || str == sep);
692 }
693
694 /// Verify that str consists of letters only
695 inline bool isalpha(const std::string& str) {
696 return std::all_of(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char c) {
697 return std::isalpha(c, std::locale());
698 });
699 }
700
701 /// Return a lower case version of a string
702 inline std::string to_lower(std::string str) {
703 std::transform(std::begin(str), std::end(str), std::begin(str), [](const std::string::value_type& x) {
704 return std::tolower(x, std::locale());
705 });
706 return str;
707 }
708
709 /// remove underscores from a string
710 inline std::string remove_underscore(std::string str) {
711 str.erase(std::remove(std::begin(str), std::end(str), '_'), std::end(str));
712 return str;
713 }
714
715 /// Find and replace a substring with another substring
716 CLI11_INLINE std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to);
717
718 /// check if the flag definitions has possible false flags
719 inline bool has_default_flag_values(const std::string& flags) {
720 return (flags.find_first_of("{!") != std::string::npos);
721 }
722
723 CLI11_INLINE void remove_default_flag_values(std::string& flags);
724
725 /// Check if a string is a member of a list of strings and optionally ignore case or ignore underscores
726 CLI11_INLINE std::ptrdiff_t
727 find_member(std::string name, const std::vector<std::string> names, bool ignore_case = false, bool ignore_underscore = false);
728
729 /// Find a trigger string and call a modify callable function that takes the current string and starting position of the
730 /// trigger and returns the position in the string to search for the next trigger string
731 template <typename Callable>
732 inline std::string find_and_modify(std::string str, std::string trigger, Callable modify) {
733 std::size_t start_pos = 0;
734 while ((start_pos = str.find(trigger, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
735 start_pos = modify(str, start_pos);
736 }
737 return str;
738 }
739
740 /// Split a string '"one two" "three"' into 'one two', 'three'
741 /// Quote characters can be ` ' or "
742 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter = '\0');
743
744 /// This function detects an equal or colon followed by an escaped quote after an argument
745 /// then modifies the string to replace the equality with a space. This is needed
746 /// to allow the split up function to work properly and is intended to be used with the find_and_modify function
747 /// the return value is the offset+1 which is required by the find_and_modify function.
748 CLI11_INLINE std::size_t escape_detect(std::string& str, std::size_t offset);
749
750 /// Add quotes if the string contains spaces
751 CLI11_INLINE std::string& add_quotes_if_needed(std::string& str);
752
753 } // namespace detail
754
755 namespace detail {
756 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& s, char delim) {
757 std::vector<std::string> elems;
758 // Check to see if empty string, give consistent result
759 if (s.empty()) {
760 elems.emplace_back();
761 } else {
762 std::stringstream ss;
763 ss.str(s);
764 std::string item;
765 while (std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
766 elems.push_back(item);
767 }
768 }
769 return elems;
770 }
771
772 CLI11_INLINE std::string& ltrim(std::string& str) {
773 auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char ch) {
774 return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale());
775 });
776 str.erase(str.begin(), it);
777 return str;
778 }
779
780 CLI11_INLINE std::string& ltrim(std::string& str, const std::string& filter) {
781 auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [&filter](char ch) {
782 return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos;
783 });
784 str.erase(str.begin(), it);
785 return str;
786 }
787
788 CLI11_INLINE std::string& rtrim(std::string& str) {
789 auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [](char ch) {
790 return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale());
791 });
792 str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
793 return str;
794 }
795
796 CLI11_INLINE std::string& rtrim(std::string& str, const std::string& filter) {
797 auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [&filter](char ch) {
798 return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos;
799 });
800 str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
801 return str;
802 }
803
804 CLI11_INLINE std::string& remove_quotes(std::string& str) {
805 if (str.length() > 1 && (str.front() == '"' || str.front() == '\'')) {
806 if (str.front() == str.back()) {
807 str.pop_back();
808 str.erase(str.begin(), str.begin() + 1);
809 }
810 }
811 return str;
812 }
813
814 CLI11_INLINE std::string fix_newlines(const std::string& leader, std::string input) {
815 std::string::size_type n = 0;
816 while (n != std::string::npos && n < input.size()) {
817 n = input.find('\n', n);
818 if (n != std::string::npos) {
819 input = input.substr(0, n + 1) + leader + input.substr(n + 1);
820 n += leader.size();
821 }
822 }
823 return input;
824 }
825
826 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream& format_help(std::ostream& out, std::string name, const std::string& description, std::size_t wid) {
827 name = " " + name;
828 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << std::left << name;
829 if (!description.empty()) {
830 if (name.length() >= wid)
831 out << "\n" << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
832 for (const char c : description) {
833 out.put(c);
834 if (c == '\n') {
835 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
836 }
837 }
838 }
839 out << "\n";
840 return out;
841 }
842
843 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream& format_aliases(std::ostream& out, const std::vector<std::string>& aliases, std::size_t wid) {
844 if (!aliases.empty()) {
845 out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << " aliases: ";
846 bool front = true;
847 for (const auto& alias : aliases) {
848 if (!front) {
849 out << ", ";
850 } else {
851 front = false;
852 }
853 out << detail::fix_newlines(" ", alias);
854 }
855 out << "\n";
856 }
857 return out;
858 }
859
860 CLI11_INLINE bool valid_name_string(const std::string& str) {
861 if (str.empty() || !valid_first_char(str[0])) {
862 return false;
863 }
864 auto e = str.end();
865 for (auto c = str.begin() + 1; c != e; ++c)
866 if (!valid_later_char(*c))
867 return false;
868 return true;
869 }
870
871 CLI11_INLINE std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to) {
872 std::size_t start_pos = 0;
873
874 while ((start_pos = str.find(from, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
875 str.replace(start_pos, from.length(), to);
876 start_pos += to.length();
877 }
878
879 return str;
880 }
881
882 CLI11_INLINE void remove_default_flag_values(std::string& flags) {
883 auto loc = flags.find_first_of('{', 2);
884 while (loc != std::string::npos) {
885 auto finish = flags.find_first_of("},", loc + 1);
886 if ((finish != std::string::npos) && (flags[finish] == '}')) {
887 flags.erase(flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(loc), flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(finish) + 1);
888 }
889 loc = flags.find_first_of('{', loc + 1);
890 }
891 flags.erase(std::remove(flags.begin(), flags.end(), '!'), flags.end());
892 }
893
894 CLI11_INLINE std::ptrdiff_t
895 find_member(std::string name, const std::vector<std::string> names, bool ignore_case, bool ignore_underscore) {
896 auto it = std::end(names);
897 if (ignore_case) {
898 if (ignore_underscore) {
899 name = detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(name));
900 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
901 return detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(local_name)) == name;
902 });
903 } else {
904 name = detail::to_lower(name);
905 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
906 return detail::to_lower(local_name) == name;
907 });
908 }
909
910 } else if (ignore_underscore) {
911 name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
912 it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
913 return detail::remove_underscore(local_name) == name;
914 });
915 } else {
916 it = std::find(std::begin(names), std::end(names), name);
917 }
918
919 return (it != std::end(names)) ? (it - std::begin(names)) : (-1);
920 }
921
922 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter) {
923 const std::string delims("\'\"`");
924 auto find_ws = [delimiter](char ch) {
925 return (delimiter == '\0') ? std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()) : (ch == delimiter);
926 };
927 trim(str);
928
929 std::vector<std::string> output;
930 bool embeddedQuote = false;
931 char keyChar = ' ';
932 while (!str.empty()) {
933 if (delims.find_first_of(str[0]) != std::string::npos) {
934 keyChar = str[0];
935 auto end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
936 while ((end != std::string::npos) && (str[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
937 end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
938 embeddedQuote = true;
939 }
940 if (end != std::string::npos) {
941 output.push_back(str.substr(1, end - 1));
942 if (end + 2 < str.size()) {
943 str = str.substr(end + 2);
944 } else {
945 str.clear();
946 }
947
948 } else {
949 output.push_back(str.substr(1));
950 str = "";
951 }
952 } else {
953 auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(str), std::end(str), find_ws);
954 if (it != std::end(str)) {
955 std::string const value = std::string(str.begin(), it);
956 output.push_back(value);
957 str = std::string(it + 1, str.end());
958 } else {
959 output.push_back(str);
960 str = "";
961 }
962 }
963 // transform any embedded quotes into the regular character
964 if (embeddedQuote) {
965 output.back() = find_and_replace(output.back(), std::string("\\") + keyChar, std::string(1, keyChar));
966 embeddedQuote = false;
967 }
968 trim(str);
969 }
970 return output;
971 }
972
973 CLI11_INLINE std::size_t escape_detect(std::string& str, std::size_t offset) {
974 auto next = str[offset + 1];
975 if ((next == '\"') || (next == '\'') || (next == '`')) {
976 auto astart = str.find_last_of("-/ \"\'`", offset - 1);
977 if (astart != std::string::npos) {
978 if (str[astart] == ((str[offset] == '=') ? '-' : '/'))
979 str[offset] = ' '; // interpret this as a space so the split_up works properly
980 }
981 }
982 return offset + 1;
983 }
984
985 CLI11_INLINE std::string& add_quotes_if_needed(std::string& str) {
986 if ((str.front() != '"' && str.front() != '\'') || str.front() != str.back()) {
987 char const quote = str.find('"') < str.find('\'') ? '\'' : '"';
988 if (str.find(' ') != std::string::npos) {
989 str.insert(0, 1, quote);
990 str.append(1, quote);
991 }
992 }
993 return str;
994 }
995
996 } // namespace detail
997
998// Use one of these on all error classes.
999// These are temporary and are undef'd at the end of this file.
1000#define CLI11_ERROR_DEF(parent, name) protected
1001 :
1002 name(std::string ename, std::string msg, int exit_code)
1003 : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {
1004 }
1005 name(std::string ename, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code)
1006 : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {
1007 }
1008 public
1009 :
1010 name(std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code)
1011 : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {
1012 }
1013 name(std::string msg, int exit_code)
1014 : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {
1015 }
1016
1017// This is added after the one above if a class is used directly and builds its own message
1018#define CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(name)
1019 explicit name(std::string msg)
1020 : name(#name, msg, ExitCodes::name) {
1021 }
1022
1023 /// These codes are part of every error in CLI. They can be obtained from e using e.exit_code or as a quick shortcut,
1024 /// int values from e.get_error_code().
1025 enum class ExitCodes {
1026 Success = 0,
1027 IncorrectConstruction = 100,
1028 BadNameString,
1029 OptionAlreadyAdded,
1030 FileError,
1031 ConversionError,
1032 ValidationError,
1033 RequiredError,
1034 RequiresError,
1035 ExcludesError,
1036 ExtrasError,
1037 ConfigError,
1038 InvalidError,
1039 HorribleError,
1040 OptionNotFound,
1041 ArgumentMismatch,
1042 BaseClass = 127
1043 };
1044
1045 // Error definitions
1046
1047 /// @defgroup error_group Errors
1048 /// @brief Errors thrown by CLI11
1049 ///
1050 /// These are the errors that can be thrown. Some of them, like CLI::Success, are not really errors.
1051 /// @{
1052
1053 /// All errors derive from this one
1054 class Error : public std::runtime_error {
1055 int actual_exit_code;
1056 std::string error_name{"Error"};
1057
1058 public:
1059 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_exit_code() const {
1060 return actual_exit_code;
1061 }
1062
1063 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_name() const {
1064 return error_name;
1065 }
1066
1067 Error(std::string name, std::string msg, int exit_code = static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::BaseClass))
1068 : runtime_error(msg)
1069 , actual_exit_code(exit_code)
1070 , error_name(std::move(name)) {
1071 }
1072
1073 Error(std::string name, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code)
1074 : Error(name, msg, static_cast<int>(exit_code)) {
1075 }
1076 };
1077
1078 // Note: Using Error::Error constructors does not work on GCC 4.7
1079
1080 /// Construction errors (not in parsing)
1081 class ConstructionError : public Error {
1082 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ConstructionError)
1083 };
1084
1085 /// Thrown when an option is set to conflicting values (non-vector and multi args, for example)
1086 class IncorrectConstruction : public ConstructionError {
1087 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, IncorrectConstruction)
1088 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(IncorrectConstruction)
1089 static IncorrectConstruction PositionalFlag(std::string name) {
1090 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Flags cannot be positional");
1091 }
1092 static IncorrectConstruction Set0Opt(std::string name) {
1093 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set 0 expected, use a flag instead");
1094 }
1095 static IncorrectConstruction SetFlag(std::string name) {
1096 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set an expected number for flags");
1097 }
1098 static IncorrectConstruction ChangeNotVector(std::string name) {
1099 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": You can only change the expected arguments for vectors");
1100 }
1101 static IncorrectConstruction AfterMultiOpt(std::string name) {
1102 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": You can't change expected arguments after you've changed the multi option policy!");
1103 }
1104 static IncorrectConstruction MissingOption(std::string name) {
1105 return IncorrectConstruction("Option " + name + " is not defined");
1106 }
1107 static IncorrectConstruction MultiOptionPolicy(std::string name) {
1108 return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": multi_option_policy only works for flags and exact value options");
1109 }
1110 };
1111
1112 /// Thrown on construction of a bad name
1113 class BadNameString : public ConstructionError {
1114 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, BadNameString)
1115 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(BadNameString)
1116 static BadNameString OneCharName(std::string name) {
1117 return BadNameString("Invalid one char name: " + name);
1118 }
1119 static BadNameString BadLongName(std::string name) {
1120 return BadNameString("Bad long name: " + name);
1121 }
1122 static BadNameString DashesOnly(std::string name) {
1123 return BadNameString("Must have a name, not just dashes: " + name);
1124 }
1125 static BadNameString MultiPositionalNames(std::string name) {
1126 return BadNameString("Only one positional name allowed, remove: " + name);
1127 }
1128 };
1129
1130 /// Thrown when an option already exists
1131 class OptionAlreadyAdded : public ConstructionError {
1132 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, OptionAlreadyAdded)
1133 explicit OptionAlreadyAdded(std::string name)
1134 : OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " is already added", ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded) {
1135 }
1136 static OptionAlreadyAdded Requires(std::string name, std::string other) {
1137 return {name + " requires " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded};
1138 }
1139 static OptionAlreadyAdded Excludes(std::string name, std::string other) {
1140 return {name + " excludes " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded};
1141 }
1142 };
1143
1144 // Parsing errors
1145
1146 /// Anything that can error in Parse
1147 class ParseError : public Error {
1148 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ParseError)
1149 };
1150
1151 // Not really "errors"
1152
1153 /// This is a successful completion on parsing, supposed to exit
1154 class Success : public ParseError {
1155 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, Success)
1156 Success()
1157 : Success("Successfully completed, should be caught and quit", ExitCodes::Success) {
1158 }
1159 };
1160
1161 /// -h or --help on command line
1162 class CallForHelp : public Success {
1163 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForHelp)
1164 CallForHelp()
1165 : CallForHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {
1166 }
1167 };
1168
1169 /// Usually something like --help-all on command line
1170 class CallForAllHelp : public Success {
1171 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForAllHelp)
1172 CallForAllHelp()
1173 : CallForAllHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {
1174 }
1175 };
1176
1177 /// -v or --version on command line
1178 class CallForVersion : public Success {
1179 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForVersion)
1180 CallForVersion()
1181 : CallForVersion("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {
1182 }
1183 };
1184
1185 /// Does not output a diagnostic in CLI11_PARSE, but allows main() to return with a specific error code.
1186 class RuntimeError : public ParseError {
1187 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RuntimeError)
1188 explicit RuntimeError(int exit_code = 1)
1189 : RuntimeError("Runtime error", exit_code) {
1190 }
1191 };
1192
1193 /// Thrown when parsing an INI file and it is missing
1194 class FileError : public ParseError {
1195 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, FileError)
1196 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(FileError)
1197 static FileError Missing(std::string name) {
1198 return FileError(name + " was not readable (missing?)");
1199 }
1200 };
1201
1202 /// Thrown when conversion call back fails, such as when an int fails to coerce to a string
1203 class ConversionError : public ParseError {
1204 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConversionError)
1205 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConversionError)
1206 ConversionError(std::string member, std::string name)
1207 : ConversionError("The value " + member + " is not an allowed value for " + name) {
1208 }
1209 ConversionError(std::string name, std::vector<std::string> results)
1210 : ConversionError("Could not convert: " + name + " = " + detail::join(results)) {
1211 }
1212 static ConversionError TooManyInputsFlag(std::string name) {
1213 return ConversionError(name + ": too many inputs for a flag");
1214 }
1215 static ConversionError TrueFalse(std::string name) {
1216 return ConversionError(name + ": Should be true/false or a number");
1217 }
1218 };
1219
1220 /// Thrown when validation of results fails
1221 class ValidationError : public ParseError {
1222 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ValidationError)
1223 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ValidationError)
1224 explicit ValidationError(std::string name, std::string msg)
1225 : ValidationError(name + ": " + msg) {
1226 }
1227 };
1228
1229 /// Thrown when a required option is missing
1230 class RequiredError : public ParseError {
1231 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiredError)
1232 explicit RequiredError(std::string name)
1233 : RequiredError(name + " is required", ExitCodes::RequiredError) {
1234 }
1235 static RequiredError Subcommand(std::size_t min_subcom) {
1236 if (min_subcom == 1) {
1237 return RequiredError("A subcommand");
1238 }
1239 return {"Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_subcom) + " subcommands", ExitCodes::RequiredError};
1240 }
1241 static RequiredError Option(std::size_t min_option, std::size_t max_option, std::size_t used, const std::string& option_list) {
1242 if ((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used == 0))
1243 return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
1244 if ((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used > 1)) {
1245 return {"Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "] is required and " + std::to_string(used) + " were given",
1246 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
1247 }
1248 if ((min_option == 1) && (used == 0))
1249 return RequiredError("At least 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
1250 if (used < min_option) {
1251 return {"Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_option) + " options used and only " + std::to_string(used) +
1252 "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
1253 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
1254 }
1255 if (max_option == 1)
1256 return {"Requires at most 1 options be given from [" + option_list + "]", ExitCodes::RequiredError};
1257
1258 return {"Requires at most " + std::to_string(max_option) + " options be used and " + std::to_string(used) +
1259 "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
1260 ExitCodes::RequiredError};
1261 }
1262 };
1263
1264 /// Thrown when the wrong number of arguments has been received
1265 class ArgumentMismatch : public ParseError {
1266 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ArgumentMismatch)
1267 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ArgumentMismatch)
1268 ArgumentMismatch(std::string name, int expected, std::size_t received)
1269 : ArgumentMismatch(
1270 expected > 0
1271 ? ("Expected exactly " + std::to_string(expected) + " arguments to " + name + ", got " + std::to_string(received))
1272 : ("Expected at least " + std::to_string(-expected) + " arguments to " + name + ", got " + std::to_string(received)),
1273 ExitCodes::ArgumentMismatch) {
1274 }
1275
1276 static ArgumentMismatch AtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
1277 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At least " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " + std::to_string(received));
1278 }
1279 static ArgumentMismatch AtMost(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
1280 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At Most " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " + std::to_string(received));
1281 }
1282 static ArgumentMismatch TypedAtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
1283 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + std::to_string(num) + " required " + type + " missing");
1284 }
1285 static ArgumentMismatch FlagOverride(std::string name) {
1286 return ArgumentMismatch(name + " was given a disallowed flag override");
1287 }
1288 static ArgumentMismatch PartialType(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
1289 return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + type + " only partially specified: " + std::to_string(num) +
1290 " required for each element");
1291 }
1292 };
1293
1294 /// Thrown when a requires option is missing
1295 class RequiresError : public ParseError {
1296 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiresError)
1297 RequiresError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
1298 : RequiresError(curname + " requires " + subname, ExitCodes::RequiresError) {
1299 }
1300 };
1301
1302 /// Thrown when an excludes option is present
1303 class ExcludesError : public ParseError {
1304 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExcludesError)
1305 ExcludesError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
1306 : ExcludesError(curname + " excludes " + subname, ExitCodes::ExcludesError) {
1307 }
1308 };
1309
1310 /// Thrown when too many positionals or options are found
1311 class ExtrasError : public ParseError {
1312 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExtrasError)
1313 explicit ExtrasError(std::vector<std::string> args)
1314 : ExtrasError((args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: " : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
1315 detail::rjoin(args, " "),
1316 ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {
1317 }
1318 ExtrasError(const std::string& name, std::vector<std::string> args)
1319 : ExtrasError(name,
1320 (args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: " : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
1321 detail::rjoin(args, " "),
1322 ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {
1323 }
1324 };
1325
1326 /// Thrown when extra values are found in an INI file
1327 class ConfigError : public ParseError {
1328 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConfigError)
1329 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConfigError)
1330 static ConfigError Extras(std::string item) {
1331 return ConfigError("INI was not able to parse " + item);
1332 }
1333 static ConfigError NotConfigurable(std::string item) {
1334 return ConfigError(item + ": This option is not allowed in a configuration file");
1335 }
1336 };
1337
1338 /// Thrown when validation fails before parsing
1339 class InvalidError : public ParseError {
1340 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, InvalidError)
1341 explicit InvalidError(std::string name)
1342 : InvalidError(name + ": Too many positional arguments with unlimited expected args", ExitCodes::InvalidError) {
1343 }
1344 };
1345
1346 /// This is just a safety check to verify selection and parsing match - you should not ever see it
1347 /// Strings are directly added to this error, but again, it should never be seen.
1348 class HorribleError : public ParseError {
1349 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, HorribleError)
1350 CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(HorribleError)
1351 };
1352
1353 // After parsing
1354
1355 /// Thrown when counting a non-existent option
1356 class OptionNotFound : public Error {
1357 CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, OptionNotFound)
1358 explicit OptionNotFound(std::string name)
1359 : OptionNotFound(name + " not found", ExitCodes::OptionNotFound) {
1360 }
1361 };
1362
1363#undef CLI11_ERROR_DEF
1364#undef CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE
1365
1366 /// @}
1367
1368 // Type tools
1369
1370 // Utilities for type enabling
1371 namespace detail {
1372 // Based generally on https://rmf.io/cxx11/almost-static-if
1373 /// Simple empty scoped class
1374 enum class enabler {};
1375
1376 /// An instance to use in EnableIf
1377 constexpr enabler dummy = {};
1378 } // namespace detail
1379
1380 /// A copy of enable_if_t from C++14, compatible with C++11.
1381 ///
1382 /// We could check to see if C++14 is being used, but it does not hurt to redefine this
1383 /// (even Google does this: https://github.com/google/skia/blob/main/include/private/SkTLogic.h)
1384 /// It is not in the std namespace anyway, so no harm done.
1385 template <bool B, class T = void>
1386 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
1387
1388 /// A copy of std::void_t from C++17 (helper for C++11 and C++14)
1389 template <typename... Ts>
1390 struct make_void {
1391 using type = void;
1392 };
1393
1394 /// A copy of std::void_t from C++17 - same reasoning as enable_if_t, it does not hurt to redefine
1395 template <typename... Ts>
1396 using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
1397
1398 /// A copy of std::conditional_t from C++14 - same reasoning as enable_if_t, it does not hurt to redefine
1399 template <bool B, class T, class F>
1400 using conditional_t = typename std::conditional<B, T, F>::type;
1401
1402 /// Check to see if something is bool (fail check by default)
1403 template <typename T>
1404 struct is_bool : std::false_type {};
1405
1406 /// Check to see if something is bool (true if actually a bool)
1407 template <>
1408 struct is_bool<bool> : std::true_type {};
1409
1410 /// Check to see if something is a shared pointer
1411 template <typename T>
1412 struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
1413
1414 /// Check to see if something is a shared pointer (True if really a shared pointer)
1415 template <typename T>
1416 struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1417
1418 /// Check to see if something is a shared pointer (True if really a shared pointer)
1419 template <typename T>
1420 struct is_shared_ptr<const std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1421
1422 /// Check to see if something is copyable pointer
1423 template <typename T>
1424 struct is_copyable_ptr {
1425 static bool const value = is_shared_ptr<T>::value || std::is_pointer<T>::value;
1426 };
1427
1428 /// This can be specialized to override the type deduction for IsMember.
1429 template <typename T>
1430 struct IsMemberType {
1431 using type = T;
1432 };
1433
1434 /// The main custom type needed here is const char * should be a string.
1435 template <>
1436 struct IsMemberType<const char*> {
1437 using type = std::string;
1438 };
1439
1440 namespace detail {
1441
1442 // These are utilities for IsMember and other transforming objects
1443
1444 /// Handy helper to access the element_type generically. This is not part of is_copyable_ptr because it requires that
1445 /// pointer_traits<T> be valid.
1446
1447 /// not a pointer
1448 template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1449 struct element_type {
1450 using type = T;
1451 };
1452
1453 template <typename T>
1454 struct element_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_copyable_ptr<T>::value>::type> {
1455 using type = typename std::pointer_traits<T>::element_type;
1456 };
1457
1458 /// Combination of the element type and value type - remove pointer (including smart pointers) and get the value_type of
1459 /// the container
1460 template <typename T>
1461 struct element_value_type {
1462 using type = typename element_type<T>::type::value_type;
1463 };
1464
1465 /// Adaptor for set-like structure: This just wraps a normal container in a few utilities that do almost nothing.
1466 template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1467 struct pair_adaptor : std::false_type {
1468 using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1469 using first_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1470 using second_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1471
1472 /// Get the first value (really just the underlying value)
1473 template <typename Q>
1474 static auto first(Q&& pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1475 return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1476 }
1477 /// Get the second value (really just the underlying value)
1478 template <typename Q>
1479 static auto second(Q&& pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1480 return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1481 }
1482 };
1483
1484 /// Adaptor for map-like structure (true version, must have key_type and mapped_type).
1485 /// This wraps a mapped container in a few utilities access it in a general way.
1486 template <typename T>
1487 struct pair_adaptor<T, conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type::first_type, typename T::value_type::second_type>, void>>
1488 : std::true_type {
1489 using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1490 using first_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::first_type>::type;
1491 using second_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::second_type>::type;
1492
1493 /// Get the first value (really just the underlying value)
1494 template <typename Q>
1495 static auto first(Q&& pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1496 return std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1497 }
1498 /// Get the second value (really just the underlying value)
1499 template <typename Q>
1500 static auto second(Q&& pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1501 return std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1502 }
1503 };
1504
1505// Warning is suppressed due to "bug" in gcc<5.0 and gcc 7.0 with c++17 enabled that generates a Wnarrowing warning
1506// in the unevaluated context even if the function that was using this wasn't used. The standard says narrowing in
1507// brace initialization shouldn't be allowed but for backwards compatibility gcc allows it in some contexts. It is a
1508// little fuzzy what happens in template constructs and I think that was something GCC took a little while to work out.
1509// But regardless some versions of gcc generate a warning when they shouldn't from the following code so that should be
1510// suppressed
1511#ifdef __GNUC__
1512#pragma GCC diagnostic push
1513#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
1514#endif
1515 // check for constructibility from a specific type and copy assignable used in the parse detection
1516 template <typename T, typename C>
1517 class is_direct_constructible {
1518 template <typename TT, typename CC>
1519 static auto test(int, std::true_type) -> decltype(
1520// NVCC warns about narrowing conversions here
1521#ifdef __CUDACC__
1522#ifdef __NVCC_DIAG_PRAGMA_SUPPORT__
1523#pragma nv_diag_suppress 2361
1524#else
1525#pragma diag_suppress 2361
1526#endif
1527#endif
1528 TT{std::declval<CC>()}
1529#ifdef __CUDACC__
1530#ifdef __NVCC_DIAG_PRAGMA_SUPPORT__
1531#pragma nv_diag_default 2361
1532#else
1533#pragma diag_default 2361
1534#endif
1535#endif
1536 ,
1537 std::is_move_assignable<TT>());
1538
1539 template <typename TT, typename CC>
1540 static auto test(int, std::false_type) -> std::false_type;
1541
1542 template <typename, typename>
1543 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1544
1545 public:
1546 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, C>(0, typename std::is_constructible<T, C>::type()))::value;
1547 };
1548#ifdef __GNUC__
1549#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
1550#endif
1551
1552 // Check for output streamability
1553 // Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22758291/how-can-i-detect-if-a-type-can-be-streamed-to-an-stdostream
1554
1555 template <typename T, typename S = std::ostringstream>
1556 class is_ostreamable {
1557 template <typename TT, typename SS>
1558 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS&>() << std::declval<TT>(), std::true_type());
1559
1560 template <typename, typename>
1561 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1562
1563 public:
1564 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1565 };
1566
1567 /// Check for input streamability
1568 template <typename T, typename S = std::istringstream>
1569 class is_istreamable {
1570 template <typename TT, typename SS>
1571 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS&>() >> std::declval<TT&>(), std::true_type());
1572
1573 template <typename, typename>
1574 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1575
1576 public:
1577 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1578 };
1579
1580 /// Check for complex
1581 template <typename T>
1582 class is_complex {
1583 template <typename TT>
1584 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<TT>().real(), std::declval<TT>().imag(), std::true_type());
1585
1586 template <typename>
1587 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1588
1589 public:
1590 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T>(0))::value;
1591 };
1592
1593 /// Templated operation to get a value from a stream
1594 template <typename T, enable_if_t<is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1595 bool from_stream(const std::string& istring, T& obj) {
1596 std::istringstream is;
1597 is.str(istring);
1598 is >> obj;
1599 return !is.fail() && !is.rdbuf()->in_avail();
1600 }
1601
1602 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1603 bool from_stream(const std::string& /*istring*/, T& /*obj*/) {
1604 return false;
1605 }
1606
1607 // check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1608 template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1609 struct is_mutable_container : std::false_type {};
1610
1611 /// type trait to test if a type is a mutable container meaning it has a value_type, it has an iterator, a clear, and
1612 /// end methods and an insert function. And for our purposes we exclude std::string and types that can be constructed
1613 /// from a std::string
1614 template <typename T>
1615 struct is_mutable_container<
1616 T,
1617 conditional_t<false,
1618 void_t<typename T::value_type,
1619 decltype(std::declval<T>().end()),
1620 decltype(std::declval<T>().clear()),
1621 decltype(std::declval<T>().insert(std::declval<decltype(std::declval<T>().end())>(),
1622 std::declval<const typename T::value_type&>()))>,
1623 void>>
1624 : public conditional_t<std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value || std::is_constructible<T, std::wstring>::value,
1625 std::false_type,
1626 std::true_type> {};
1627
1628 // check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1629 template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1630 struct is_readable_container : std::false_type {};
1631
1632 /// type trait to test if a type is a container meaning it has a value_type, it has an iterator, a clear, and an end
1633 /// methods and an insert function. And for our purposes we exclude std::string and types that can be constructed from
1634 /// a std::string
1635 template <typename T>
1636 struct is_readable_container<
1637 T,
1638 conditional_t<false, void_t<decltype(std::declval<T>().end()), decltype(std::declval<T>().begin())>, void>>
1639 : public std::true_type {};
1640
1641 // check to see if an object is a wrapper (fail by default)
1642 template <typename T, typename _ = void>
1643 struct is_wrapper : std::false_type {};
1644
1645 // check if an object is a wrapper (it has a value_type defined)
1646 template <typename T>
1647 struct is_wrapper<T, conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type>, void>> : public std::true_type {};
1648
1649 // Check for tuple like types, as in classes with a tuple_size type trait
1650 template <typename S>
1651 class is_tuple_like {
1652 template <typename SS>
1653 // static auto test(int)
1654 // -> decltype(std::conditional<(std::tuple_size<SS>::value > 0), std::true_type, std::false_type>::type());
1655 static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::tuple_size<typename std::decay<SS>::type>::value, std::true_type{});
1656 template <typename>
1657 static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1658
1659 public:
1660 static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<S>(0))::value;
1661 };
1662
1663 /// Convert an object to a string (directly forward if this can become a string)
1664 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1665 auto to_string(T&& value) -> decltype(std::forward<T>(value)) {
1666 return std::forward<T>(value);
1667 }
1668
1669 /// Construct a string from the object
1670 template <typename T,
1671 enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value,
1672 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1673 std::string to_string(const T& value) {
1674 return std::string(value); // NOLINT(google-readability-casting)
1675 }
1676
1677 /// Convert an object to a string (streaming must be supported for that type)
1678 template <typename T,
1679 enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<std::string, T>::value && !std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1680 is_ostreamable<T>::value,
1681 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1682 std::string to_string(T&& value) {
1683 std::stringstream stream;
1684 stream << value;
1685 return stream.str();
1686 }
1687
1688 /// If conversion is not supported, return an empty string (streaming is not supported for that type)
1689 template <typename T,
1690 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1691 !is_readable_container<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::value,
1692 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1693 std::string to_string(T&&) {
1694 return {};
1695 }
1696
1697 /// convert a readable container to a string
1698 template <typename T,
1699 enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value && is_readable_container<T>::value,
1700 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1701 std::string to_string(T&& variable) {
1702 auto cval = variable.begin();
1703 auto end = variable.end();
1704 if (cval == end) {
1705 return {"{}"};
1706 }
1707 std::vector<std::string> defaults;
1708 while (cval != end) {
1709 defaults.emplace_back(CLI::detail::to_string(*cval));
1710 ++cval;
1711 }
1712 return {"[" + detail::join(defaults) + "]"};
1713 }
1714
1715 /// special template overload
1716 template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1717 auto checked_to_string(T&& value) -> decltype(to_string(std::forward<T>(value))) {
1718 return to_string(std::forward<T>(value));
1719 }
1720
1721 /// special template overload
1722 template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T, enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1723 std::string checked_to_string(T&&) {
1724 return std::string{};
1725 }
1726 /// get a string as a convertible value for arithmetic types
1727 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1728 std::string value_string(const T& value) {
1729 return std::to_string(value);
1730 }
1731 /// get a string as a convertible value for enumerations
1732 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1733 std::string value_string(const T& value) {
1734 return std::to_string(static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(value));
1735 }
1736 /// for other types just use the regular to_string function
1737 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!std::is_enum<T>::value && !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1738 auto value_string(const T& value) -> decltype(to_string(value)) {
1739 return to_string(value);
1740 }
1741
1742 /// template to get the underlying value type if it exists or use a default
1743 template <typename T, typename def, typename Enable = void>
1744 struct wrapped_type {
1745 using type = def;
1746 };
1747
1748 /// Type size for regular object types that do not look like a tuple
1749 template <typename T, typename def>
1750 struct wrapped_type<T, def, typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1751 using type = typename T::value_type;
1752 };
1753
1754 /// This will only trigger for actual void type
1755 template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1756 struct type_count_base {
1757 static const int value{0};
1758 };
1759
1760 /// Type size for regular object types that do not look like a tuple
1761 template <typename T>
1762 struct type_count_base<
1763 T,
1764 typename std::enable_if<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1765 static constexpr int value{1};
1766 };
1767
1768 /// the base tuple size
1769 template <typename T>
1770 struct type_count_base<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1771 static constexpr int value{std::tuple_size<T>::value};
1772 };
1773
1774 /// Type count base for containers is the type_count_base of the individual element
1775 template <typename T>
1776 struct type_count_base<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1777 static constexpr int value{type_count_base<typename T::value_type>::value};
1778 };
1779
1780 /// Set of overloads to get the type size of an object
1781
1782 /// forward declare the subtype_count structure
1783 template <typename T>
1784 struct subtype_count;
1785
1786 /// forward declare the subtype_count_min structure
1787 template <typename T>
1788 struct subtype_count_min;
1789
1790 /// This will only trigger for actual void type
1791 template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1792 struct type_count {
1793 static const int value{0};
1794 };
1795
1796 /// Type size for regular object types that do not look like a tuple
1797 template <typename T>
1798 struct type_count<T,
1799 typename std::enable_if<!is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1800 !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1801 static constexpr int value{1};
1802 };
1803
1804 /// Type size for complex since it sometimes looks like a wrapper
1805 template <typename T>
1806 struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1807 static constexpr int value{2};
1808 };
1809
1810 /// Type size of types that are wrappers,except complex and tuples(which can also be wrappers sometimes)
1811 template <typename T>
1812 struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1813 static constexpr int value{subtype_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1814 };
1815
1816 /// Type size of types that are wrappers,except containers complex and tuples(which can also be wrappers sometimes)
1817 template <typename T>
1818 struct type_count<T,
1819 typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1820 !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1821 static constexpr int value{type_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1822 };
1823
1824 /// 0 if the index > tuple size
1825 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1826 constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1827 return 0;
1828 }
1829
1830 /// Recursively generate the tuple type name
1831 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1832 constexpr typename std::enable_if < I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1833 return subtype_count<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value + tuple_type_size<T, I + 1>();
1834 }
1835
1836 /// Get the type size of the sum of type sizes for all the individual tuple types
1837 template <typename T>
1838 struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1839 static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size<T, 0>()};
1840 };
1841
1842 /// definition of subtype count
1843 template <typename T>
1844 struct subtype_count {
1845 static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container<T>::value ? expected_max_vector_size : type_count<T>::value};
1846 };
1847
1848 /// This will only trigger for actual void type
1849 template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1850 struct type_count_min {
1851 static const int value{0};
1852 };
1853
1854 /// Type size for regular object types that do not look like a tuple
1855 template <typename T>
1856 struct type_count_min<T,
1857 typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1858 !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1859 static constexpr int value{type_count<T>::value};
1860 };
1861
1862 /// Type size for complex since it sometimes looks like a wrapper
1863 template <typename T>
1864 struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1865 static constexpr int value{1};
1866 };
1867
1868 /// Type size min of types that are wrappers,except complex and tuples(which can also be wrappers sometimes)
1869 template <typename T>
1870 struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1871 static constexpr int value{subtype_count_min<typename T::value_type>::value};
1872 };
1873
1874 /// 0 if the index > tuple size
1875 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1876 constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1877 return 0;
1878 }
1879
1880 /// Recursively generate the tuple type name
1881 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1882 constexpr typename std::enable_if < I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1883 return subtype_count_min<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value + tuple_type_size_min<T, I + 1>();
1884 }
1885
1886 /// Get the type size of the sum of type sizes for all the individual tuple types
1887 template <typename T>
1888 struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1889 static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size_min<T, 0>()};
1890 };
1891
1892 /// definition of subtype count
1893 template <typename T>
1894 struct subtype_count_min {
1895 static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container<T>::value
1896 ? ((type_count<T>::value < expected_max_vector_size) ? type_count<T>::value : 0)
1897 : type_count_min<T>::value};
1898 };
1899
1900 /// This will only trigger for actual void type
1901 template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1902 struct expected_count {
1903 static const int value{0};
1904 };
1905
1906 /// For most types the number of expected items is 1
1907 template <typename T>
1908 struct expected_count<
1909 T,
1910 typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && !is_wrapper<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1911 static constexpr int value{1};
1912 };
1913 /// number of expected items in a vector
1914 template <typename T>
1915 struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1916 static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};
1917 };
1918
1919 /// number of expected items in a vector
1920 template <typename T>
1921 struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1922 static constexpr int value{expected_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1923 };
1924
1925 // Enumeration of the different supported categorizations of objects
1926 enum class object_category : int {
1927 char_value = 1,
1928 integral_value = 2,
1929 unsigned_integral = 4,
1930 enumeration = 6,
1931 boolean_value = 8,
1932 floating_point = 10,
1933 number_constructible = 12,
1934 double_constructible = 14,
1935 integer_constructible = 16,
1936 // string like types
1937 string_assignable = 23,
1938 string_constructible = 24,
1939 wstring_assignable = 25,
1940 wstring_constructible = 26,
1941 other = 45,
1942 // special wrapper or container types
1943 wrapper_value = 50,
1944 complex_number = 60,
1945 tuple_value = 70,
1946 container_value = 80,
1947
1948 };
1949
1950 /// Set of overloads to classify an object according to type
1951
1952 /// some type that is not otherwise recognized
1953 template <typename T, typename Enable = void>
1954 struct classify_object {
1955 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};
1956 };
1957
1958 /// Signed integers
1959 template <typename T>
1960 struct classify_object<T,
1961 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_same<T, char>::value &&
1962 std::is_signed<T>::value && !is_bool<T>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1963 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};
1964 };
1965
1966 /// Unsigned integers
1967 template <typename T>
1968 struct classify_object<T,
1969 typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value &&
1970 !std::is_same<T, char>::value && !is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1971 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};
1972 };
1973
1974 /// single character values
1975 template <typename T>
1976 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<T, char>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1977 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::char_value};
1978 };
1979
1980 /// Boolean values
1981 template <typename T>
1982 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1983 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};
1984 };
1985
1986 /// Floats
1987 template <typename T>
1988 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value>::type> {
1989 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};
1990 };
1991
1992 /// String and similar direct assignment
1993 template <typename T>
1994 struct classify_object<T,
1995 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1996 std::is_assignable<T&, std::string>::value>::type> {
1997 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};
1998 };
1999
2000 /// String and similar constructible and copy assignment
2001 template <typename T>
2002 struct classify_object<T,
2003 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
2004 !std::is_assignable<T&, std::string>::value && (type_count<T>::value == 1) &&
2005 std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value>::type> {
2006 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_constructible};
2007 };
2008
2009 /// Wide strings
2010 template <typename T>
2011 struct classify_object<
2012 T,
2013 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
2014 !std::is_assignable<T&, std::string>::value && !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value &&
2015 std::is_assignable<T&, std::wstring>::value>::type> {
2016 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wstring_assignable};
2017 };
2018
2019 template <typename T>
2020 struct classify_object<
2021 T,
2022 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
2023 !std::is_assignable<T&, std::string>::value && !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value &&
2024 !std::is_assignable<T&, std::wstring>::value && (type_count<T>::value == 1) &&
2025 std::is_constructible<T, std::wstring>::value>::type> {
2026 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wstring_constructible};
2027 };
2028
2029 /// Enumerations
2030 template <typename T>
2031 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
2032 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};
2033 };
2034
2035 template <typename T>
2036 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
2037 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::complex_number};
2038 };
2039
2040 /// Handy helper to contain a bunch of checks that rule out many common types (integers, string like, floating point,
2041 /// vectors, and enumerations
2042 template <typename T>
2043 struct uncommon_type {
2044 using type = typename std::conditional<
2045 !std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_assignable<T&, std::string>::value &&
2046 !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !std::is_assignable<T&, std::wstring>::value &&
2047 !std::is_constructible<T, std::wstring>::value && !is_complex<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
2048 !std::is_enum<T>::value,
2049 std::true_type,
2050 std::false_type>::type;
2051 static constexpr bool value = type::value;
2052 };
2053
2054 /// wrapper type
2055 template <typename T>
2056 struct classify_object<T,
2057 typename std::enable_if<(!is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value &&
2058 !is_tuple_like<T>::value && uncommon_type<T>::value)>::type> {
2059 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wrapper_value};
2060 };
2061
2062 /// Assignable from double or int
2063 template <typename T>
2064 struct classify_object<
2065 T,
2066 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 && !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
2067 is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
2068 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::number_constructible};
2069 };
2070
2071 /// Assignable from int
2072 template <typename T>
2073 struct classify_object<
2074 T,
2075 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 && !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
2076 !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
2077 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integer_constructible};
2078 };
2079
2080 /// Assignable from double
2081 template <typename T>
2082 struct classify_object<
2083 T,
2084 typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 && !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
2085 is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value && !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
2086 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::double_constructible};
2087 };
2088
2089 /// Tuple type
2090 template <typename T>
2091 struct classify_object<
2092 T,
2093 typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value && ((type_count<T>::value >= 2 && !is_wrapper<T>::value) ||
2094 (uncommon_type<T>::value && !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
2095 !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value) ||
2096 (uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value >= 2))>::type> {
2097 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};
2098 // the condition on this class requires it be like a tuple, but on some compilers (like Xcode) tuples can be
2099 // constructed from just the first element so tuples of <string, int,int> can be constructed from a string, which
2100 // could lead to issues so there are two variants of the condition, the first isolates things with a type size >=2
2101 // mainly to get tuples on Xcode with the exception of wrappers, the second is the main one and just separating out
2102 // those cases that are caught by other object classifications
2103 };
2104
2105 /// container type
2106 template <typename T>
2107 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
2108 static constexpr object_category value{object_category::container_value};
2109 };
2110
2111 // Type name print
2112
2113 /// Was going to be based on
2114 /// http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1055452/c-get-name-of-type-in-template
2115 /// But this is cleaner and works better in this case
2116
2117 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2118 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2119 return "CHAR";
2120 }
2121
2122 template <typename T,
2123 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
2124 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible,
2125 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2126 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2127 return "INT";
2128 }
2129
2130 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2131 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2132 return "UINT";
2133 }
2134
2135 template <typename T,
2136 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point ||
2137 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible ||
2138 classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible,
2139 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2140 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2141 return "FLOAT";
2142 }
2143
2144 /// Print name for enumeration types
2145 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2146 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2147 return "ENUM";
2148 }
2149
2150 /// Print name for enumeration types
2151 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2152 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2153 return "BOOLEAN";
2154 }
2155
2156 /// Print name for enumeration types
2157 template <typename T, enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::complex_number, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2158 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2159 return "COMPLEX";
2160 }
2161
2162 /// Print for all other types
2163 template <typename T,
2164 enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value >= object_category::string_assignable &&
2165 classify_object<T>::value <= object_category::other,
2166 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2167 constexpr const char* type_name() {
2168 return "TEXT";
2169 }
