4271 newval._merge_description(*this, other, " OR ");
4272
4273 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
4274 const std::function<std::string(std::string&)>& f1 = func_;
4275 const std::function<std::string(std::string&)>& f2 = other.func_;
4276
4277 newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string& input) {
4278 std::string const s1 = f1(input);
4279 std::string const s2 = f2(input);
4280 if (s1.empty() || s2.empty())
4281 return std::string();
4282
4283 return std::string("(") + s1 + ") OR (" + s2 + ")";
4284 };
4285 newval.active_ = active_ && other.active_;
4286 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
4287 return newval;
4288 }
4289
4290 CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator!() const {
4291 Validator newval;
4292 const std::function<std::string()>& dfunc1 = desc_function_;
4293 newval.desc_function_ = [dfunc1]() {
4294 auto str = dfunc1();
4295 return (!str.empty()) ? std::string("NOT ") + str : std::string{};
4296 };
4297 // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
4298 const std::function<std::string(std::string & res)>& f1 = func_;
4299
4300 newval.func_ = [f1, dfunc1](std::string& test) -> std::string {
4301 std::string const s1 = f1(test);
4302 if (s1.empty()) {
4303 return std::string("check ") + dfunc1() + " succeeded improperly";
4304 }
4305 return std::string{};
4306 };
4307 newval.active_ = active_;
4308 newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
4309 return newval;
4310 }
4311
4312 CLI11_INLINE void Validator::_merge_description(const Validator& val1, const Validator& val2, const std::string& merger) {
4313 const std::function<std::string()>& dfunc1 = val1.desc_function_;
4314 const std::function<std::string()>& dfunc2 = val2.desc_function_;
4315
4316 desc_function_ = [=]() {
4317 std::string const f1 = dfunc1();
4318 std::string const f2 = dfunc2();
4319 if ((f1.empty()) || (f2.empty())) {
4320 return f1 + f2;
4321 }
4322 return std::string(1, '(') + f1 + ')' + merger + '(' + f2 + ')';
4323 };
4324 }
4325
4326 namespace detail {
4327
4328#if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
4329 CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char* file) noexcept {
4330 std::error_code ec;
4331 auto stat = std::filesystem::status(to_path(file), ec);
4332 if (ec) {
4333 return path_type::nonexistent;
4334 }
4335 switch (stat.type()) {
4336 case std::filesystem::file_type::none: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
4337 case std::filesystem::file_type::not_found:
4338 return path_type::nonexistent;
4339 case std::filesystem::file_type::directory:
4340 return path_type::directory;
4341 case std::filesystem::file_type::symlink:
4342 case std::filesystem::file_type::block:
4343 case std::filesystem::file_type::character:
4344 case std::filesystem::file_type::fifo:
4345 case std::filesystem::file_type::socket:
4346 case std::filesystem::file_type::regular:
4347 case std::filesystem::file_type::unknown:
4348 default:
4349 return path_type::file;
4350 }
4351 }
4352#else
4353 CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char* file) noexcept {
4354#if defined(_MSC_VER)
4355 struct __stat64 buffer;
4356 if (_stat64(file, &buffer) == 0) {
4357 return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
4358 }
4359#else
4360 struct stat buffer;
4361 if (stat(file, &buffer) == 0) {
4362 return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
4363 }
4364#endif
4365 return path_type::nonexistent;
4366 }
4367#endif
4368
4369 CLI11_INLINE ExistingFileValidator::ExistingFileValidator()
4370 : Validator("FILE") {
4371 func_ = [](std::string& filename) {
4372 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4373 if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
4374 return "File does not exist: " + filename;
4375 }
4376 if (path_result == path_type::directory) {
4377 return "File is actually a directory: " + filename;
4378 }
4379 return std::string();
4380 };
4381 }
4382
4383 CLI11_INLINE ExistingDirectoryValidator::ExistingDirectoryValidator()
4384 : Validator("DIR") {
4385 func_ = [](std::string& filename) {
4386 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4387 if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
4388 return "Directory does not exist: " + filename;
4389 }
4390 if (path_result == path_type::file) {
4391 return "Directory is actually a file: " + filename;
4392 }
4393 return std::string();
4394 };
4395 }
4396
4397 CLI11_INLINE ExistingPathValidator::ExistingPathValidator()
4398 : Validator("PATH(existing)") {
4399 func_ = [](std::string& filename) {
4400 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4401 if (path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
4402 return "Path does not exist: " + filename;
4403 }
4404 return std::string();
4405 };
4406 }
4407
4408 CLI11_INLINE NonexistentPathValidator::NonexistentPathValidator()
4409 : Validator("PATH(non-existing)") {
4410 func_ = [](std::string& filename) {
4411 auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
4412 if (path_result != path_type::nonexistent) {
4413 return "Path already exists: " + filename;
4414 }
4415 return std::string();
4416 };
4417 }
4418
4419 CLI11_INLINE IPV4Validator::IPV4Validator()
4420 : Validator("IPV4") {
4421 func_ = [](std::string& ip_addr) {
4422 auto result = CLI::detail::split(ip_addr, '.');
4423 if (result.size() != 4) {
4424 return std::string("Invalid IPV4 address must have four parts (") + ip_addr + ')';
4425 }
4426 int num = 0;
4427 for (const auto& var : result) {
4428 using CLI::detail::lexical_cast;
4429 bool const retval = lexical_cast(var, num);
4430 if (!retval) {
4431 return std::string("Failed parsing number (") + var + ')';
4432 }
4433 if (num < 0 || num > 255) {
4434 return std::string("Each IP number must be between 0 and 255 ") + var;
4435 }
4436 }
4437 return std::string();
4438 };
4439 }
4440
4441 } // namespace detail
4442
4443 CLI11_INLINE FileOnDefaultPath::FileOnDefaultPath(std::string default_path, bool enableErrorReturn)
4444 : Validator("FILE") {
4445 func_ = [default_path, enableErrorReturn](std::string& filename) {
4446 auto path_result = detail::check_path(filename.c_str());
4447 if (path_result == detail::path_type::nonexistent) {
4448 std::string test_file_path = default_path;
4449 if (default_path.back() != '/' && default_path.back() != '\\') {
4450 // Add folder separator
4451 test_file_path += '/';
4452 }
4453 test_file_path.append(filename);
4454 path_result = detail::check_path(test_file_path.c_str());
4455 if (path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
4456 filename = test_file_path;
4457 } else {
4458 if (enableErrorReturn) {
4459 return "File does not exist: " + filename;
4460 }
4461 }
4462 }
4463 return std::string{};
4464 };
4465 }
4466
4467 CLI11_INLINE AsSizeValue::AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000)
4468 : AsNumberWithUnit(get_mapping(kb_is_1000)) {
4469 if (kb_is_1000) {
4470 description("SIZE [b, kb(=1000b), kib(=1024b), ...]");
4471 } else {
4472 description("SIZE [b, kb(=1024b), ...]");
4473 }
4474 }
4475
4476 CLI11_INLINE std::map<std::string, AsSizeValue::result_t> AsSizeValue::init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
4477 std::map<std::string, result_t> m;
4478 result_t const k_factor = kb_is_1000 ? 1000 : 1024;
4479 result_t const ki_factor = 1024;
4480 result_t k = 1;
4481 result_t ki = 1;
4482 m["b"] = 1;
4483 for (std::string const p : {"k", "m", "g", "t", "p", "e"}) {
4484 k *= k_factor;
4485 ki *= ki_factor;
4486 m[p] = k;
4487 m[p + "b"] = k;
4488 m[p + "i"] = ki;
4489 m[p + "ib"] = ki;
4490 }
4491 return m;
4492 }
4493
4494 CLI11_INLINE std::map<std::string, AsSizeValue::result_t> AsSizeValue::get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
4495 if (kb_is_1000) {
4496 static auto m = init_mapping(true);
4497 return m;
4498 }
4499 static auto m = init_mapping(false);
4500 return m;
4501 }
4502
4503 namespace detail {
4504
4505 CLI11_INLINE std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline) {
4506 // try to determine the programName
4507 std::pair<std::string, std::string> vals;
4508 trim(commandline);
4509 auto esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4510 while (detail::check_path(commandline.substr(0, esp).c_str()) != path_type::file) {
4511 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', esp + 1);
4512 if (esp == std::string::npos) {
4513 // if we have reached the end and haven't found a valid file just assume the first argument is the
4514 // program name
4515 if (commandline[0] == '"' || commandline[0] == '\'' || commandline[0] == '`') {
4516 bool embeddedQuote = false;
4517 auto keyChar = commandline[0];
4518 auto end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
4519 while ((end != std::string::npos) && (commandline[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
4520 end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
4521 embeddedQuote = true;
4522 }
4523 if (end != std::string::npos) {
4524 vals.first = commandline.substr(1, end - 1);
4525 esp = end + 1;
4526 if (embeddedQuote) {
4527 vals.first = find_and_replace(vals.first, std::string("\\") + keyChar, std::string(1, keyChar));
4528 }
4529 } else {
4530 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4531 }
4532 } else {
4533 esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
4534 }
4535
4536 break;
4537 }
4538 }
4539 if (vals.first.empty()) {
4540 vals.first = commandline.substr(0, esp);
4541 rtrim(vals.first);
4542 }
4543
4544 // strip the program name
4545 vals.second = (esp < commandline.length() - 1) ? commandline.substr(esp + 1) : std::string{};
4546 ltrim(vals.second);
4547 return vals;
4548 }
4549
4550 } // namespace detail
4551 /// @}
4552
4553 class Option;
4554 class App;
4555
4556 /// This enum signifies the type of help requested
4557 ///
4558 /// This is passed in by App; all user classes must accept this as
4559 /// the second argument.
4560
4561 enum class AppFormatMode {
4562 Normal, ///< The normal, detailed help
4563 All, ///< A fully expanded help
4564 Sub, ///< Used when printed as part of expanded subcommand
4565 };
4566
4567 /// This is the minimum requirements to run a formatter.
4568 ///
4569 /// A user can subclass this is if they do not care at all
4570 /// about the structure in CLI::Formatter.
4571 class FormatterBase {
4572 protected:
4573 /// @name Options
4574 ///@{
4575
4576 /// The width of the first column
4577 std::size_t column_width_{30};
4578
4579 /// @brief The required help printout labels (user changeable)
4580 /// Values are Needs, Excludes, etc.
4581 std::map<std::string, std::string> labels_{};
4582
4583 ///@}
4584 /// @name Basic
4585 ///@{
4586
4587 public:
4588 FormatterBase() = default;
4589 FormatterBase(const FormatterBase&) = default;
4590 FormatterBase(FormatterBase&&) = default;
4591 FormatterBase& operator=(const FormatterBase&) = default;
4592 FormatterBase& operator=(FormatterBase&&) = default;
4593
4594 /// Adding a destructor in this form to work around bug in GCC 4.7
4595 virtual ~FormatterBase() noexcept {
4596 } // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4597
4598 /// This is the key method that puts together help
4599 virtual std::string make_help(const App*, std::string, AppFormatMode) const = 0;
4600
4601 ///@}
4602 /// @name Setters
4603 ///@{
4604
4605 /// Set the "REQUIRED" label
4606 void label(std::string key, std::string val) {
4607 labels_[key] = val;
4608 }
4609
4610 /// Set the column width
4611 void column_width(std::size_t val) {
4612 column_width_ = val;
4613 }
4614
4615 ///@}
4616 /// @name Getters
4617 ///@{
4618
4619 /// Get the current value of a name (REQUIRED, etc.)
4620 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_label(std::string key) const {
4621 if (labels_.find(key) == labels_.end())
4622 return key;
4623 return labels_.at(key);
4624 }
4625
4626 /// Get the current column width
4627 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_column_width() const {
4628 return column_width_;
4629 }
4630
4631 ///@}
4632 };
4633
4634 /// This is a specialty override for lambda functions
4635 class FormatterLambda final : public FormatterBase {
4636 using funct_t = std::function<std::string(const App*, std::string, AppFormatMode)>;
4637
4638 /// The lambda to hold and run
4639 funct_t lambda_;
4640
4641 public:
4642 /// Create a FormatterLambda with a lambda function
4643 explicit FormatterLambda(funct_t funct)
4644 : lambda_(std::move(funct)) {
4645 }
4646
4647 /// Adding a destructor (mostly to make GCC 4.7 happy)
4648 ~FormatterLambda() noexcept override {
4649 } // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4650
4651 /// This will simply call the lambda function
4652 std::string make_help(const App* app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const override {
4653 return lambda_(app, name, mode);
4654 }
4655 };
4656
4657 /// This is the default Formatter for CLI11. It pretty prints help output, and is broken into quite a few
4658 /// overridable methods, to be highly customizable with minimal effort.
4659 class Formatter : public FormatterBase {
4660 public:
4661 Formatter() = default;
4662 Formatter(const Formatter&) = default;
4663 Formatter(Formatter&&) = default;
4664 Formatter& operator=(const Formatter&) = default;
4665 Formatter& operator=(Formatter&&) = default;
4666
4667 /// @name Overridables
4668 ///@{
4669
4670 /// This prints out a group of options with title
4671 ///
4672 CLI11_NODISCARD virtual std::string make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option*> opts) const;
4673
4674 /// This prints out just the positionals "group"
4675 virtual std::string make_positionals(const App* app) const;
4676
4677 /// This prints out all the groups of options
4678 std::string make_groups(const App* app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4679
4680 /// This prints out all the subcommands
4681 virtual std::string make_subcommands(const App* app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4682
4683 /// This prints out a subcommand
4684 virtual std::string make_subcommand(const App* sub) const;
4685
4686 /// This prints out a subcommand in help-all
4687 virtual std::string make_expanded(const App* sub) const;
4688
4689 /// This prints out all the groups of options
4690 virtual std::string make_footer(const App* app) const;
4691
4692 /// This displays the description line
4693 virtual std::string make_description(const App* app) const;
4694
4695 /// This displays the usage line
4696 virtual std::string make_usage(const App* app, std::string name) const;
4697
4698 /// This puts everything together
4699 std::string make_help(const App* /*app*/, std::string, AppFormatMode) const override;
4700
4701 ///@}
4702 /// @name Options
4703 ///@{
4704
4705 /// This prints out an option help line, either positional or optional form
4706 virtual std::string make_option(const Option* opt, bool is_positional) const {
4707 std::stringstream out;
4708 detail::format_help(out, make_option_name(opt, is_positional) + make_option_opts(opt), make_option_desc(opt), column_width_);
4709 return out.str();
4710 }
4711
4712 /// @brief This is the name part of an option, Default: left column
4713 virtual std::string make_option_name(const Option*, bool) const;
4714
4715 /// @brief This is the options part of the name, Default: combined into left column
4716 virtual std::string make_option_opts(const Option*) const;
4717
4718 /// @brief This is the description. Default: Right column, on new line if left column too large
4719 virtual std::string make_option_desc(const Option*) const;
4720
4721 /// @brief This is used to print the name on the USAGE line
4722 virtual std::string make_option_usage(const Option* opt) const;
4723
4724 ///@}
4725 };
4726
4727 using results_t = std::vector<std::string>;
4728 /// callback function definition
4729 using callback_t = std::function<bool(const results_t&)>;
4730
4731 class Option;
4732 class App;
4733
4734 using Option_p = std::unique_ptr<Option>;
4735 /// Enumeration of the multiOption Policy selection
4736 enum class MultiOptionPolicy : char {
4737 Throw, //!< Throw an error if any extra arguments were given
4738 TakeLast, //!< take only the last Expected number of arguments
4739 TakeFirst, //!< take only the first Expected number of arguments
4740 Join, //!< merge all the arguments together into a single string via the delimiter character default('\n')
4741 TakeAll, //!< just get all the passed argument regardless
4742 Sum //!< sum all the arguments together if numerical or concatenate directly without delimiter
4743 };
4744
4745 /// This is the CRTP base class for Option and OptionDefaults. It was designed this way
4746 /// to share parts of the class; an OptionDefaults can copy to an Option.
4747 template <typename CRTP>
4748 class OptionBase {
4749 friend App;
4750
4751 protected:
4752 /// The group membership
4753 std::string group_ = std::string("Options");
4754
4755 /// True if this is a required option
4756 bool required_{false};
4757
4758 /// Ignore the case when matching (option, not value)
4759 bool ignore_case_{false};
4760
4761 /// Ignore underscores when matching (option, not value)
4762 bool ignore_underscore_{false};
4763
4764 /// Allow this option to be given in a configuration file
4765 bool configurable_{true};
4766
4767 /// Disable overriding flag values with '=value'
4768 bool disable_flag_override_{false};
4769
4770 /// Specify a delimiter character for vector arguments
4771 char delimiter_{'\0'};
4772
4773 /// Automatically capture default value
4774 bool always_capture_default_{false};
4775
4776 /// Policy for handling multiple arguments beyond the expected Max
4777 MultiOptionPolicy multi_option_policy_{MultiOptionPolicy::Throw};
4778
4779 /// Copy the contents to another similar class (one based on OptionBase)
4780 template <typename T>
4781 void copy_to(T* other) const;
4782
4783 public:
4784 // setters
4785
4786 /// Changes the group membership
4787 CRTP* group(const std::string& name) {
4788 if (!detail::valid_alias_name_string(name)) {
4789 throw IncorrectConstruction("Group names may not contain newlines or null characters");
4790 }
4791 group_ = name;
4792 return static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4793 }
4794
4795 /// Set the option as required
4796 CRTP* required(bool value = true) {
4797 required_ = value;
4798 return static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4799 }
4800
4801 /// Support Plumbum term
4802 CRTP* mandatory(bool value = true) {
4803 return required(value);
4804 }
4805
4806 CRTP* always_capture_default(bool value = true) {
4807 always_capture_default_ = value;
4808 return static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4809 }
4810
4811 // Getters
4812
4813 /// Get the group of this option
4814 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& get_group() const {
4815 return group_;
4816 }
4817
4818 /// True if this is a required option
4819 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_required() const {
4820 return required_;
4821 }
4822
4823 /// The status of ignore case
4824 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_ignore_case() const {
4825 return ignore_case_;
4826 }
4827
4828 /// The status of ignore_underscore
4829 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_ignore_underscore() const {
4830 return ignore_underscore_;
4831 }
4832
4833 /// The status of configurable
4834 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_configurable() const {
4835 return configurable_;
4836 }
4837
4838 /// The status of configurable
4839 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_disable_flag_override() const {
4840 return disable_flag_override_;
4841 }
4842
4843 /// Get the current delimiter char
4844 CLI11_NODISCARD char get_delimiter() const {
4845 return delimiter_;
4846 }
4847
4848 /// Return true if this will automatically capture the default value for help printing
4849 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_always_capture_default() const {
4850 return always_capture_default_;
4851 }
4852
4853 /// The status of the multi option policy
4854 CLI11_NODISCARD MultiOptionPolicy get_multi_option_policy() const {
4855 return multi_option_policy_;
4856 }
4857
4858 // Shortcuts for multi option policy
4859
4860 /// Set the multi option policy to take last
4861 CRTP* take_last() {
4862 auto* self = static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4863 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
4864 return self;
4865 }
4866
4867 /// Set the multi option policy to take last
4868 CRTP* take_first() {
4869 auto* self = static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4870 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst);
4871 return self;
4872 }
4873
4874 /// Set the multi option policy to take all arguments
4875 CRTP* take_all() {
4876 auto self = static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4877 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll);
4878 return self;
4879 }
4880
4881 /// Set the multi option policy to join
4882 CRTP* join() {
4883 auto* self = static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4884 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
4885 return self;
4886 }
4887
4888 /// Set the multi option policy to join with a specific delimiter
4889 CRTP* join(char delim) {
4890 auto self = static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4891 self->delimiter_ = delim;
4892 self->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Join);
4893 return self;
4894 }
4895
4896 /// Allow in a configuration file
4897 CRTP* configurable(bool value = true) {
4898 configurable_ = value;
4899 return static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4900 }
4901
4902 /// Allow in a configuration file
4903 CRTP* delimiter(char value = '\0') {
4904 delimiter_ = value;
4905 return static_cast<CRTP*>(this);
4906 }
4907 };
4908
4909 /// This is a version of OptionBase that only supports setting values,
4910 /// for defaults. It is stored as the default option in an App.
4911 class OptionDefaults : public OptionBase<OptionDefaults> {
4912 public:
4913 OptionDefaults() = default;
4914
4915 // Methods here need a different implementation if they are Option vs. OptionDefault
4916
4917 /// Take the last argument if given multiple times
4918 OptionDefaults* multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw) {
4919 multi_option_policy_ = value;
4920 return this;
4921 }
4922
4923 /// Ignore the case of the option name
4924 OptionDefaults* ignore_case(bool value = true) {
4925 ignore_case_ = value;
4926 return this;
4927 }
4928
4929 /// Ignore underscores in the option name
4930 OptionDefaults* ignore_underscore(bool value = true) {
4931 ignore_underscore_ = value;
4932 return this;
4933 }
4934
4935 /// Disable overriding flag values with an '=<value>' segment
4936 OptionDefaults* disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
4937 disable_flag_override_ = value;
4938 return this;
4939 }
4940
4941 /// set a delimiter character to split up single arguments to treat as multiple inputs
4942 OptionDefaults* delimiter(char value = '\0') {
4943 delimiter_ = value;
4944 return this;
4945 }
4946 };
4947
4948 class Option : public OptionBase<Option> {
4949 friend App;
4950
4951 protected:
4952 /// @name Names
4953 ///@{
4954
4955 /// A list of the short names (`-a`) without the leading dashes
4956 std::vector<std::string> snames_{};
4957
4958 /// A list of the long names (`--long`) without the leading dashes
4959 std::vector<std::string> lnames_{};
4960
4961 /// A list of the flag names with the appropriate default value, the first part of the pair should be duplicates of
4962 /// what is in snames or lnames but will trigger a particular response on a flag
4963 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> default_flag_values_{};
4964
4965 /// a list of flag names with specified default values;
4966 std::vector<std::string> fnames_{};
4967
4968 /// A positional name
4969 std::string pname_{};
4970
4971 /// If given, check the environment for this option
4972 std::string envname_{};
4973
4974 ///@}
4975 /// @name Help
4976 ///@{
4977
4978 /// The description for help strings
4979 std::string description_{};
4980
4981 /// A human readable default value, either manually set, captured, or captured by default
4982 std::string default_str_{};
4983
4984 /// If given, replace the text that describes the option type and usage in the help text
4985 std::string option_text_{};
4986
4987 /// A human readable type value, set when App creates this
4988 ///
4989 /// This is a lambda function so "types" can be dynamic, such as when a set prints its contents.
4990 std::function<std::string()> type_name_{[]() {
4991 return std::string();
4992 }};
4993
4994 /// Run this function to capture a default (ignore if empty)
4995 std::function<std::string()> default_function_{};
4996
4997 ///@}
4998 /// @name Configuration
4999 ///@{
5000
5001 /// The number of arguments that make up one option. max is the nominal type size, min is the minimum number of
5002 /// strings
5003 int type_size_max_{1};
5004 /// The minimum number of arguments an option should be expecting
5005 int type_size_min_{1};
5006
5007 /// The minimum number of expected values
5008 int expected_min_{1};
5009 /// The maximum number of expected values
5010 int expected_max_{1};
5011
5012 /// A list of Validators to run on each value parsed
5013 std::vector<Validator> validators_{};
5014
5015 /// A list of options that are required with this option
5016 std::set<Option*> needs_{};
5017
5018 /// A list of options that are excluded with this option
5019 std::set<Option*> excludes_{};
5020
5021 ///@}
5022 /// @name Other
5023 ///@{
5024
5025 /// link back up to the parent App for fallthrough
5026 App* parent_{nullptr};
5027
5028 /// Options store a callback to do all the work
5029 callback_t callback_{};
5030
5031 ///@}
5032 /// @name Parsing results
5033 ///@{
5034
5035 /// complete Results of parsing
5036 results_t results_{};
5037 /// results after reduction
5038 results_t proc_results_{};
5039 /// enumeration for the option state machine
5040 enum class option_state : char {
5041 parsing = 0, //!< The option is currently collecting parsed results
5042 validated = 2, //!< the results have been validated
5043 reduced = 4, //!< a subset of results has been generated
5044 callback_run = 6, //!< the callback has been executed
5045 };
5046 /// Whether the callback has run (needed for INI parsing)
5047 option_state current_option_state_{option_state::parsing};
5048 /// Specify that extra args beyond type_size_max should be allowed
5049 bool allow_extra_args_{false};
5050 /// Specify that the option should act like a flag vs regular option
5051 bool flag_like_{false};
5052 /// Control option to run the callback to set the default
5053 bool run_callback_for_default_{false};
5054 /// flag indicating a separator needs to be injected after each argument call
5055 bool inject_separator_{false};
5056 /// flag indicating that the option should trigger the validation and callback chain on each result when loaded
5057 bool trigger_on_result_{false};
5058 /// flag indicating that the option should force the callback regardless if any results present
5059 bool force_callback_{false};
5060 ///@}
5061
5062 /// Making an option by hand is not defined, it must be made by the App class
5063 Option(std::string option_name, std::string option_description, callback_t callback, App* parent)
5064 : description_(std::move(option_description))
5065 , parent_(parent)
5066 , callback_(std::move(callback)) {
5067 std::tie(snames_, lnames_, pname_) = detail::get_names(detail::split_names(option_name));
5068 }
5069
5070 public:
5071 /// @name Basic
5072 ///@{
5073
5074 Option(const Option&) = delete;
5075 Option& operator=(const Option&) = delete;
5076
5077 /// Count the total number of times an option was passed
5078 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t count() const {
5079 return results_.size();
5080 }
5081
5082 /// True if the option was not passed
5083 CLI11_NODISCARD bool empty() const {
5084 return results_.empty();
5085 }
5086
5087 /// This bool operator returns true if any arguments were passed or the option callback is forced
5088 explicit operator bool() const {
5089 return !empty() || force_callback_;
5090 }
5091
5092 /// Clear the parsed results (mostly for testing)
5093 void clear() {
5094 results_.clear();
5095 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5096 }
5097
5098 ///@}
5099 /// @name Setting options
5100 ///@{
5101
5102 /// Set the number of expected arguments
5103 Option* expected(int value);
5104
5105 /// Set the range of expected arguments
5106 Option* expected(int value_min, int value_max);
5107
5108 /// Set the value of allow_extra_args which allows extra value arguments on the flag or option to be included
5109 /// with each instance
5110 Option* allow_extra_args(bool value = true) {
5111 allow_extra_args_ = value;
5112 return this;
5113 }
5114 /// Get the current value of allow extra args
5115 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_allow_extra_args() const {
5116 return allow_extra_args_;
5117 }
5118 /// Set the value of trigger_on_parse which specifies that the option callback should be triggered on every parse
5119 Option* trigger_on_parse(bool value = true) {
5120 trigger_on_result_ = value;
5121 return this;
5122 }
5123 /// The status of trigger on parse
5124 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_trigger_on_parse() const {
5125 return trigger_on_result_;
5126 }
5127
5128 /// Set the value of force_callback
5129 Option* force_callback(bool value = true) {
5130 force_callback_ = value;
5131 return this;
5132 }
5133 /// The status of force_callback
5134 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_force_callback() const {
5135 return force_callback_;
5136 }
5137
5138 /// Set the value of run_callback_for_default which controls whether the callback function should be called to set
5139 /// the default This is controlled automatically but could be manipulated by the user.
5140 Option* run_callback_for_default(bool value = true) {
5141 run_callback_for_default_ = value;
5142 return this;
5143 }
5144 /// Get the current value of run_callback_for_default
5145 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_run_callback_for_default() const {
5146 return run_callback_for_default_;
5147 }
5148
5149 /// Adds a Validator with a built in type name
5150 Option* check(Validator validator, const std::string& validator_name = "");
5151
5152 /// Adds a Validator. Takes a const string& and returns an error message (empty if conversion/check is okay).
5153 Option* check(std::function<std::string(const std::string&)> Validator,
5154 std::string Validator_description = "",
5155 std::string Validator_name = "");
5156
5157 /// Adds a transforming Validator with a built in type name
5158 Option* transform(Validator Validator, const std::string& Validator_name = "");
5159
5160 /// Adds a Validator-like function that can change result
5161 Option* transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)>& func,
5162 std::string transform_description = "",
5163 std::string transform_name = "");
5164
5165 /// Adds a user supplied function to run on each item passed in (communicate though lambda capture)
5166 Option* each(const std::function<void(std::string)>& func);
5167
5168 /// Get a named Validator
5169 Validator* get_validator(const std::string& Validator_name = "");
5170
5171 /// Get a Validator by index NOTE: this may not be the order of definition
5172 Validator* get_validator(int index);
5173
5174 /// Sets required options
5175 Option* needs(Option* opt) {
5176 if (opt != this) {
5177 needs_.insert(opt);
5178 }
5179 return this;
5180 }
5181
5182 /// Can find a string if needed
5183 template <typename T = App>
5184 Option* needs(std::string opt_name) {
5185 auto opt = static_cast<T*>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
5186 if (opt == nullptr) {
5187 throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
5188 }
5189 return needs(opt);
5190 }
5191
5192 /// Any number supported, any mix of string and Opt
5193 template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG>
5194 Option* needs(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
5195 needs(opt);
5196 return needs(opt1, args...); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
5197 }
5198
5199 /// Remove needs link from an option. Returns true if the option really was in the needs list.
5200 bool remove_needs(Option* opt);
5201
5202 /// Sets excluded options
5203 Option* excludes(Option* opt);
5204
5205 /// Can find a string if needed
5206 template <typename T = App>
5207 Option* excludes(std::string opt_name) {
5208 auto opt = static_cast<T*>(parent_)->get_option_no_throw(opt_name);
5209 if (opt == nullptr) {
5210 throw IncorrectConstruction::MissingOption(opt_name);
5211 }
5212 return excludes(opt);
5213 }
5214
5215 /// Any number supported, any mix of string and Opt
5216 template <typename A, typename B, typename... ARG>
5217 Option* excludes(A opt, B opt1, ARG... args) {
5218 excludes(opt);
5219 return excludes(opt1, args...);
5220 }
5221
5222 /// Remove needs link from an option. Returns true if the option really was in the needs list.
5223 bool remove_excludes(Option* opt);
5224
5225 /// Sets environment variable to read if no option given
5226 Option* envname(std::string name) {
5227 envname_ = std::move(name);
5228 return this;
5229 }
5230
5231 /// Ignore case
5232 ///
5233 /// The template hides the fact that we don't have the definition of App yet.
5234 /// You are never expected to add an argument to the template here.
5235 template <typename T = App>
5236 Option* ignore_case(bool value = true);
5237
5238 /// Ignore underscores in the option names
5239 ///
5240 /// The template hides the fact that we don't have the definition of App yet.
5241 /// You are never expected to add an argument to the template here.
5242 template <typename T = App>
5243 Option* ignore_underscore(bool value = true);
5244
5245 /// Take the last argument if given multiple times (or another policy)
5246 Option* multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value = MultiOptionPolicy::Throw);
5247
5248 /// Disable flag overrides values, e.g. --flag=<value> is not allowed
5249 Option* disable_flag_override(bool value = true) {
5250 disable_flag_override_ = value;
5251 return this;
5252 }
5253 ///@}
5254 /// @name Accessors
5255 ///@{
5256
5257 /// The number of arguments the option expects
5258 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_type_size() const {
5259 return type_size_min_;
5260 }
5261
5262 /// The minimum number of arguments the option expects
5263 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_type_size_min() const {
5264 return type_size_min_;
5265 }
5266 /// The maximum number of arguments the option expects
5267 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_type_size_max() const {
5268 return type_size_max_;
5269 }
5270
5271 /// Return the inject_separator flag
5272 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_inject_separator() const {
5273 return inject_separator_;
5274 }
5275
5276 /// The environment variable associated to this value
5277 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_envname() const {
5278 return envname_;
5279 }
5280
5281 /// The set of options needed
5282 CLI11_NODISCARD std::set<Option*> get_needs() const {
5283 return needs_;
5284 }
5285
5286 /// The set of options excluded
5287 CLI11_NODISCARD std::set<Option*> get_excludes() const {
5288 return excludes_;
5289 }
5290
5291 /// The default value (for help printing)
5292 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_default_str() const {
5293 return default_str_;
5294 }
5295
5296 /// Get the callback function
5297 CLI11_NODISCARD callback_t get_callback() const {
5298 return callback_;
5299 }
5300
5301 /// Get the long names
5302 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string>& get_lnames() const {
5303 return lnames_;
5304 }
5305
5306 /// Get the short names
5307 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string>& get_snames() const {
5308 return snames_;
5309 }
5310
5311 /// Get the flag names with specified default values
5312 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string>& get_fnames() const {
5313 return fnames_;
5314 }
5315 /// Get a single name for the option, first of lname, pname, sname, envname
5316 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& get_single_name() const {
5317 if (!lnames_.empty()) {
5318 return lnames_[0];
5319 }
5320 if (!pname_.empty()) {
5321 return pname_;
5322 }
5323 if (!snames_.empty()) {
5324 return snames_[0];
5325 }
5326 return envname_;
5327 }
5328 /// The number of times the option expects to be included
5329 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_expected() const {
5330 return expected_min_;
5331 }
5332
5333 /// The number of times the option expects to be included
5334 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_expected_min() const {
5335 return expected_min_;
5336 }
5337 /// The max number of times the option expects to be included
5338 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_expected_max() const {
5339 return expected_max_;
5340 }
5341
5342 /// The total min number of expected string values to be used
5343 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_items_expected_min() const {
5344 return type_size_min_ * expected_min_;
5345 }
5346
5347 /// Get the maximum number of items expected to be returned and used for the callback
5348 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_items_expected_max() const {
5349 int t = type_size_max_;
5350 return detail::checked_multiply(t, expected_max_) ? t : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5351 }
5352 /// The total min number of expected string values to be used
5353 CLI11_NODISCARD int get_items_expected() const {
5354 return get_items_expected_min();
5355 }
5356
5357 /// True if the argument can be given directly
5358 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_positional() const {
5359 return pname_.length() > 0;
5360 }
5361
5362 /// True if option has at least one non-positional name
5363 CLI11_NODISCARD bool nonpositional() const {
5364 return (snames_.size() + lnames_.size()) > 0;
5365 }
5366
5367 /// True if option has description
5368 CLI11_NODISCARD bool has_description() const {
5369 return description_.length() > 0;
5370 }
5371
5372 /// Get the description
5373 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& get_description() const {
5374 return description_;
5375 }
5376
5377 /// Set the description
5378 Option* description(std::string option_description) {
5379 description_ = std::move(option_description);
5380 return this;
5381 }
5382
5383 Option* option_text(std::string text) {
5384 option_text_ = std::move(text);
5385 return this;
5386 }
5387
5388 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& get_option_text() const {
5389 return option_text_;
5390 }
5391
5392 ///@}
5393 /// @name Help tools
5394 ///@{
5395
5396 /// \brief Gets a comma separated list of names.
5397 /// Will include / prefer the positional name if positional is true.
5398 /// If all_options is false, pick just the most descriptive name to show.
5399 /// Use `get_name(true)` to get the positional name (replaces `get_pname`)
5400 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_name(bool positional = false, ///< Show the positional name
5401 bool all_options = false ///< Show every option
5402 ) const;
5403
5404 ///@}
5405 /// @name Parser tools
5406 ///@{
5407
5408 /// Process the callback
5409 void run_callback();
5410
5411 /// If options share any of the same names, find it
5412 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& matching_name(const Option& other) const;
5413
5414 /// If options share any of the same names, they are equal (not counting positional)
5415 bool operator==(const Option& other) const {
5416 return !matching_name(other).empty();
5417 }
5418
5419 /// Check a name. Requires "-" or "--" for short / long, supports positional name
5420 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_name(const std::string& name) const;
5421
5422 /// Requires "-" to be removed from string
5423 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_sname(std::string name) const {
5424 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), snames_, ignore_case_) >= 0);
5425 }
5426
5427 /// Requires "--" to be removed from string
5428 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_lname(std::string name) const {
5429 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), lnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
5430 }
5431
5432 /// Requires "--" to be removed from string
5433 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_fname(std::string name) const {
5434 if (fnames_.empty()) {
5435 return false;
5436 }
5437 return (detail::find_member(std::move(name), fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_) >= 0);
5438 }
5439
5440 /// Get the value that goes for a flag, nominally gets the default value but allows for overrides if not
5441 /// disabled
5442 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_flag_value(const std::string& name, std::string input_value) const;
5443
5444 /// Puts a result at the end
5445 Option* add_result(std::string s);
5446
5447 /// Puts a result at the end and get a count of the number of arguments actually added
5448 Option* add_result(std::string s, int& results_added);
5449
5450 /// Puts a result at the end
5451 Option* add_result(std::vector<std::string> s);
5452
5453 /// Get the current complete results set
5454 CLI11_NODISCARD const results_t& results() const {
5455 return results_;
5456 }
5457
5458 /// Get a copy of the results
5459 CLI11_NODISCARD results_t reduced_results() const;
5460
5461 /// Get the results as a specified type
5462 template <typename T>
5463 void results(T& output) const {
5464 bool retval = false;
5465 if (current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced || (results_.size() == 1 && validators_.empty())) {
5466 const results_t& res = (proc_results_.empty()) ? results_ : proc_results_;
5467 retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
5468 } else {
5469 results_t res;
5470 if (results_.empty()) {
5471 if (!default_str_.empty()) {
5472 // _add_results takes an rvalue only
5473 _add_result(std::string(default_str_), res);
5474 _validate_results(res);
5475 results_t extra;
5476 _reduce_results(extra, res);
5477 if (!extra.empty()) {
5478 res = std::move(extra);
5479 }
5480 } else {
5481 res.emplace_back();
5482 }
5483 } else {
5484 res = reduced_results();
5485 }
5486 retval = detail::lexical_conversion<T, T>(res, output);
5487 }
5488 if (!retval) {
5489 throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
5490 }
5491 }
5492
5493 /// Return the results as the specified type
5494 template <typename T>
5495 CLI11_NODISCARD T as() const {
5496 T output;
5497 results(output);
5498 return output;
5499 }
5500
5501 /// See if the callback has been run already
5502 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_callback_run() const {
5503 return (current_option_state_ == option_state::callback_run);
5504 }
5505
5506 ///@}
5507 /// @name Custom options
5508 ///@{
5509
5510 /// Set the type function to run when displayed on this option
5511 Option* type_name_fn(std::function<std::string()> typefun) {
5512 type_name_ = std::move(typefun);
5513 return this;
5514 }
5515
5516 /// Set a custom option typestring
5517 Option* type_name(std::string typeval) {
5518 type_name_fn([typeval]() {
5519 return typeval;
5520 });
5521 return this;
5522 }
5523
5524 /// Set a custom option size
5525 Option* type_size(int option_type_size);
5526
5527 /// Set a custom option type size range
5528 Option* type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max);
5529
5530 /// Set the value of the separator injection flag
5531 void inject_separator(bool value = true) {
5532 inject_separator_ = value;
5533 }
5534
5535 /// Set a capture function for the default. Mostly used by App.
5536 Option* default_function(const std::function<std::string()>& func) {
5537 default_function_ = func;
5538 return this;
5539 }
5540
5541 /// Capture the default value from the original value (if it can be captured)
5542 Option* capture_default_str() {
5543 if (default_function_) {
5544 default_str_ = default_function_();
5545 }
5546 return this;
5547 }
5548
5549 /// Set the default value string representation (does not change the contained value)
5550 Option* default_str(std::string val) {
5551 default_str_ = std::move(val);
5552 return this;
5553 }
5554
5555 /// Set the default value and validate the results and run the callback if appropriate to set the value into the
5556 /// bound value only available for types that can be converted to a string
5557 template <typename X>
5558 Option* default_val(const X& val) {
5559 std::string val_str = detail::to_string(val);
5560 auto old_option_state = current_option_state_;
5561 results_t old_results{std::move(results_)};
5562 results_.clear();
5563 try {
5564 add_result(val_str);
5565 // if trigger_on_result_ is set the callback already ran
5566 if (run_callback_for_default_ && !trigger_on_result_) {
5567 run_callback(); // run callback sets the state, we need to reset it again
5568 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5569 } else {
5570 _validate_results(results_);
5571 current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
5572 }
5573 } catch (const CLI::Error&) {
5574 // this should be done
5575 results_ = std::move(old_results);
5576 current_option_state_ = old_option_state;
5577 throw;
5578 }
5579 results_ = std::move(old_results);
5580 default_str_ = std::move(val_str);
5581 return this;
5582 }
5583
5584 /// Get the full typename for this option
5585 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_type_name() const;
5586
5587 private:
5588 /// Run the results through the Validators
5589 void _validate_results(results_t& res) const;
5590
5591 /** reduce the results in accordance with the MultiOptionPolicy
5592 @param[out] out results are assigned to res if there if they are different
5593 */
5594 void _reduce_results(results_t& out, const results_t& original) const;
5595
5596 // Run a result through the Validators
5597 std::string _validate(std::string& result, int index) const;
5598
5599 /// Add a single result to the result set, taking into account delimiters
5600 int _add_result(std::string&& result, std::vector<std::string>& res) const;
5601 };
5602
5603 template <typename CRTP>
5604 template <typename T>
5605 void OptionBase<CRTP>::copy_to(T* other) const {
5606 other->group(group_);
5607 other->required(required_);
5608 other->ignore_case(ignore_case_);
5609 other->ignore_underscore(ignore_underscore_);
5610 other->configurable(configurable_);
5611 other->disable_flag_override(disable_flag_override_);
5612 other->delimiter(delimiter_);
5613 other->always_capture_default(always_capture_default_);
5614 other->multi_option_policy(multi_option_policy_);
5615 }
5616
5617 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::expected(int value) {
5618 if (value < 0) {
5619 expected_min_ = -value;
5620 if (expected_max_ < expected_min_) {
5621 expected_max_ = expected_min_;
5622 }
5623 allow_extra_args_ = true;
5624 flag_like_ = false;
5625 } else if (value == detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
5626 expected_min_ = 1;
5627 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5628 allow_extra_args_ = true;
5629 flag_like_ = false;
5630 } else {
5631 expected_min_ = value;
5632 expected_max_ = value;
5633 flag_like_ = (expected_min_ == 0);
5634 }
5635 return this;
5636 }
5637
5638 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::expected(int value_min, int value_max) {
5639 if (value_min < 0) {
5640 value_min = -value_min;
5641 }
5642
5643 if (value_max < 0) {
5644 value_max = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
5645 }
5646 if (value_max < value_min) {
5647 expected_min_ = value_max;
5648 expected_max_ = value_min;
5649 } else {
5650 expected_max_ = value_max;
5651 expected_min_ = value_min;
5652 }
5653
5654 return this;
5655 }
5656
5657 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::check(Validator validator, const std::string& validator_name) {
5658 validator.non_modifying();
5659 validators_.push_back(std::move(validator));
5660 if (!validator_name.empty())
5661 validators_.back().name(validator_name);
5662 return this;
5663 }
5664
5665 CLI11_INLINE Option*
5666 Option::check(std::function<std::string(const std::string&)> Validator, std::string Validator_description, std::string Validator_name) {
5667 validators_.emplace_back(Validator, std::move(Validator_description), std::move(Validator_name));
5668 validators_.back().non_modifying();
5669 return this;
5670 }
5671
5672 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::transform(Validator Validator, const std::string& Validator_name) {
5673 validators_.insert(validators_.begin(), std::move(Validator));
5674 if (!Validator_name.empty())
5675 validators_.front().name(Validator_name);
5676 return this;
5677 }
5678
5679 CLI11_INLINE Option*
5680 Option::transform(const std::function<std::string(std::string)>& func, std::string transform_description, std::string transform_name) {
5681 validators_.insert(validators_.begin(),
5682 Validator(
5683 [func](std::string& val) {
5684 val = func(val);
5685 return std::string{};
5686 },
5687 std::move(transform_description),
5688 std::move(transform_name)));
5689
5690 return this;
5691 }
5692
5693 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::each(const std::function<void(std::string)>& func) {
5694 validators_.emplace_back(
5695 [func](std::string& inout) {
5696 func(inout);
5697 return std::string{};
5698 },
5699 std::string{});
5700 return this;
5701 }
5702
5703 CLI11_INLINE Validator* Option::get_validator(const std::string& Validator_name) {
5704 for (auto& Validator : validators_) {
5705 if (Validator_name == Validator.get_name()) {
5706 return &Validator;
5707 }
5708 }
5709 if ((Validator_name.empty()) && (!validators_.empty())) {
5710 return &(validators_.front());
5711 }
5712 throw OptionNotFound(std::string{"Validator "} + Validator_name + " Not Found");
5713 }
5714
5715 CLI11_INLINE Validator* Option::get_validator(int index) {
5716 // This is an signed int so that it is not equivalent to a pointer.
5717 if (index >= 0 && index < static_cast<int>(validators_.size())) {
5718 return &(validators_[static_cast<decltype(validators_)::size_type>(index)]);
5719 }
5720 throw OptionNotFound("Validator index is not valid");
5721 }
5722
5723 CLI11_INLINE bool Option::remove_needs(Option* opt) {
5724 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(needs_), std::end(needs_), opt);
5725
5726 if (iterator == std::end(needs_)) {
5727 return false;
5728 }
5729 needs_.erase(iterator);
5730 return true;
5731 }
5732
5733 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::excludes(Option* opt) {
5734 if (opt == this) {
5735 throw(IncorrectConstruction("and option cannot exclude itself"));
5736 }
5737 excludes_.insert(opt);
5738
5739 // Help text should be symmetric - excluding a should exclude b
5740 opt->excludes_.insert(this);
5741
5742 // Ignoring the insert return value, excluding twice is now allowed.
5743 // (Mostly to allow both directions to be excluded by user, even though the library does it for you.)
5744
5745 return this;
5746 }
5747
5748 CLI11_INLINE bool Option::remove_excludes(Option* opt) {
5749 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(excludes_), std::end(excludes_), opt);
5750
5751 if (iterator == std::end(excludes_)) {
5752 return false;
5753 }
5754 excludes_.erase(iterator);
5755 return true;
5756 }
5757
5758 template <typename T>
5759 Option* Option::ignore_case(bool value) {
5760 if (!ignore_case_ && value) {
5761 ignore_case_ = value;
5762 auto* parent = static_cast<T*>(parent_);
5763 for (const Option_p& opt : parent->options_) {
5764 if (opt.get() == this) {
5765 continue;
5766 }
5767 const auto& omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
5768 if (!omatch.empty()) {
5769 ignore_case_ = false;
5770 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore case caused a name conflict with " + omatch);
5771 }
5772 }
5773 } else {
5774 ignore_case_ = value;
5775 }
5776 return this;
5777 }
5778
5779 template <typename T>
5780 Option* Option::ignore_underscore(bool value) {
5781 if (!ignore_underscore_ && value) {
5782 ignore_underscore_ = value;
5783 auto* parent = static_cast<T*>(parent_);
5784 for (const Option_p& opt : parent->options_) {
5785 if (opt.get() == this) {
5786 continue;
5787 }
5788 const auto& omatch = opt->matching_name(*this);
5789 if (!omatch.empty()) {
5790 ignore_underscore_ = false;
5791 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("adding ignore underscore caused a name conflict with " + omatch);
5792 }
5793 }
5794 } else {
5795 ignore_underscore_ = value;
5796 }
5797 return this;
5798 }
5799
5800 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy value) {
5801 if (value != multi_option_policy_) {
5802 if (multi_option_policy_ == MultiOptionPolicy::Throw && expected_max_ == detail::expected_max_vector_size &&
5803 expected_min_ > 1) { // this bizarre condition is to maintain backwards compatibility
5804 // with the previous behavior of expected_ with vectors
5805 expected_max_ = expected_min_;
5806 }
5807 multi_option_policy_ = value;
5808 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5809 }
5810 return this;
5811 }
5812
5813 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::get_name(bool positional, bool all_options) const {
5814 if (get_group().empty())
5815 return {}; // Hidden
5816
5817 if (all_options) {
5818 std::vector<std::string> name_list;
5819
5820 /// The all list will never include a positional unless asked or that's the only name.
5821 if ((positional && (!pname_.empty())) || (snames_.empty() && lnames_.empty())) {
5822 name_list.push_back(pname_);
5823 }
5824 if ((get_items_expected() == 0) && (!fnames_.empty())) {
5825 for (const std::string& sname : snames_) {
5826 name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
5827 if (check_fname(sname)) {
5828 name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(sname, "") + "}";
5829 }
5830 }
5831
5832 for (const std::string& lname : lnames_) {
5833 name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
5834 if (check_fname(lname)) {
5835 name_list.back() += "{" + get_flag_value(lname, "") + "}";
5836 }
5837 }
5838 } else {
5839 for (const std::string& sname : snames_)
5840 name_list.push_back("-" + sname);
5841
5842 for (const std::string& lname : lnames_)
5843 name_list.push_back("--" + lname);
5844 }
5845
5846 return detail::join(name_list);
5847 }
5848
5849 // This returns the positional name no matter what
5850 if (positional)
5851 return pname_;
5852
5853 // Prefer long name
5854 if (!lnames_.empty())
5855 return std::string(2, '-') + lnames_[0];
5856
5857 // Or short name if no long name
5858 if (!snames_.empty())
5859 return std::string(1, '-') + snames_[0];
5860
5861 // If positional is the only name, it's okay to use that
5862 return pname_;
5863 }
5864
5865 CLI11_INLINE void Option::run_callback() {
5866 if (force_callback_ && results_.empty()) {
5867 add_result(default_str_);
5868 }
5869 if (current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
5870 _validate_results(results_);
5871 current_option_state_ = option_state::validated;
5872 }
5873
5874 if (current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
5875 _reduce_results(proc_results_, results_);
5876 current_option_state_ = option_state::reduced;
5877 }
5878 if (current_option_state_ >= option_state::reduced) {
5879 current_option_state_ = option_state::callback_run;
5880 if (!(callback_)) {
5881 return;
5882 }
5883 const results_t& send_results = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
5884 bool const local_result = callback_(send_results);
5885
5886 if (!local_result)
5887 throw ConversionError(get_name(), results_);
5888 }
5889 }
5890
5891 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const std::string& Option::matching_name(const Option& other) const {
5892 static const std::string estring;
5893 for (const std::string& sname : snames_)
5894 if (other.check_sname(sname))
5895 return sname;
5896 for (const std::string& lname : lnames_)
5897 if (other.check_lname(lname))
5898 return lname;
5899
5900 if (ignore_case_ || ignore_underscore_) { // We need to do the inverse, in case we are ignore_case or ignore underscore
5901 for (const std::string& sname : other.snames_)
5902 if (check_sname(sname))
5903 return sname;
5904 for (const std::string& lname : other.lnames_)
5905 if (check_lname(lname))
5906 return lname;
5907 }
5908 return estring;
5909 }
5910
5911 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool Option::check_name(const std::string& name) const {
5912 if (name.length() > 2 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] == '-')
5913 return check_lname(name.substr(2));
5914 if (name.length() > 1 && name.front() == '-')
5915 return check_sname(name.substr(1));
5916 if (!pname_.empty()) {
5917 std::string local_pname = pname_;
5918 std::string local_name = name;
5919 if (ignore_underscore_) {
5920 local_pname = detail::remove_underscore(local_pname);
5921 local_name = detail::remove_underscore(local_name);
5922 }
5923 if (ignore_case_) {
5924 local_pname = detail::to_lower(local_pname);
5925 local_name = detail::to_lower(local_name);
5926 }
5927 if (local_name == local_pname) {
5928 return true;
5929 }
5930 }
5931
5932 if (!envname_.empty()) {
5933 // this needs to be the original since envname_ shouldn't match on case insensitivity
5934 return (name == envname_);
5935 }
5936 return false;
5937 }
5938
5939 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::get_flag_value(const std::string& name, std::string input_value) const {
5940 static const std::string trueString{"true"};
5941 static const std::string falseString{"false"};
5942 static const std::string emptyString{"{}"};
5943 // check for disable flag override_
5944 if (disable_flag_override_) {
5945 if (!((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString))) {
5946 auto default_ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
5947 if (default_ind >= 0) {
5948 // We can static cast this to std::size_t because it is more than 0 in this block
5949 if (default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(default_ind)].second != input_value) {
5950 throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
5951 }
5952 } else {
5953 if (input_value != trueString) {
5954 throw(ArgumentMismatch::FlagOverride(name));
5955 }
5956 }
5957 }
5958 }
5959 auto ind = detail::find_member(name, fnames_, ignore_case_, ignore_underscore_);
5960 if ((input_value.empty()) || (input_value == emptyString)) {
5961 if (flag_like_) {
5962 return (ind < 0) ? trueString : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
5963 }
5964 return (ind < 0) ? default_str_ : default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second;
5965 }
5966 if (ind < 0) {
5967 return input_value;
5968 }
5969 if (default_flag_values_[static_cast<std::size_t>(ind)].second == falseString) {
5970 try {
5971 auto val = detail::to_flag_value(input_value);
5972 return (val == 1) ? falseString : (val == (-1) ? trueString : std::to_string(-val));
5973 } catch (const std::invalid_argument&) {
5974 return input_value;
5975 }
5976 } else {
5977 return input_value;
5978 }
5979 }
5980
5981 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::add_result(std::string s) {
5982 _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
5983 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5984 return this;
5985 }
5986
5987 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::add_result(std::string s, int& results_added) {
5988 results_added = _add_result(std::move(s), results_);
5989 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5990 return this;
5991 }
5992
5993 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::add_result(std::vector<std::string> s) {
5994 current_option_state_ = option_state::parsing;
5995 for (auto& str : s) {
5996 _add_result(std::move(str), results_);
5997 }
5998 return this;
5999 }
6000
6001 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE results_t Option::reduced_results() const {
6002 results_t res = proc_results_.empty() ? results_ : proc_results_;
6003 if (current_option_state_ < option_state::reduced) {
6004 if (current_option_state_ == option_state::parsing) {
6005 res = results_;
6006 _validate_results(res);
6007 }
6008 if (!res.empty()) {
6009 results_t extra;
6010 _reduce_results(extra, res);
6011 if (!extra.empty()) {
6012 res = std::move(extra);
6013 }
6014 }
6015 }
6016 return res;
6017 }
6018
6019 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::type_size(int option_type_size) {
6020 if (option_type_size < 0) {
6021 // this section is included for backwards compatibility
6022 type_size_max_ = -option_type_size;
6023 type_size_min_ = -option_type_size;
6024 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
6025 } else {
6026 type_size_max_ = option_type_size;
6027 if (type_size_max_ < detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
6028 type_size_min_ = option_type_size;
6029 } else {
6030 inject_separator_ = true;
6031 }
6032 if (type_size_max_ == 0)
6033 required_ = false;
6034 }
6035 return this;
6036 }
6037
6038 CLI11_INLINE Option* Option::type_size(int option_type_size_min, int option_type_size_max) {
6039 if (option_type_size_min < 0 || option_type_size_max < 0) {
6040 // this section is included for backwards compatibility
6041 expected_max_ = detail::expected_max_vector_size;
6042 option_type_size_min = (std::abs)(option_type_size_min);
6043 option_type_size_max = (std::abs)(option_type_size_max);
6044 }
6045
6046 if (option_type_size_min > option_type_size_max) {
6047 type_size_max_ = option_type_size_min;
6048 type_size_min_ = option_type_size_max;
6049 } else {
6050 type_size_min_ = option_type_size_min;
6051 type_size_max_ = option_type_size_max;
6052 }
6053 if (type_size_max_ == 0) {
6054 required_ = false;
6055 }
6056 if (type_size_max_ >= detail::expected_max_vector_size) {
6057 inject_separator_ = true;
6058 }
6059 return this;
6060 }
6061
6062 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::get_type_name() const {
6063 std::string full_type_name = type_name_();
6064 if (!validators_.empty()) {
6065 for (const auto& Validator : validators_) {
6066 std::string const vtype = Validator.get_description();
6067 if (!vtype.empty()) {
6068 full_type_name += ":" + vtype;
6069 }
6070 }
6071 }
6072 return full_type_name;
6073 }
6074
6075 CLI11_INLINE void Option::_validate_results(results_t& res) const {
6076 // Run the Validators (can change the string)
6077 if (!validators_.empty()) {
6078 if (type_size_max_ > 1) { // in this context index refers to the index in the type
6079 int index = 0;
6080 if (get_items_expected_max() < static_cast<int>(res.size()) && multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
6081 // create a negative index for the earliest ones
6082 index = get_items_expected_max() - static_cast<int>(res.size());
6083 }
6084
6085 for (std::string& result : res) {
6086 if (detail::is_separator(result) && type_size_max_ != type_size_min_ && index >= 0) {
6087 index = 0; // reset index for variable size chunks
6088 continue;
6089 }
6090 auto err_msg = _validate(result, (index >= 0) ? (index % type_size_max_) : index);
6091 if (!err_msg.empty())
6092 throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
6093 ++index;
6094 }
6095 } else {
6096 int index = 0;
6097 if (expected_max_ < static_cast<int>(res.size()) && multi_option_policy_ == CLI::MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast) {
6098 // create a negative index for the earliest ones
6099 index = expected_max_ - static_cast<int>(res.size());
6100 }
6101 for (std::string& result : res) {
6102 auto err_msg = _validate(result, index);
6103 ++index;
6104 if (!err_msg.empty())
6105 throw ValidationError(get_name(), err_msg);
6106 }
6107 }
6108 }
6109 }
6110
6111 CLI11_INLINE void Option::_reduce_results(results_t& out, const results_t& original) const {
6112 // max num items expected or length of vector, always at least 1
6113 // Only valid for a trimming policy
6114
6115 out.clear();
6116 // Operation depends on the policy setting
6117 switch (multi_option_policy_) {
6118 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll:
6119 break;
6120 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast: {
6121 // Allow multi-option sizes (including 0)
6122 std::size_t const trim_size =
6123 std::min<std::size_t>(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)), original.size());
6124 if (original.size() != trim_size) {
6125 out.assign(original.end() - static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size), original.end());
6126 }
6127 } break;
6128 case MultiOptionPolicy::TakeFirst: {
6129 std::size_t const trim_size =
6130 std::min<std::size_t>(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::max<int>(get_items_expected_max(), 1)), original.size());
6131 if (original.size() != trim_size) {
6132 out.assign(original.begin(), original.begin() + static_cast<results_t::difference_type>(trim_size));
6133 }
6134 } break;
6135 case MultiOptionPolicy::Join:
6136 if (results_.size() > 1) {
6137 out.push_back(detail::join(original, std::string(1, (delimiter_ == '\0') ? '\n' : delimiter_)));
6138 }
6139 break;
6140 case MultiOptionPolicy::Sum:
6141 out.push_back(detail::sum_string_vector(original));
6142 break;
6143 case MultiOptionPolicy::Throw:
6144 default: {
6145 auto num_min = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_min());
6146 auto num_max = static_cast<std::size_t>(get_items_expected_max());
6147 if (num_min == 0) {
6148 num_min = 1;
6149 }
6150 if (num_max == 0) {
6151 num_max = 1;
6152 }
6153 if (original.size() < num_min) {
6154 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtLeast(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_min), original.size());
6155 }
6156 if (original.size() > num_max) {
6157 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(get_name(), static_cast<int>(num_max), original.size());
6158 }
6159 break;
6160 }
6161 }
6162 // this check is to allow an empty vector in certain circumstances but not if expected is not zero.
6163 // {} is the indicator for an empty container
6164 if (out.empty()) {
6165 if (original.size() == 1 && original[0] == "{}" && get_items_expected_min() > 0) {
6166 out.push_back("{}");
6167 out.push_back("%%");
6168 }
6169 } else if (out.size() == 1 && out[0] == "{}" && get_items_expected_min() > 0) {
6170 out.push_back("%%");
6171 }
6172 }
6173
6174 CLI11_INLINE std::string Option::_validate(std::string& result, int index) const {
6175 std::string err_msg;
6176 if (result.empty() && expected_min_ == 0) {
6177 // an empty with nothing expected is allowed
6178 return err_msg;
6179 }
6180 for (const auto& vali : validators_) {
6181 auto v = vali.get_application_index();
6182 if (v == -1 || v == index) {
6183 try {
6184 err_msg = vali(result);
6185 } catch (const ValidationError& err) {
6186 err_msg = err.what();
6187 }
6188 if (!err_msg.empty())
6189 break;
6190 }
6191 }
6192
6193 return err_msg;
6194 }
6195
6196 CLI11_INLINE int Option::_add_result(std::string&& result, std::vector<std::string>& res) const {
6197 int result_count = 0;
6198 if (allow_extra_args_ && !result.empty() && result.front() == '[' &&
6199 result.back() == ']') { // this is now a vector string likely from the default or user entry
6200 result.pop_back();
6201
6202 for (auto& var : CLI::detail::split(result.substr(1), ',')) {
6203 if (!var.empty()) {
6204 result_count += _add_result(std::move(var), res);
6205 }
6206 }
6207 return result_count;
6208 }
6209 if (delimiter_ == '\0') {
6210 res.push_back(std::move(result));
6211 ++result_count;
6212 } else {
6213 if ((result.find_first_of(delimiter_) != std::string::npos)) {
6214 for (const auto& var : CLI::detail::split(result, delimiter_)) {
6215 if (!var.empty()) {
6216 res.push_back(var);
6217 ++result_count;
6218 }
6219 }
6220 } else {
6221 res.push_back(std::move(result));
6222 ++result_count;
6223 }
6224 }
6225 return result_count;
6226 }
6227
6228#ifndef CLI11_PARSE
6229#define CLI11_PARSE(app, ...)
6230 try {
6231 (app).parse(__VA_ARGS__);
6232 } catch (const CLI::ParseError& e) {
6233 return (app).exit(e);
6234 }
6235#endif
6236
6237 namespace detail {
6238 enum class Classifier { NONE, POSITIONAL_MARK, SHORT, LONG, WINDOWS_STYLE, SUBCOMMAND, SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR };
6239 struct AppFriend;
6240 } // namespace detail
6241
6242 namespace FailureMessage {
6243 /// Printout a clean, simple message on error (the default in CLI11 1.5+)
6244 CLI11_INLINE std::string simple(const App* app, const Error& e);
6245
6246 /// Printout the full help string on error (if this fn is set, the old default for CLI11)
6247 CLI11_INLINE std::string help(const App* app, const Error& e);
6248 } // namespace FailureMessage
6249
6250 /// enumeration of modes of how to deal with extras in config files
6251
6252 enum class config_extras_mode : char { error = 0, ignore, ignore_all, capture };
6253
6254 class App;
6255
6256 using App_p = std::shared_ptr<App>;
6257
6258 namespace detail {
6259 /// helper functions for adding in appropriate flag modifiers for add_flag
6260
6261 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!std::is_integral<T>::value || (sizeof(T) <= 1U), detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6262 Option* default_flag_modifiers(Option* opt) {
6263 return opt->always_capture_default();
6264 }
6265
6266 /// summing modifiers
6267 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && (sizeof(T) > 1U), detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6268 Option* default_flag_modifiers(Option* opt) {
6269 return opt->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Sum)->default_str("0")->force_callback();
6270 }
6271
6272 } // namespace detail
6273
6274 class Option_group;
6275 /// Creates a command line program, with very few defaults.
6276 /** To use, create a new `Program()` instance with `argc`, `argv`, and a help description. The templated
6277 * add_option methods make it easy to prepare options. Remember to call `.start` before starting your
6278 * program, so that the options can be evaluated and the help option doesn't accidentally run your program. */
6279 class App {
6280 friend Option;
6281 friend detail::AppFriend;
6282
6283 protected:
6284 // This library follows the Google style guide for member names ending in underscores
6285
6286 /// @name Basics
6287 ///@{
6288
6289 /// Subcommand name or program name (from parser if name is empty)
6290 std::string name_{};
6291
6292 /// Description of the current program/subcommand
6293 std::string description_{};
6294
6295 /// If true, allow extra arguments (ie, don't throw an error). INHERITABLE
6296 bool allow_extras_{false};
6297
6298 /// If ignore, allow extra arguments in the ini file (ie, don't throw an error). INHERITABLE
6299 /// if error error on an extra argument, and if capture feed it to the app
6300 config_extras_mode allow_config_extras_{config_extras_mode::ignore};
6301
6302 /// If true, return immediately on an unrecognized option (implies allow_extras) INHERITABLE
6303 bool prefix_command_{false};
6304
6305 /// If set to true the name was automatically generated from the command line vs a user set name
6306 bool has_automatic_name_{false};
6307
6308 /// If set to true the subcommand is required to be processed and used, ignored for main app
6309 bool required_{false};
6310
6311 /// If set to true the subcommand is disabled and cannot be used, ignored for main app
6312 bool disabled_{false};
6313
6314 /// Flag indicating that the pre_parse_callback has been triggered
6315 bool pre_parse_called_{false};
6316
6317 /// Flag indicating that the callback for the subcommand should be executed immediately on parse completion which is
6318 /// before help or ini files are processed. INHERITABLE
6319 bool immediate_callback_{false};
6320
6321 /// This is a function that runs prior to the start of parsing
6322 std::function<void(std::size_t)> pre_parse_callback_{};
6323
6324 /// This is a function that runs when parsing has finished.
6325 std::function<void()> parse_complete_callback_{};
6326
6327 /// This is a function that runs when all processing has completed
6328 std::function<void()> final_callback_{};
6329
6330 ///@}
6331 /// @name Options
6332 ///@{
6333
6334 /// The default values for options, customizable and changeable INHERITABLE
6335 OptionDefaults option_defaults_{};
6336
6337 /// The list of options, stored locally
6338 std::vector<Option_p> options_{};
6339
6340 ///@}
6341 /// @name Help
6342 ///@{
6343
6344 /// Usage to put after program/subcommand description in the help output INHERITABLE
6345 std::string usage_{};
6346
6347 /// This is a function that generates a usage to put after program/subcommand description in help output
6348 std::function<std::string()> usage_callback_{};
6349
6350 /// Footer to put after all options in the help output INHERITABLE
6351 std::string footer_{};
6352
6353 /// This is a function that generates a footer to put after all other options in help output
6354 std::function<std::string()> footer_callback_{};
6355
6356 /// A pointer to the help flag if there is one INHERITABLE
6357 Option* help_ptr_{nullptr};
6358
6359 /// A pointer to the help all flag if there is one INHERITABLE
6360 Option* help_all_ptr_{nullptr};
6361
6362 /// A pointer to a version flag if there is one
6363 Option* version_ptr_{nullptr};
6364
6365 /// This is the formatter for help printing. Default provided. INHERITABLE (same pointer)
6366 std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> formatter_{new Formatter()};
6367
6368 /// The error message printing function INHERITABLE
6369 std::function<std::string(const App*, const Error& e)> failure_message_{FailureMessage::simple};
6370
6371 ///@}
6372 /// @name Parsing
6373 ///@{
6374
6375 using missing_t = std::vector<std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>>;
6376
6377 /// Pair of classifier, string for missing options. (extra detail is removed on returning from parse)
6378 ///
6379 /// This is faster and cleaner than storing just a list of strings and reparsing. This may contain the -- separator.
6380 missing_t missing_{};
6381
6382 /// This is a list of pointers to options with the original parse order
6383 std::vector<Option*> parse_order_{};
6384
6385 /// This is a list of the subcommands collected, in order
6386 std::vector<App*> parsed_subcommands_{};
6387
6388 /// this is a list of subcommands that are exclusionary to this one
6389 std::set<App*> exclude_subcommands_{};
6390
6391 /// This is a list of options which are exclusionary to this App, if the options were used this subcommand should
6392 /// not be
6393 std::set<Option*> exclude_options_{};
6394
6395 /// this is a list of subcommands or option groups that are required by this one, the list is not mutual, the
6396 /// listed subcommands do not require this one
6397 std::set<App*> need_subcommands_{};
6398
6399 /// This is a list of options which are required by this app, the list is not mutual, listed options do not need the
6400 /// subcommand not be
6401 std::set<Option*> need_options_{};
6402
6403 ///@}
6404 /// @name Subcommands
6405 ///@{
6406
6407 /// Storage for subcommand list
6408 std::vector<App_p> subcommands_{};
6409
6410 /// If true, the program name is not case sensitive INHERITABLE
6411 bool ignore_case_{false};
6412
6413 /// If true, the program should ignore underscores INHERITABLE
6414 bool ignore_underscore_{false};
6415
6416 /// Allow subcommand fallthrough, so that parent commands can collect commands after subcommand. INHERITABLE
6417 bool fallthrough_{false};
6418
6419 /// Allow '/' for options for Windows like options. Defaults to true on Windows, false otherwise. INHERITABLE
6420 bool allow_windows_style_options_{
6421#ifdef _WIN32
6422 true
6423#else
6424 false
6425#endif
6426 };
6427 /// specify that positional arguments come at the end of the argument sequence not inheritable
6428 bool positionals_at_end_{false};
6429
6430 enum class startup_mode : char { stable, enabled, disabled };
6431 /// specify the startup mode for the app
6432 /// stable=no change, enabled= startup enabled, disabled=startup disabled
6433 startup_mode default_startup{startup_mode::stable};
6434
6435 /// if set to true the subcommand can be triggered via configuration files INHERITABLE
6436 bool configurable_{false};
6437
6438 /// If set to true positional options are validated before assigning INHERITABLE
6439 bool validate_positionals_{false};
6440
6441 /// If set to true optional vector arguments are validated before assigning INHERITABLE
6442 bool validate_optional_arguments_{false};
6443
6444 /// indicator that the subcommand is silent and won't show up in subcommands list
6445 /// This is potentially useful as a modifier subcommand
6446 bool silent_{false};
6447
6448 /// Counts the number of times this command/subcommand was parsed
6449 std::uint32_t parsed_{0U};
6450
6451 /// Minimum required subcommands (not inheritable!)
6452 std::size_t require_subcommand_min_{0};
6453
6454 /// Max number of subcommands allowed (parsing stops after this number). 0 is unlimited INHERITABLE
6455 std::size_t require_subcommand_max_{0};
6456
6457 /// Minimum required options (not inheritable!)
6458 std::size_t require_option_min_{0};
6459
6460 /// Max number of options allowed. 0 is unlimited (not inheritable)
6461 std::size_t require_option_max_{0};
6462
6463 /// A pointer to the parent if this is a subcommand
6464 App* parent_{nullptr};
6465
6466 /// The group membership INHERITABLE
6467 std::string group_{"Subcommands"};
6468
6469 /// Alias names for the subcommand
6470 std::vector<std::string> aliases_{};
6471
6472 ///@}
6473 /// @name Config
6474 ///@{
6475
6476 /// Pointer to the config option
6477 Option* config_ptr_{nullptr};
6478
6479 /// This is the formatter for help printing. Default provided. INHERITABLE (same pointer)
6480 std::shared_ptr<Config> config_formatter_{new ConfigTOML()};
6481
6482 ///@}
6483
6484 /// Special private constructor for subcommand
6485 App(std::string app_description, std::string app_name, App* parent);
6486
6487 public:
6488 /// @name Basic
6489 ///@{
6490
6491 /// Create a new program. Pass in the same arguments as main(), along with a help string.
6492 explicit App(std::string app_description = "", std::string app_name = "")
6493 : App(app_description, app_name, nullptr) {
6494 set_help_flag("-h,--help", "Print this help message and exit");
6495 }
6496
6497 App(const App&) = delete;
6498 App& operator=(const App&) = delete;
6499
6500 /// virtual destructor
6501 virtual ~App() = default;
6502
6503 /// Set a callback for execution when all parsing and processing has completed
6504 ///
6505 /// Due to a bug in c++11,
6506 /// it is not possible to overload on std::function (fixed in c++14
6507 /// and backported to c++11 on newer compilers). Use capture by reference
6508 /// to get a pointer to App if needed.
6509 App* callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
6510 if (immediate_callback_) {
6511 parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
6512 } else {
6513 final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
6514 }
6515 return this;
6516 }
6517
6518 /// Set a callback for execution when all parsing and processing has completed
6519 /// aliased as callback
6520 App* final_callback(std::function<void()> app_callback) {
6521 final_callback_ = std::move(app_callback);
6522 return this;
6523 }
6524
6525 /// Set a callback to execute when parsing has completed for the app
6526 ///
6527 App* parse_complete_callback(std::function<void()> pc_callback) {
6528 parse_complete_callback_ = std::move(pc_callback);
6529 return this;
6530 }
6531
6532 /// Set a callback to execute prior to parsing.
6533 ///
6534 App* preparse_callback(std::function<void(std::size_t)> pp_callback) {
6535 pre_parse_callback_ = std::move(pp_callback);
6536 return this;
6537 }
6538
6539 /// Set a name for the app (empty will use parser to set the name)
6540 App* name(std::string app_name = "");
6541
6542 /// Set an alias for the app
6543 App* alias(std::string app_name);
6544
6545 /// Remove the error when extras are left over on the command line.
6546 App* allow_extras(bool allow = true) {
6547 allow_extras_ = allow;
6548 return this;
6549 }
6550
6551 /// Remove the error when extras are left over on the command line.
6552 App* required(bool require = true) {
6553 required_ = require;
6554 return this;
6555 }
6556
6557 /// Disable the subcommand or option group
6558 App* disabled(bool disable = true) {
6559 disabled_ = disable;
6560 return this;
6561 }
6562
6563 /// silence the subcommand from showing up in the processed list
6564 App* silent(bool silence = true) {
6565 silent_ = silence;
6566 return this;
6567 }
6568
6569 /// Set the subcommand to be disabled by default, so on clear(), at the start of each parse it is disabled
6570 App* disabled_by_default(bool disable = true) {
6571 if (disable) {
6572 default_startup = startup_mode::disabled;
6573 } else {
6574 default_startup = (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) ? startup_mode::enabled : startup_mode::stable;
6575 }
6576 return this;
6577 }
6578
6579 /// Set the subcommand to be enabled by default, so on clear(), at the start of each parse it is enabled (not
6580 /// disabled)
6581 App* enabled_by_default(bool enable = true) {
6582 if (enable) {
6583 default_startup = startup_mode::enabled;
6584 } else {
6585 default_startup = (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) ? startup_mode::disabled : startup_mode::stable;
6586 }
6587 return this;
6588 }
6589
6590 /// Set the subcommand callback to be executed immediately on subcommand completion
6591 App* immediate_callback(bool immediate = true);
6592
6593 /// Set the subcommand to validate positional arguments before assigning
6594 App* validate_positionals(bool validate = true) {
6595 validate_positionals_ = validate;
6596 return this;
6597 }
6598
6599 /// Set the subcommand to validate optional vector arguments before assigning
6600 App* validate_optional_arguments(bool validate = true) {
6601 validate_optional_arguments_ = validate;
6602 return this;
6603 }
6604
6605 /// ignore extras in config files
6606 App* allow_config_extras(bool allow = true) {
6607 if (allow) {
