6608 allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::capture;
6609 allow_extras_ = true;
6610 } else {
6611 allow_config_extras_ = config_extras_mode::error;
6612 }
6613 return this;
6614 }
6615
6616 /// ignore extras in config files
6617 App* allow_config_extras(config_extras_mode mode) {
6618 allow_config_extras_ = mode;
6619 return this;
6620 }
6621
6622 /// Do not parse anything after the first unrecognized option and return
6623 App* prefix_command(bool allow = true) {
6624 prefix_command_ = allow;
6625 return this;
6626 }
6627
6628 /// Ignore case. Subcommands inherit value.
6629 App* ignore_case(bool value = true);
6630
6631 /// Allow windows style options, such as `/opt`. First matching short or long name used. Subcommands inherit
6632 /// value.
6633 App* allow_windows_style_options(bool value = true) {
6634 allow_windows_style_options_ = value;
6635 return this;
6636 }
6637
6638 /// Specify that the positional arguments are only at the end of the sequence
6639 App* positionals_at_end(bool value = true) {
6640 positionals_at_end_ = value;
6641 return this;
6642 }
6643
6644 /// Specify that the subcommand can be triggered by a config file
6645 App* configurable(bool value = true) {
6646 configurable_ = value;
6647 return this;
6648 }
6649
6650 /// Ignore underscore. Subcommands inherit value.
6651 App* ignore_underscore(bool value = true);
6652
6653 /// Set the help formatter
6654 App* formatter(std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> fmt) {
6655 formatter_ = fmt;
6656 return this;
6657 }
6658
6659 /// Set the help formatter
6660 App* formatter_fn(std::function<std::string(const App*, std::string, AppFormatMode)> fmt) {
6661 formatter_ = std::make_shared<FormatterLambda>(fmt);
6662 return this;
6663 }
6664
6665 /// Set the config formatter
6666 App* config_formatter(std::shared_ptr<Config> fmt) {
6667 config_formatter_ = fmt;
6668 return this;
6669 }
6670
6671 /// Check to see if this subcommand was parsed, true only if received on command line.
6672 CLI11_NODISCARD bool parsed() const {
6673 return parsed_ > 0;
6674 }
6675
6676 /// Get the OptionDefault object, to set option defaults
6677 OptionDefaults* option_defaults() {
6678 return &option_defaults_;
6679 }
6680
6681 ///@}
6682 /// @name Adding options
6683 ///@{
6684
6685 /// Add an option, will automatically understand the type for common types.
6686 ///
6687 /// To use, create a variable with the expected type, and pass it in after the name.
6688 /// After start is called, you can use count to see if the value was passed, and
6689 /// the value will be initialized properly. Numbers, vectors, and strings are supported.
6690 ///
6691 /// ->required(), ->default, and the validators are options,
6692 /// The positional options take an optional number of arguments.
6693 ///
6694 /// For example,
6695 ///
6696 /// std::string filename;
6697 /// program.add_option("filename", filename, "description of filename");
6698 ///
6699 Option* add_option(std::string option_name,
6700 callback_t option_callback,
6701 std::string option_description = "",
6702 bool defaulted = false,
6703 std::function<std::string()> func = {});
6704
6705 /// Add option for assigning to a variable
6706 template <typename AssignTo,
6707 typename ConvertTo = AssignTo,
6708 enable_if_t<!std::is_const<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6709 Option* add_option(std::string option_name,
6710 AssignTo& variable, ///< The variable to set
6711 std::string option_description = "") {
6712 auto fun = [&variable](const CLI::results_t& res) { // comment for spacing
6713 return detail::lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(res, variable);
6714 };
6715
6716 Option* opt = add_option(option_name, fun, option_description, false, [&variable]() {
6717 return CLI::detail::checked_to_string<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(variable);
6718 });
6719 opt->type_name(detail::type_name<ConvertTo>());
6720 // these must be actual lvalues since (std::max) sometimes is defined in terms of references and references
6721 // to structs used in the evaluation can be temporary so that would cause issues.
6722 auto Tcount = detail::type_count<AssignTo>::value;
6723 auto XCcount = detail::type_count<ConvertTo>::value;
6724 opt->type_size(detail::type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value, (std::max)(Tcount, XCcount));
6725 opt->expected(detail::expected_count<ConvertTo>::value);
6726 opt->run_callback_for_default();
6727 return opt;
6728 }
6729
6730 /// Add option for assigning to a variable
6731 template <typename AssignTo, enable_if_t<!std::is_const<AssignTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6732 Option* add_option_no_stream(std::string option_name,
6733 AssignTo& variable, ///< The variable to set
6734 std::string option_description = "") {
6735 auto fun = [&variable](const CLI::results_t& res) { // comment for spacing
6736 return detail::lexical_conversion<AssignTo, AssignTo>(res, variable);
6737 };
6738
6739 Option* opt = add_option(option_name, fun, option_description, false, []() {
6740 return std::string{};
6741 });
6742 opt->type_name(detail::type_name<AssignTo>());
6743 opt->type_size(detail::type_count_min<AssignTo>::value, detail::type_count<AssignTo>::value);
6744 opt->expected(detail::expected_count<AssignTo>::value);
6745 opt->run_callback_for_default();
6746 return opt;
6747 }
6748
6749 /// Add option for a callback of a specific type
6750 template <typename ArgType>
6751 Option* add_option_function(std::string option_name,
6752 const std::function<void(const ArgType&)>& func, ///< the callback to execute
6753 std::string option_description = "") {
6754 auto fun = [func](const CLI::results_t& res) {
6755 ArgType variable;
6756 bool result = detail::lexical_conversion<ArgType, ArgType>(res, variable);
6757 if (result) {
6758 func(variable);
6759 }
6760 return result;
6761 };
6762
6763 Option* opt = add_option(option_name, std::move(fun), option_description, false);
6764 opt->type_name(detail::type_name<ArgType>());
6765 opt->type_size(detail::type_count_min<ArgType>::value, detail::type_count<ArgType>::value);
6766 opt->expected(detail::expected_count<ArgType>::value);
6767 return opt;
6768 }
6769
6770 /// Add option with no description or variable assignment
6771 Option* add_option(std::string option_name) {
6772 return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t{}, std::string{}, false);
6773 }
6774
6775 /// Add option with description but with no variable assignment or callback
6776 template <typename T,
6777 enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value && std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6778 Option* add_option(std::string option_name, T& option_description) {
6779 return add_option(option_name, CLI::callback_t(), option_description, false);
6780 }
6781
6782 /// Set a help flag, replace the existing one if present
6783 Option* set_help_flag(std::string flag_name = "", const std::string& help_description = "");
6784
6785 /// Set a help all flag, replaced the existing one if present
6786 Option* set_help_all_flag(std::string help_name = "", const std::string& help_description = "");
6787
6788 /// Set a version flag and version display string, replace the existing one if present
6789 Option* set_version_flag(std::string flag_name = "",
6790 const std::string& versionString = "",
6791 const std::string& version_help = "Display program version information and exit");
6792
6793 /// Generate the version string through a callback function
6794 Option* set_version_flag(std::string flag_name,
6795 std::function<std::string()> vfunc,
6796 const std::string& version_help = "Display program version information and exit");
6797
6798 private:
6799 /// Internal function for adding a flag
6800 Option* _add_flag_internal(std::string flag_name, CLI::callback_t fun, std::string flag_description);
6801
6802 public:
6803 /// Add a flag with no description or variable assignment
6804 Option* add_flag(std::string flag_name) {
6805 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), std::string{});
6806 }
6807
6808 /// Add flag with description but with no variable assignment or callback
6809 /// takes a constant string, if a variable string is passed that variable will be assigned the results from the
6810 /// flag
6811 template <typename T,
6812 enable_if_t<std::is_const<T>::value && std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6813 Option* add_flag(std::string flag_name, T& flag_description) {
6814 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, CLI::callback_t(), flag_description);
6815 }
6816
6817 /// Other type version accepts all other types that are not vectors such as bool, enum, string or other classes
6818 /// that can be converted from a string
6819 template <typename T,
6820 enable_if_t<!detail::is_mutable_container<T>::value && !std::is_const<T>::value &&
6821 !std::is_constructible<std::function<void(int)>, T>::value,
6822 detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6823 Option* add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6824 T& flag_result, ///< A variable holding the flag result
6825 std::string flag_description = "") {
6826 CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_result](const CLI::results_t& res) {
6827 using CLI::detail::lexical_cast;
6828 return lexical_cast(res[0], flag_result);
6829 };
6830 auto* opt = _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description));
6831 return detail::default_flag_modifiers<T>(opt);
6832 }
6833
6834 /// Vector version to capture multiple flags.
6835 template <typename T,
6836 enable_if_t<!std::is_assignable<std::function<void(std::int64_t)>&, T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
6837 Option* add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6838 std::vector<T>& flag_results, ///< A vector of values with the flag results
6839 std::string flag_description = "") {
6840 CLI::callback_t fun = [&flag_results](const CLI::results_t& res) {
6841 bool retval = true;
6842 for (const auto& elem : res) {
6843 using CLI::detail::lexical_cast;
6844 flag_results.emplace_back();
6845 retval &= lexical_cast(elem, flag_results.back());
6846 }
6847 return retval;
6848 };
6849 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))
6850 ->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeAll)
6851 ->run_callback_for_default();
6852 }
6853
6854 /// Add option for callback that is triggered with a true flag and takes no arguments
6855 Option* add_flag_callback(std::string flag_name,
6856 std::function<void(void)> function, ///< A function to call, void(void)
6857 std::string flag_description = "");
6858
6859 /// Add option for callback with an integer value
6860 Option* add_flag_function(std::string flag_name,
6861 std::function<void(std::int64_t)> function, ///< A function to call, void(int)
6862 std::string flag_description = "");
6863
6864#ifdef CLI11_CPP14
6865 /// Add option for callback (C++14 or better only)
6866 Option* add_flag(std::string flag_name,
6867 std::function<void(std::int64_t)> function, ///< A function to call, void(std::int64_t)
6868 std::string flag_description = "") {
6869 return add_flag_function(std::move(flag_name), std::move(function), std::move(flag_description));
6870 }
6871#endif
6872
6873 /// Set a configuration ini file option, or clear it if no name passed
6874 Option* set_config(std::string option_name = "",
6875 std::string default_filename = "",
6876 const std::string& help_message = "Read an ini file",
6877 bool config_required = false);
6878
6879 /// Removes an option from the App. Takes an option pointer. Returns true if found and removed.
6880 bool remove_option(Option* opt);
6881
6882 /// creates an option group as part of the given app
6883 template <typename T = Option_group>
6884 T* add_option_group(std::string group_name, std::string group_description = "") {
6885 if (!detail::valid_alias_name_string(group_name)) {
6886 throw IncorrectConstruction("option group names may not contain newlines or null characters");
6887 }
6888 auto option_group = std::make_shared<T>(std::move(group_description), group_name, this);
6889 auto* ptr = option_group.get();
6890 // move to App_p for overload resolution on older gcc versions
6891 App_p app_ptr = std::dynamic_pointer_cast<App>(option_group);
6892 add_subcommand(std::move(app_ptr));
6893 return ptr;
6894 }
6895
6896 ///@}
6897 /// @name Subcommands
6898 ///@{
6899
6900 /// Add a subcommand. Inherits INHERITABLE and OptionDefaults, and help flag
6901 App* add_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name = "", std::string subcommand_description = "");
6902
6903 /// Add a previously created app as a subcommand
6904 App* add_subcommand(CLI::App_p subcom);
6905
6906 /// Removes a subcommand from the App. Takes a subcommand pointer. Returns true if found and removed.
6907 bool remove_subcommand(App* subcom);
6908
6909 /// Check to see if a subcommand is part of this command (doesn't have to be in command line)
6910 /// returns the first subcommand if passed a nullptr
6911 App* get_subcommand(const App* subcom) const;
6912
6913 /// Check to see if a subcommand is part of this command (text version)
6914 CLI11_NODISCARD App* get_subcommand(std::string subcom) const;
6915 CLI11_NODISCARD App* get_subcommand_no_throw(std::string subcom) const;
6916
6917 /// Get a pointer to subcommand by index
6918 CLI11_NODISCARD App* get_subcommand(int index = 0) const;
6919
6920 /// Check to see if a subcommand is part of this command and get a shared_ptr to it
6921 CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(App* subcom) const;
6922
6923 /// Check to see if a subcommand is part of this command (text version)
6924 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(std::string subcom) const;
6925
6926 /// Get an owning pointer to subcommand by index
6927 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI::App_p get_subcommand_ptr(int index = 0) const;
6928
6929 /// Check to see if an option group is part of this App
6930 CLI11_NODISCARD App* get_option_group(std::string group_name) const;
6931
6932 /// No argument version of count counts the number of times this subcommand was
6933 /// passed in. The main app will return 1. Unnamed subcommands will also return 1 unless
6934 /// otherwise modified in a callback
6935 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t count() const {
6936 return parsed_;
6937 }
6938
6939 /// Get a count of all the arguments processed in options and subcommands, this excludes arguments which were
6940 /// treated as extras.
6941 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t count_all() const;
6942
6943 /// Changes the group membership
6944 App* group(std::string group_name) {
6945 group_ = group_name;
6946 return this;
6947 }
6948
6949 /// The argumentless form of require subcommand requires 1 or more subcommands
6950 App* require_subcommand() {
6951 require_subcommand_min_ = 1;
6952 require_subcommand_max_ = 0;
6953 return this;
6954 }
6955
6956 /// Require a subcommand to be given (does not affect help call)
6957 /// The number required can be given. Negative values indicate maximum
6958 /// number allowed (0 for any number). Max number inheritable.
6959 App* require_subcommand(int value) {
6960 if (value < 0) {
6961 require_subcommand_min_ = 0;
6962 require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
6963 } else {
6964 require_subcommand_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
6965 require_subcommand_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
6966 }
6967 return this;
6968 }
6969
6970 /// Explicitly control the number of subcommands required. Setting 0
6971 /// for the max means unlimited number allowed. Max number inheritable.
6972 App* require_subcommand(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
6973 require_subcommand_min_ = min;
6974 require_subcommand_max_ = max;
6975 return this;
6976 }
6977
6978 /// The argumentless form of require option requires 1 or more options be used
6979 App* require_option() {
6980 require_option_min_ = 1;
6981 require_option_max_ = 0;
6982 return this;
6983 }
6984
6985 /// Require an option to be given (does not affect help call)
6986 /// The number required can be given. Negative values indicate maximum
6987 /// number allowed (0 for any number).
6988 App* require_option(int value) {
6989 if (value < 0) {
6990 require_option_min_ = 0;
6991 require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(-value);
6992 } else {
6993 require_option_min_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
6994 require_option_max_ = static_cast<std::size_t>(value);
6995 }
6996 return this;
6997 }
6998
6999 /// Explicitly control the number of options required. Setting 0
7000 /// for the max means unlimited number allowed. Max number inheritable.
7001 App* require_option(std::size_t min, std::size_t max) {
7002 require_option_min_ = min;
7003 require_option_max_ = max;
7004 return this;
7005 }
7006
7007 /// Stop subcommand fallthrough, so that parent commands cannot collect commands after subcommand.
7008 /// Default from parent, usually set on parent.
7009 App* fallthrough(bool value = true) {
7010 fallthrough_ = value;
7011 return this;
7012 }
7013
7014 /// Check to see if this subcommand was parsed, true only if received on command line.
7015 /// This allows the subcommand to be directly checked.
7016 explicit operator bool() const {
7017 return parsed_ > 0;
7018 }
7019
7020 ///@}
7021 /// @name Extras for subclassing
7022 ///@{
7023
7024 /// This allows subclasses to inject code before callbacks but after parse.
7025 ///
7026 /// This does not run if any errors or help is thrown.
7027 virtual void pre_callback() {
7028 }
7029
7030 ///@}
7031 /// @name Parsing
7032 ///@{
7033 //
7034 /// Reset the parsed data
7035 void clear();
7036
7037 /// Parse the command-line arguments passed to the main function of the executable.
7038 /// This overload will correctly parse unicode arguments on Windows.
7039 void parse();
7040
7041 /// Parses the command line - throws errors.
7042 /// This must be called after the options are in but before the rest of the program.
7043 void parse(int argc, const char* const* argv);
7044 void parse(int argc, const wchar_t* const* argv);
7045
7046 private:
7047 template <class CharT>
7048 void parse_char_t(int argc, const CharT* const* argv);
7049
7050 public:
7051 /// Parse a single string as if it contained command line arguments.
7052 /// This function splits the string into arguments then calls parse(std::vector<std::string> &)
7053 /// the function takes an optional boolean argument specifying if the programName is included in the string to
7054 /// process
7055 void parse(std::string commandline, bool program_name_included = false);
7056 void parse(std::wstring commandline, bool program_name_included = false);
7057
7058 /// The real work is done here. Expects a reversed vector.
7059 /// Changes the vector to the remaining options.
7060 void parse(std::vector<std::string>& args);
7061
7062 /// The real work is done here. Expects a reversed vector.
7063 void parse(std::vector<std::string>&& args);
7064
7065 void parse_from_stream(std::istream& input);
7066
7067 /// Provide a function to print a help message. The function gets access to the App pointer and error.
7068 void failure_message(std::function<std::string(const App*, const Error& e)> function) {
7069 failure_message_ = function;
7070 }
7071
7072 /// Print a nice error message and return the exit code
7073 int exit(const Error& e, std::ostream& out = std::cout, std::ostream& err = std::cerr) const;
7074
7075 ///@}
7076 /// @name Post parsing
7077 ///@{
7078
7079 /// Counts the number of times the given option was passed.
7080 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t count(std::string option_name) const {
7081 return get_option(option_name)->count();
7082 }
7083
7084 /// Get a subcommand pointer list to the currently selected subcommands (after parsing by default, in command
7085 /// line order; use parsed = false to get the original definition list.)
7086 CLI11_NODISCARD std::vector<App*> get_subcommands() const {
7087 return parsed_subcommands_;
7088 }
7089
7090 /// Get a filtered subcommand pointer list from the original definition list. An empty function will provide all
7091 /// subcommands (const)
7092 std::vector<const App*> get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(const App*)>& filter) const;
7093
7094 /// Get a filtered subcommand pointer list from the original definition list. An empty function will provide all
7095 /// subcommands
7096 std::vector<App*> get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(App*)>& filter);
7097
7098 /// Check to see if given subcommand was selected
7099 bool got_subcommand(const App* subcom) const {
7100 // get subcom needed to verify that this was a real subcommand
7101 return get_subcommand(subcom)->parsed_ > 0;
7102 }
7103
7104 /// Check with name instead of pointer to see if subcommand was selected
7105 CLI11_NODISCARD bool got_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name) const {
7106 return get_subcommand(subcommand_name)->parsed_ > 0;
7107 }
7108
7109 /// Sets excluded options for the subcommand
7110 App* excludes(Option* opt) {
7111 if (opt == nullptr) {
7112 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7113 }
7114 exclude_options_.insert(opt);
7115 return this;
7116 }
7117
7118 /// Sets excluded subcommands for the subcommand
7119 App* excludes(App* app) {
7120 if (app == nullptr) {
7121 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7122 }
7123 if (app == this) {
7124 throw OptionNotFound("cannot self reference in needs");
7125 }
7126 auto res = exclude_subcommands_.insert(app);
7127 // subcommand exclusion should be symmetric
7128 if (res.second) {
7129 app->exclude_subcommands_.insert(this);
7130 }
7131 return this;
7132 }
7133
7134 App* needs(Option* opt) {
7135 if (opt == nullptr) {
7136 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7137 }
7138 need_options_.insert(opt);
7139 return this;
7140 }
7141
7142 App* needs(App* app) {
7143 if (app == nullptr) {
7144 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
7145 }
7146 if (app == this) {
7147 throw OptionNotFound("cannot self reference in needs");
7148 }
7149 need_subcommands_.insert(app);
7150 return this;
7151 }
7152
7153 /// Removes an option from the excludes list of this subcommand
7154 bool remove_excludes(Option* opt);
7155
7156 /// Removes a subcommand from the excludes list of this subcommand
7157 bool remove_excludes(App* app);
7158
7159 /// Removes an option from the needs list of this subcommand
7160 bool remove_needs(Option* opt);
7161
7162 /// Removes a subcommand from the needs list of this subcommand
7163 bool remove_needs(App* app);
7164 ///@}
7165 /// @name Help
7166 ///@{
7167
7168 /// Set usage.
7169 App* usage(std::string usage_string) {
7170 usage_ = std::move(usage_string);
7171 return this;
7172 }
7173 /// Set usage.
7174 App* usage(std::function<std::string()> usage_function) {
7175 usage_callback_ = std::move(usage_function);
7176 return this;
7177 }
7178 /// Set footer.
7179 App* footer(std::string footer_string) {
7180 footer_ = std::move(footer_string);
7181 return this;
7182 }
7183 /// Set footer.
7184 App* footer(std::function<std::string()> footer_function) {
7185 footer_callback_ = std::move(footer_function);
7186 return this;
7187 }
7188 /// Produce a string that could be read in as a config of the current values of the App. Set default_also to
7189 /// include default arguments. write_descriptions will print a description for the App and for each option.
7190 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string config_to_str(bool default_also = false, bool write_description = false) const {
7191 return config_formatter_->to_config(this, default_also, write_description, "");
7192 }
7193
7194 /// Makes a help message, using the currently configured formatter
7195 /// Will only do one subcommand at a time
7196 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string help(std::string prev = "", AppFormatMode mode = AppFormatMode::Normal) const;
7197
7198 /// Displays a version string
7199 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string version() const;
7200 ///@}
7201 /// @name Getters
7202 ///@{
7203
7204 /// Access the formatter
7205 CLI11_NODISCARD std::shared_ptr<FormatterBase> get_formatter() const {
7206 return formatter_;
7207 }
7208
7209 /// Access the config formatter
7210 CLI11_NODISCARD std::shared_ptr<Config> get_config_formatter() const {
7211 return config_formatter_;
7212 }
7213
7214 /// Access the config formatter as a configBase pointer
7215 CLI11_NODISCARD std::shared_ptr<ConfigBase> get_config_formatter_base() const {
7216 // This is safer as a dynamic_cast if we have RTTI, as Config -> ConfigBase
7217#if CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI == 0
7218 return std::dynamic_pointer_cast<ConfigBase>(config_formatter_);
7219#else
7220 return std::static_pointer_cast<ConfigBase>(config_formatter_);
7221#endif
7222 }
7223
7224 /// Get the app or subcommand description
7225 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_description() const {
7226 return description_;
7227 }
7228
7229 /// Set the description of the app
7230 App* description(std::string app_description) {
7231 description_ = std::move(app_description);
7232 return this;
7233 }
7234
7235 /// Get the list of options (user facing function, so returns raw pointers), has optional filter function
7236 std::vector<const Option*> get_options(const std::function<bool(const Option*)> filter = {}) const;
7237
7238 /// Non-const version of the above
7239 std::vector<Option*> get_options(const std::function<bool(Option*)> filter = {});
7240
7241 /// Get an option by name (noexcept non-const version)
7242 Option* get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) noexcept;
7243
7244 /// Get an option by name (noexcept const version)
7245 CLI11_NODISCARD const Option* get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) const noexcept;
7246
7247 /// Get an option by name
7248 CLI11_NODISCARD const Option* get_option(std::string option_name) const {
7249 const auto* opt = get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7250 if (opt == nullptr) {
7251 throw OptionNotFound(option_name);
7252 }
7253 return opt;
7254 }
7255
7256 /// Get an option by name (non-const version)
7257 Option* get_option(std::string option_name) {
7258 auto* opt = get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7259 if (opt == nullptr) {
7260 throw OptionNotFound(option_name);
7261 }
7262 return opt;
7263 }
7264
7265 /// Shortcut bracket operator for getting a pointer to an option
7266 const Option* operator[](const std::string& option_name) const {
7267 return get_option(option_name);
7268 }
7269
7270 /// Shortcut bracket operator for getting a pointer to an option
7271 const Option* operator[](const char* option_name) const {
7272 return get_option(option_name);
7273 }
7274
7275 /// Check the status of ignore_case
7276 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_ignore_case() const {
7277 return ignore_case_;
7278 }
7279
7280 /// Check the status of ignore_underscore
7281 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_ignore_underscore() const {
7282 return ignore_underscore_;
7283 }
7284
7285 /// Check the status of fallthrough
7286 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_fallthrough() const {
7287 return fallthrough_;
7288 }
7289
7290 /// Check the status of the allow windows style options
7291 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_allow_windows_style_options() const {
7292 return allow_windows_style_options_;
7293 }
7294
7295 /// Check the status of the allow windows style options
7296 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_positionals_at_end() const {
7297 return positionals_at_end_;
7298 }
7299
7300 /// Check the status of the allow windows style options
7301 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_configurable() const {
7302 return configurable_;
7303 }
7304
7305 /// Get the group of this subcommand
7306 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& get_group() const {
7307 return group_;
7308 }
7309
7310 /// Generate and return the usage.
7311 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_usage() const {
7312 return (usage_callback_) ? usage_callback_() + '\n' + usage_ : usage_;
7313 }
7314
7315 /// Generate and return the footer.
7316 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_footer() const {
7317 return (footer_callback_) ? footer_callback_() + '\n' + footer_ : footer_;
7318 }
7319
7320 /// Get the required min subcommand value
7321 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_require_subcommand_min() const {
7322 return require_subcommand_min_;
7323 }
7324
7325 /// Get the required max subcommand value
7326 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_require_subcommand_max() const {
7327 return require_subcommand_max_;
7328 }
7329
7330 /// Get the required min option value
7331 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_require_option_min() const {
7332 return require_option_min_;
7333 }
7334
7335 /// Get the required max option value
7336 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_require_option_max() const {
7337 return require_option_max_;
7338 }
7339
7340 /// Get the prefix command status
7341 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_prefix_command() const {
7342 return prefix_command_;
7343 }
7344
7345 /// Get the status of allow extras
7346 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_allow_extras() const {
7347 return allow_extras_;
7348 }
7349
7350 /// Get the status of required
7351 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_required() const {
7352 return required_;
7353 }
7354
7355 /// Get the status of disabled
7356 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_disabled() const {
7357 return disabled_;
7358 }
7359
7360 /// Get the status of silence
7361 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_silent() const {
7362 return silent_;
7363 }
7364
7365 /// Get the status of disabled
7366 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_immediate_callback() const {
7367 return immediate_callback_;
7368 }
7369
7370 /// Get the status of disabled by default
7371 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_disabled_by_default() const {
7372 return (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled);
7373 }
7374
7375 /// Get the status of disabled by default
7376 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_enabled_by_default() const {
7377 return (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled);
7378 }
7379 /// Get the status of validating positionals
7380 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_validate_positionals() const {
7381 return validate_positionals_;
7382 }
7383 /// Get the status of validating optional vector arguments
7384 CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_validate_optional_arguments() const {
7385 return validate_optional_arguments_;
7386 }
7387
7388 /// Get the status of allow extras
7389 CLI11_NODISCARD config_extras_mode get_allow_config_extras() const {
7390 return allow_config_extras_;
7391 }
7392
7393 /// Get a pointer to the help flag.
7394 Option* get_help_ptr() {
7395 return help_ptr_;
7396 }
7397
7398 /// Get a pointer to the help flag. (const)
7399 CLI11_NODISCARD const Option* get_help_ptr() const {
7400 return help_ptr_;
7401 }
7402
7403 /// Get a pointer to the help all flag. (const)
7404 CLI11_NODISCARD const Option* get_help_all_ptr() const {
7405 return help_all_ptr_;
7406 }
7407
7408 /// Get a pointer to the config option.
7409 Option* get_config_ptr() {
7410 return config_ptr_;
7411 }
7412
7413 /// Get a pointer to the config option. (const)
7414 CLI11_NODISCARD const Option* get_config_ptr() const {
7415 return config_ptr_;
7416 }
7417
7418 /// Get a pointer to the version option.
7419 Option* get_version_ptr() {
7420 return version_ptr_;
7421 }
7422
7423 /// Get a pointer to the version option. (const)
7424 CLI11_NODISCARD const Option* get_version_ptr() const {
7425 return version_ptr_;
7426 }
7427
7428 /// Get the parent of this subcommand (or nullptr if main app)
7429 App* get_parent() {
7430 return parent_;
7431 }
7432
7433 /// Get the parent of this subcommand (or nullptr if main app) (const version)
7434 CLI11_NODISCARD const App* get_parent() const {
7435 return parent_;
7436 }
7437
7438 /// Get the name of the current app
7439 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& get_name() const {
7440 return name_;
7441 }
7442
7443 /// Get the aliases of the current app
7444 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<std::string>& get_aliases() const {
7445 return aliases_;
7446 }
7447
7448 /// clear all the aliases of the current App
7449 App* clear_aliases() {
7450 aliases_.clear();
7451 return this;
7452 }
7453
7454 /// Get a display name for an app
7455 CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_display_name(bool with_aliases = false) const;
7456
7457 /// Check the name, case insensitive and underscore insensitive if set
7458 CLI11_NODISCARD bool check_name(std::string name_to_check) const;
7459
7460 /// Get the groups available directly from this option (in order)
7461 CLI11_NODISCARD std::vector<std::string> get_groups() const;
7462
7463 /// This gets a vector of pointers with the original parse order
7464 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::vector<Option*>& parse_order() const {
7465 return parse_order_;
7466 }
7467
7468 /// This returns the missing options from the current subcommand
7469 CLI11_NODISCARD std::vector<std::string> remaining(bool recurse = false) const;
7470
7471 /// This returns the missing options in a form ready for processing by another command line program
7472 CLI11_NODISCARD std::vector<std::string> remaining_for_passthrough(bool recurse = false) const;
7473
7474 /// This returns the number of remaining options, minus the -- separator
7475 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t remaining_size(bool recurse = false) const;
7476
7477 ///@}
7478
7479 protected:
7480 /// Check the options to make sure there are no conflicts.
7481 ///
7482 /// Currently checks to see if multiple positionals exist with unlimited args and checks if the min and max options
7483 /// are feasible
7484 void _validate() const;
7485
7486 /// configure subcommands to enable parsing through the current object
7487 /// set the correct fallthrough and prefix for nameless subcommands and manage the automatic enable or disable
7488 /// makes sure parent is set correctly
7489 void _configure();
7490
7491 /// Internal function to run (App) callback, bottom up
7492 void run_callback(bool final_mode = false, bool suppress_final_callback = false);
7493
7494 /// Check to see if a subcommand is valid. Give up immediately if subcommand max has been reached.
7495 CLI11_NODISCARD bool _valid_subcommand(const std::string& current, bool ignore_used = true) const;
7496
7497 /// Selects a Classifier enum based on the type of the current argument
7498 CLI11_NODISCARD detail::Classifier _recognize(const std::string& current, bool ignore_used_subcommands = true) const;
7499
7500 // The parse function is now broken into several parts, and part of process
7501
7502 /// Read and process a configuration file (main app only)
7503 void _process_config_file();
7504
7505 /// Get envname options if not yet passed. Runs on *all* subcommands.
7506 void _process_env();
7507
7508 /// Process callbacks. Runs on *all* subcommands.
7509 void _process_callbacks();
7510
7511 /// Run help flag processing if any are found.
7512 ///
7513 /// The flags allow recursive calls to remember if there was a help flag on a parent.
7514 void _process_help_flags(bool trigger_help = false, bool trigger_all_help = false) const;
7515
7516 /// Verify required options and cross requirements. Subcommands too (only if selected).
7517 void _process_requirements();
7518
7519 /// Process callbacks and such.
7520 void _process();
7521
7522 /// Throw an error if anything is left over and should not be.
7523 void _process_extras();
7524
7525 /// Throw an error if anything is left over and should not be.
7526 /// Modifies the args to fill in the missing items before throwing.
7527 void _process_extras(std::vector<std::string>& args);
7528
7529 /// Internal function to recursively increment the parsed counter on the current app as well unnamed subcommands
7530 void increment_parsed();
7531
7532 /// Internal parse function
7533 void _parse(std::vector<std::string>& args);
7534
7535 /// Internal parse function
7536 void _parse(std::vector<std::string>&& args);
7537
7538 /// Internal function to parse a stream
7539 void _parse_stream(std::istream& input);
7540
7541 /// Parse one config param, return false if not found in any subcommand, remove if it is
7542 ///
7543 /// If this has more than one dot.separated.name, go into the subcommand matching it
7544 /// Returns true if it managed to find the option, if false you'll need to remove the arg manually.
7545 void _parse_config(const std::vector<ConfigItem>& args);
7546
7547 /// Fill in a single config option
7548 bool _parse_single_config(const ConfigItem& item, std::size_t level = 0);
7549
7550 /// Parse "one" argument (some may eat more than one), delegate to parent if fails, add to missing if missing
7551 /// from main return false if the parse has failed and needs to return to parent
7552 bool _parse_single(std::vector<std::string>& args, bool& positional_only);
7553
7554 /// Count the required remaining positional arguments
7555 CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t _count_remaining_positionals(bool required_only = false) const;
7556
7557 /// Count the required remaining positional arguments
7558 CLI11_NODISCARD bool _has_remaining_positionals() const;
7559
7560 /// Parse a positional, go up the tree to check
7561 /// @param haltOnSubcommand if set to true the operation will not process subcommands merely return false
7562 /// Return true if the positional was used false otherwise
7563 bool _parse_positional(std::vector<std::string>& args, bool haltOnSubcommand);
7564
7565 /// Locate a subcommand by name with two conditions, should disabled subcommands be ignored, and should used
7566 /// subcommands be ignored
7567 CLI11_NODISCARD App* _find_subcommand(const std::string& subc_name, bool ignore_disabled, bool ignore_used) const noexcept;
7568
7569 /// Parse a subcommand, modify args and continue
7570 ///
7571 /// Unlike the others, this one will always allow fallthrough
7572 /// return true if the subcommand was processed false otherwise
7573 bool _parse_subcommand(std::vector<std::string>& args);
7574
7575 /// Parse a short (false) or long (true) argument, must be at the top of the list
7576 /// if local_processing_only is set to true then fallthrough is disabled will return false if not found
7577 /// return true if the argument was processed or false if nothing was done
7578 bool _parse_arg(std::vector<std::string>& args, detail::Classifier current_type, bool local_processing_only);
7579
7580 /// Trigger the pre_parse callback if needed
7581 void _trigger_pre_parse(std::size_t remaining_args);
7582
7583 /// Get the appropriate parent to fallthrough to which is the first one that has a name or the main app
7584 App* _get_fallthrough_parent();
7585
7586 /// Helper function to run through all possible comparisons of subcommand names to check there is no overlap
7587 CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string& _compare_subcommand_names(const App& subcom, const App& base) const;
7588
7589 /// Helper function to place extra values in the most appropriate position
7590 void _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier val_type, const std::string& val);
7591
7592 public:
7593 /// function that could be used by subclasses of App to shift options around into subcommands
7594 void _move_option(Option* opt, App* app);
7595 }; // namespace CLI
7596
7597 /// Extension of App to better manage groups of options
7598 class Option_group : public App {
7599 public:
7600 Option_group(std::string group_description, std::string group_name, App* parent)
7601 : App(std::move(group_description), "", parent) {
7602 group(group_name);
7603 // option groups should have automatic fallthrough
7604 }
7605 using App::add_option;
7606 /// Add an existing option to the Option_group
7607 Option* add_option(Option* opt) {
7608 if (get_parent() == nullptr) {
7609 throw OptionNotFound("Unable to locate the specified option");
7610 }
7611 get_parent()->_move_option(opt, this);
7612 return opt;
7613 }
7614 /// Add an existing option to the Option_group
7615 void add_options(Option* opt) {
7616 add_option(opt);
7617 }
7618 /// Add a bunch of options to the group
7619 template <typename... Args>
7620 void add_options(Option* opt, Args... args) {
7621 add_option(opt);
7622 add_options(args...);
7623 }
7624 using App::add_subcommand;
7625 /// Add an existing subcommand to be a member of an option_group
7626 App* add_subcommand(App* subcom) {
7627 App_p subc = subcom->get_parent()->get_subcommand_ptr(subcom);
7628 subc->get_parent()->remove_subcommand(subcom);
7629 add_subcommand(std::move(subc));
7630 return subcom;
7631 }
7632 };
7633
7634 /// Helper function to enable one option group/subcommand when another is used
7635 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App* trigger_app, App* app_to_enable);
7636
7637 /// Helper function to enable one option group/subcommand when another is used
7638 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App* trigger_app, std::vector<App*> apps_to_enable);
7639
7640 /// Helper function to disable one option group/subcommand when another is used
7641 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App* trigger_app, App* app_to_enable);
7642
7643 /// Helper function to disable one option group/subcommand when another is used
7644 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App* trigger_app, std::vector<App*> apps_to_enable);
7645
7646 /// Helper function to mark an option as deprecated
7647 CLI11_INLINE void deprecate_option(Option* opt, const std::string& replacement = "");
7648
7649 /// Helper function to mark an option as deprecated
7650 inline void deprecate_option(App* app, const std::string& option_name, const std::string& replacement = "") {
7651 auto* opt = app->get_option(option_name);
7652 deprecate_option(opt, replacement);
7653 }
7654
7655 /// Helper function to mark an option as deprecated
7656 inline void deprecate_option(App& app, const std::string& option_name, const std::string& replacement = "") {
7657 auto* opt = app.get_option(option_name);
7658 deprecate_option(opt, replacement);
7659 }
7660
7661 /// Helper function to mark an option as retired
7662 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App* app, Option* opt);
7663
7664 /// Helper function to mark an option as retired
7665 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App& app, Option* opt);
7666
7667 /// Helper function to mark an option as retired
7668 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App* app, const std::string& option_name);
7669
7670 /// Helper function to mark an option as retired
7671 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App& app, const std::string& option_name);
7672
7673 namespace detail {
7674 /// This class is simply to allow tests access to App's protected functions
7675 struct AppFriend {
7676#ifdef CLI11_CPP14
7677
7678 /// Wrap _parse_short, perfectly forward arguments and return
7679 template <typename... Args>
7680 static decltype(auto) parse_arg(App* app, Args&&... args) {
7681 return app->_parse_arg(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7682 }
7683
7684 /// Wrap _parse_subcommand, perfectly forward arguments and return
7685 template <typename... Args>
7686 static decltype(auto) parse_subcommand(App* app, Args&&... args) {
7687 return app->_parse_subcommand(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7688 }
7689#else
7690 /// Wrap _parse_short, perfectly forward arguments and return
7691 template <typename... Args>
7692 static auto parse_arg(App* app, Args&&... args) -> typename std::result_of<decltype (&App::_parse_arg)(App, Args...)>::type {
7693 return app->_parse_arg(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7694 }
7695
7696 /// Wrap _parse_subcommand, perfectly forward arguments and return
7697 template <typename... Args>
7698 static auto parse_subcommand(App* app, Args&&... args) ->
7699 typename std::result_of<decltype (&App::_parse_subcommand)(App, Args...)>::type {
7700 return app->_parse_subcommand(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7701 }
7702#endif
7703 /// Wrap the fallthrough parent function to make sure that is working correctly
7704 static App* get_fallthrough_parent(App* app) {
7705 return app->_get_fallthrough_parent();
7706 }
7707 };
7708 } // namespace detail
7709
7710 CLI11_INLINE App::App(std::string app_description, std::string app_name, App* parent)
7711 : name_(std::move(app_name))
7712 , description_(std::move(app_description))
7713 , parent_(parent) {
7714 // Inherit if not from a nullptr
7715 if (parent_ != nullptr) {
7716 if (parent_->help_ptr_ != nullptr)
7717 set_help_flag(parent_->help_ptr_->get_name(false, true), parent_->help_ptr_->get_description());
7718 if (parent_->help_all_ptr_ != nullptr)
7719 set_help_all_flag(parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_name(false, true), parent_->help_all_ptr_->get_description());
7720
7721 /// OptionDefaults
7722 option_defaults_ = parent_->option_defaults_;
7723
7724 // INHERITABLE
7725 failure_message_ = parent_->failure_message_;
7726 allow_extras_ = parent_->allow_extras_;
7727 allow_config_extras_ = parent_->allow_config_extras_;
7728 prefix_command_ = parent_->prefix_command_;
7729 immediate_callback_ = parent_->immediate_callback_;
7730 ignore_case_ = parent_->ignore_case_;
7731 ignore_underscore_ = parent_->ignore_underscore_;
7732 fallthrough_ = parent_->fallthrough_;
7733 validate_positionals_ = parent_->validate_positionals_;
7734 validate_optional_arguments_ = parent_->validate_optional_arguments_;
7735 configurable_ = parent_->configurable_;
7736 allow_windows_style_options_ = parent_->allow_windows_style_options_;
7737 group_ = parent_->group_;
7738 usage_ = parent_->usage_;
7739 footer_ = parent_->footer_;
7740 formatter_ = parent_->formatter_;
7741 config_formatter_ = parent_->config_formatter_;
7742 require_subcommand_max_ = parent_->require_subcommand_max_;
7743 }
7744 }
7745
7746 CLI11_INLINE App* App::name(std::string app_name) {
7747 if (parent_ != nullptr) {
7748 auto oname = name_;
7749 name_ = app_name;
7750 const auto& res = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
7751 if (!res.empty()) {
7752 name_ = oname;
7753 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded(app_name + " conflicts with existing subcommand names"));
7754 }
7755 } else {
7756 name_ = app_name;
7757 }
7758 has_automatic_name_ = false;
7759 return this;
7760 }
7761
7762 CLI11_INLINE App* App::alias(std::string app_name) {
7763 if (app_name.empty() || !detail::valid_alias_name_string(app_name)) {
7764 throw IncorrectConstruction("Aliases may not be empty or contain newlines or null characters");
7765 }
7766 if (parent_ != nullptr) {
7767 aliases_.push_back(app_name);
7768 const auto& res = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *_get_fallthrough_parent());
7769 if (!res.empty()) {
7770 aliases_.pop_back();
7771 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("alias already matches an existing subcommand: " + app_name));
7772 }
7773 } else {
7774 aliases_.push_back(app_name);
7775 }
7776
7777 return this;
7778 }
7779
7780 CLI11_INLINE App* App::immediate_callback(bool immediate) {
7781 immediate_callback_ = immediate;
7782 if (immediate_callback_) {
7783 if (final_callback_ && !(parse_complete_callback_)) {
7784 std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
7785 }
7786 } else if (!(final_callback_) && parse_complete_callback_) {
7787 std::swap(final_callback_, parse_complete_callback_);
7788 }
7789 return this;
7790 }
7791
7792 CLI11_INLINE App* App::ignore_case(bool value) {
7793 if (value && !ignore_case_) {
7794 ignore_case_ = true;
7795 auto* p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
7796 const auto& match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
7797 if (!match.empty()) {
7798 ignore_case_ = false; // we are throwing so need to be exception invariant
7799 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore case would cause subcommand name conflicts: " + match);
7800 }
7801 }
7802 ignore_case_ = value;
7803 return this;
7804 }
7805
7806 CLI11_INLINE App* App::ignore_underscore(bool value) {
7807 if (value && !ignore_underscore_) {
7808 ignore_underscore_ = true;
7809 auto* p = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
7810 const auto& match = _compare_subcommand_names(*this, *p);
7811 if (!match.empty()) {
7812 ignore_underscore_ = false;
7813 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("ignore underscore would cause subcommand name conflicts: " + match);
7814 }
7815 }
7816 ignore_underscore_ = value;
7817 return this;
7818 }
7819
7820 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::add_option(std::string option_name,
7821 callback_t option_callback,
7822 std::string option_description,
7823 bool defaulted,
7824 std::function<std::string()> func) {
7825 Option myopt{option_name, option_description, option_callback, this};
7826
7827 if (std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [&myopt](const Option_p& v) {
7828 return *v == myopt;
7829 }) == std::end(options_)) {
7830 options_.emplace_back();
7831 Option_p& option = options_.back();
7832 option.reset(new Option(option_name, option_description, option_callback, this));
7833
7834 // Set the default string capture function
7835 option->default_function(func);
7836
7837 // For compatibility with CLI11 1.7 and before, capture the default string here
7838 if (defaulted)
7839 option->capture_default_str();
7840
7841 // Transfer defaults to the new option
7842 option_defaults_.copy_to(option.get());
7843
7844 // Don't bother to capture if we already did
7845 if (!defaulted && option->get_always_capture_default())
7846 option->capture_default_str();
7847
7848 return option.get();
7849 }
7850 // we know something matches now find what it is so we can produce more error information
7851 for (auto& opt : options_) {
7852 const auto& matchname = opt->matching_name(myopt);
7853 if (!matchname.empty()) {
7854 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("added option matched existing option name: " + matchname));
7855 }
7856 }
7857 // this line should not be reached the above loop should trigger the throw
7858 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("added option matched existing option name")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
7859 }
7860
7861 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::set_help_flag(std::string flag_name, const std::string& help_description) {
7862 // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to help_description
7863 if (help_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7864 remove_option(help_ptr_);
7865 help_ptr_ = nullptr;
7866 }
7867
7868 // Empty name will simply remove the help flag
7869 if (!flag_name.empty()) {
7870 help_ptr_ = add_flag(flag_name, help_description);
7871 help_ptr_->configurable(false);
7872 }
7873
7874 return help_ptr_;
7875 }
7876
7877 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::set_help_all_flag(std::string help_name, const std::string& help_description) {
7878 // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to flag_description
7879 if (help_all_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7880 remove_option(help_all_ptr_);
7881 help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
7882 }
7883
7884 // Empty name will simply remove the help all flag
7885 if (!help_name.empty()) {
7886 help_all_ptr_ = add_flag(help_name, help_description);
7887 help_all_ptr_->configurable(false);
7888 }
7889
7890 return help_all_ptr_;
7891 }
7892
7893 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::set_version_flag(std::string flag_name, const std::string& versionString, const std::string& version_help) {
7894 // take flag_description by const reference otherwise add_flag tries to assign to version_description
7895 if (version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7896 remove_option(version_ptr_);
7897 version_ptr_ = nullptr;
7898 }
7899
7900 // Empty name will simply remove the version flag
7901 if (!flag_name.empty()) {
7902 version_ptr_ = add_flag_callback(
7903 flag_name,
7904 [versionString]() {
7905 throw(CLI::CallForVersion(versionString, 0));
7906 },
7907 version_help);
7908 version_ptr_->configurable(false);
7909 }
7910
7911 return version_ptr_;
7912 }
7913
7914 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::set_version_flag(std::string flag_name, std::function<std::string()> vfunc, const std::string& version_help) {
7915 if (version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7916 remove_option(version_ptr_);
7917 version_ptr_ = nullptr;
7918 }
7919
7920 // Empty name will simply remove the version flag
7921 if (!flag_name.empty()) {
7922 version_ptr_ = add_flag_callback(
7923 flag_name,
7924 [vfunc]() {
7925 throw(CLI::CallForVersion(vfunc(), 0));
7926 },
7927 version_help);
7928 version_ptr_->configurable(false);
7929 }
7930
7931 return version_ptr_;
7932 }
7933
7934 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::_add_flag_internal(std::string flag_name, CLI::callback_t fun, std::string flag_description) {
7935 Option* opt = nullptr;
7936 if (detail::has_default_flag_values(flag_name)) {
7937 // check for default values and if it has them
7938 auto flag_defaults = detail::get_default_flag_values(flag_name);
7939 detail::remove_default_flag_values(flag_name);
7940 opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description), false);
7941 for (const auto& fname : flag_defaults)
7942 opt->fnames_.push_back(fname.first);
7943 opt->default_flag_values_ = std::move(flag_defaults);
7944 } else {
7945 opt = add_option(std::move(flag_name), std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description), false);
7946 }
7947 // flags cannot have positional values
7948 if (opt->get_positional()) {
7949 auto pos_name = opt->get_name(true);
7950 remove_option(opt);
7951 throw IncorrectConstruction::PositionalFlag(pos_name);
7952 }
7953 opt->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::TakeLast);
7954 opt->expected(0);
7955 opt->required(false);
7956 return opt;
7957 }
7958
7959 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::add_flag_callback(std::string flag_name,
7960 std::function<void(void)> function, ///< A function to call, void(void)
7961 std::string flag_description) {
7962 CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t& res) {
7963 using CLI::detail::lexical_cast;
7964 bool trigger{false};
7965 auto result = lexical_cast(res[0], trigger);
7966 if (result && trigger) {
7967 function();
7968 }
7969 return result;
7970 };
7971 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description));
7972 }
7973
7974 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::add_flag_function(std::string flag_name,
7975 std::function<void(std::int64_t)> function, ///< A function to call, void(int)
7976 std::string flag_description) {
7977 CLI::callback_t fun = [function](const CLI::results_t& res) {
7978 using CLI::detail::lexical_cast;
7979 std::int64_t flag_count{0};
7980 lexical_cast(res[0], flag_count);
7981 function(flag_count);
7982 return true;
7983 };
7984 return _add_flag_internal(flag_name, std::move(fun), std::move(flag_description))->multi_option_policy(MultiOptionPolicy::Sum);
7985 }
7986
7987 CLI11_INLINE Option*
7988 App::set_config(std::string option_name, std::string default_filename, const std::string& help_message, bool config_required) {
7989 // Remove existing config if present
7990 if (config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7991 remove_option(config_ptr_);
7992 config_ptr_ = nullptr; // need to remove the config_ptr completely
7993 }
7994
7995 // Only add config if option passed
7996 if (!option_name.empty()) {
7997 config_ptr_ = add_option(option_name, help_message);
7998 if (config_required) {
7999 config_ptr_->required();
8000 }
8001 if (!default_filename.empty()) {
8002 config_ptr_->default_str(std::move(default_filename));
8003 }
8004 config_ptr_->configurable(false);
8005 }
8006
8007 return config_ptr_;
8008 }
8009
8010 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_option(Option* opt) {
8011 // Make sure no links exist
8012 for (Option_p& op : options_) {
8013 op->remove_needs(opt);
8014 op->remove_excludes(opt);
8015 }
8016
8017 if (help_ptr_ == opt)
8018 help_ptr_ = nullptr;
8019 if (help_all_ptr_ == opt)
8020 help_all_ptr_ = nullptr;
8021
8022 auto iterator = std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [opt](const Option_p& v) {
8023 return v.get() == opt;
8024 });
8025 if (iterator != std::end(options_)) {
8026 options_.erase(iterator);
8027 return true;
8028 }
8029 return false;
8030 }
8031
8032 CLI11_INLINE App* App::add_subcommand(std::string subcommand_name, std::string subcommand_description) {
8033 if (!subcommand_name.empty() && !detail::valid_name_string(subcommand_name)) {
8034 if (!detail::valid_first_char(subcommand_name[0])) {
8035 throw IncorrectConstruction("Subcommand name starts with invalid character, '!' and '-' are not allowed");
8036 }
8037 for (auto c : subcommand_name) {
8038 if (!detail::valid_later_char(c)) {
8039 throw IncorrectConstruction(std::string("Subcommand name contains invalid character ('") + c +
8040 "'), all characters are allowed except"
8041 "'=',':','{','}', and ' '");
8042 }
8043 }
8044 }
8045 CLI::App_p subcom = std::shared_ptr<App>(new App(std::move(subcommand_description), subcommand_name, this));
8046 return add_subcommand(std::move(subcom));
8047 }
8048
8049 CLI11_INLINE App* App::add_subcommand(CLI::App_p subcom) {
8050 if (!subcom)
8051 throw IncorrectConstruction("passed App is not valid");
8052 auto* ckapp = (name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
8053 const auto& mstrg = _compare_subcommand_names(*subcom, *ckapp);
8054 if (!mstrg.empty()) {
8055 throw(OptionAlreadyAdded("subcommand name or alias matches existing subcommand: " + mstrg));
8056 }
8057 subcom->parent_ = this;
8058 subcommands_.push_back(std::move(subcom));
8059 return subcommands_.back().get();
8060 }
8061
8062 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_subcommand(App* subcom) {
8063 // Make sure no links exist
8064 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
8065 sub->remove_excludes(subcom);
8066 sub->remove_needs(subcom);
8067 }
8068
8069 auto iterator = std::find_if(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), [subcom](const App_p& v) {
8070 return v.get() == subcom;
8071 });
8072 if (iterator != std::end(subcommands_)) {
8073 subcommands_.erase(iterator);
8074 return true;
8075 }
8076 return false;
8077 }
8078
8079 CLI11_INLINE App* App::get_subcommand(const App* subcom) const {
8080 if (subcom == nullptr)
8081 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
8082 for (const App_p& subcomptr : subcommands_)
8083 if (subcomptr.get() == subcom)
8084 return subcomptr.get();
8085 throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
8086 }
8087
8088 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE App* App::get_subcommand(std::string subcom) const {
8089 auto* subc = _find_subcommand(subcom, false, false);
8090 if (subc == nullptr)
8091 throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
8092 return subc;
8093 }
8094
8095 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE App* App::get_subcommand_no_throw(std::string subcom) const {
8096 return _find_subcommand(subcom, false, false);
8097 }
8098
8099 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE App* App::get_subcommand(int index) const {
8100 if (index >= 0) {
8101 auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
8102 if (uindex < subcommands_.size())
8103 return subcommands_[uindex].get();
8104 }
8105 throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
8106 }
8107
8108 CLI11_INLINE CLI::App_p App::get_subcommand_ptr(App* subcom) const {
8109 if (subcom == nullptr)
8110 throw OptionNotFound("nullptr passed");
8111 for (const App_p& subcomptr : subcommands_)
8112 if (subcomptr.get() == subcom)
8113 return subcomptr;
8114 throw OptionNotFound(subcom->get_name());
8115 }
8116
8117 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE CLI::App_p App::get_subcommand_ptr(std::string subcom) const {
8118 for (const App_p& subcomptr : subcommands_)
8119 if (subcomptr->check_name(subcom))
8120 return subcomptr;
8121 throw OptionNotFound(subcom);
8122 }
8123
8124 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE CLI::App_p App::get_subcommand_ptr(int index) const {
8125 if (index >= 0) {
8126 auto uindex = static_cast<unsigned>(index);
8127 if (uindex < subcommands_.size())
8128 return subcommands_[uindex];
8129 }
8130 throw OptionNotFound(std::to_string(index));
8131 }
8132
8133 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE CLI::App* App::get_option_group(std::string group_name) const {
8134 for (const App_p& app : subcommands_) {
8135 if (app->name_.empty() && app->group_ == group_name) {
8136 return app.get();
8137 }
8138 }
8139 throw OptionNotFound(group_name);
8140 }
8141
8142 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::size_t App::count_all() const {
8143 std::size_t cnt{0};
8144 for (const auto& opt : options_) {
8145 cnt += opt->count();
8146 }
8147 for (const auto& sub : subcommands_) {
8148 cnt += sub->count_all();
8149 }
8150 if (!get_name().empty()) { // for named subcommands add the number of times the subcommand was called
8151 cnt += parsed_;
8152 }
8153 return cnt;
8154 }
8155
8156 CLI11_INLINE void App::clear() {
8157 parsed_ = 0;
8158 pre_parse_called_ = false;
8159
8160 missing_.clear();
8161 parsed_subcommands_.clear();
8162 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
8163 opt->clear();
8164 }
8165 for (const App_p& subc : subcommands_) {
8166 subc->clear();
8167 }
8168 }
8169
8170 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse() {
8171 parse(argc(), argv());
8172 } // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8173
8174 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse(int argc, const char* const* argv) {
8175 parse_char_t(argc, argv);
8176 }
8177 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse(int argc, const wchar_t* const* argv) {
8178 parse_char_t(argc, argv);
8179 }
8180
8181 namespace detail {
8182
8183 // Do nothing or perform narrowing
8184 CLI11_INLINE const char* maybe_narrow(const char* str) {
8185 return str;
8186 }
8187 CLI11_INLINE std::string maybe_narrow(const wchar_t* str) {
8188 return narrow(str);
8189 }
8190
8191 } // namespace detail
8192
8193 template <class CharT>
8194 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse_char_t(int argc, const CharT* const* argv) {
8195 // If the name is not set, read from command line
8196 if (name_.empty() || has_automatic_name_) {
8197 has_automatic_name_ = true;
8198 name_ = detail::maybe_narrow(argv[0]);
8199 }
8200
8201 std::vector<std::string> args;
8202 args.reserve(static_cast<std::size_t>(argc) - 1U);
8203 for (auto i = static_cast<std::size_t>(argc) - 1U; i > 0U; --i)
8204 args.emplace_back(detail::maybe_narrow(argv[i]));
8205
8206 parse(std::move(args));
8207 }
8208
8209 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse(std::string commandline, bool program_name_included) {
8210 if (program_name_included) {
8211 auto nstr = detail::split_program_name(commandline);
8212 if ((name_.empty()) || (has_automatic_name_)) {
8213 has_automatic_name_ = true;
8214 name_ = nstr.first;
8215 }
8216 commandline = std::move(nstr.second);
8217 } else {
8218 detail::trim(commandline);
8219 }
8220 // the next section of code is to deal with quoted arguments after an '=' or ':' for windows like operations
8221 if (!commandline.empty()) {
8222 commandline = detail::find_and_modify(commandline, "=", detail::escape_detect);
8223 if (allow_windows_style_options_)
8224 commandline = detail::find_and_modify(commandline, ":", detail::escape_detect);
8225 }
8226
8227 auto args = detail::split_up(std::move(commandline));
8228 // remove all empty strings
8229 args.erase(std::remove(args.begin(), args.end(), std::string{}), args.end());
8230 std::reverse(args.begin(), args.end());
8231
8232 parse(std::move(args));
8233 }
8234
8235 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse(std::wstring commandline, bool program_name_included) {
8236 parse(narrow(commandline), program_name_included);
8237 }
8238
8239 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse(std::vector<std::string>& args) {
8240 // Clear if parsed
8241 if (parsed_ > 0)
8242 clear();
8243
8244 // parsed_ is incremented in commands/subcommands,
8245 // but placed here to make sure this is cleared when
8246 // running parse after an error is thrown, even by _validate or _configure.
8247 parsed_ = 1;
8248 _validate();
8249 _configure();
8250 // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
8251 parent_ = nullptr;
8252 parsed_ = 0;
8253
8254 _parse(args);
8255 run_callback();
8256 }
8257
8258 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse(std::vector<std::string>&& args) {
8259 // Clear if parsed
8260 if (parsed_ > 0)
8261 clear();
8262
8263 // parsed_ is incremented in commands/subcommands,
8264 // but placed here to make sure this is cleared when
8265 // running parse after an error is thrown, even by _validate or _configure.
8266 parsed_ = 1;
8267 _validate();
8268 _configure();
8269 // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
8270 parent_ = nullptr;
8271 parsed_ = 0;
8272
8273 _parse(std::move(args));
8274 run_callback();
8275 }
8276
8277 CLI11_INLINE void App::parse_from_stream(std::istream& input) {
8278 if (parsed_ == 0) {
8279 _validate();
8280 _configure();
8281 // set the parent as nullptr as this object should be the top now
8282 }
8283
8284 _parse_stream(input);
8285 run_callback();
8286 }
8287
8288 CLI11_INLINE int App::exit(const Error& e, std::ostream& out, std::ostream& err) const {
8289 /// Avoid printing anything if this is a CLI::RuntimeError
8290 if (e.get_name() == "RuntimeError")
8291 return e.get_exit_code();
8292
8293 if (e.get_name() == "CallForHelp") {
8294 out << help();
8295 return e.get_exit_code();
8296 }
8297
8298 if (e.get_name() == "CallForAllHelp") {
8299 out << help("", AppFormatMode::All);
8300 return e.get_exit_code();
8301 }
8302
8303 if (e.get_name() == "CallForVersion") {
8304 out << e.what() << std::endl;
8305 return e.get_exit_code();
8306 }
8307
8308 if (e.get_exit_code() != static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::Success)) {
8309 if (failure_message_)
8310 err << failure_message_(this, e) << std::flush;
8311 }
8312
8313 return e.get_exit_code();
8314 }
8315
8316 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<const App*> App::get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(const App*)>& filter) const {
8317 std::vector<const App*> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
8318 std::transform(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), std::begin(subcomms), [](const App_p& v) {
8319 return v.get();
8320 });
8321
8322 if (filter) {
8323 subcomms.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms),
8324 std::end(subcomms),
8325 [&filter](const App* app) {
8326 return !filter(app);
8327 }),
8328 std::end(subcomms));
8329 }
8330
8331 return subcomms;
8332 }
8333
8334 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<App*> App::get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(App*)>& filter) {
8335 std::vector<App*> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
8336 std::transform(std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), std::begin(subcomms), [](const App_p& v) {
8337 return v.get();
8338 });
8339
8340 if (filter) {
8341 subcomms.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms),
8342 std::end(subcomms),
8343 [&filter](App* app) {
8344 return !filter(app);
8345 }),
8346 std::end(subcomms));
8347 }
8348
8349 return subcomms;
8350 }
8351
8352 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_excludes(Option* opt) {
8353 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_options_), std::end(exclude_options_), opt);
8354 if (iterator == std::end(exclude_options_)) {
8355 return false;
8356 }
8357 exclude_options_.erase(iterator);
8358 return true;
8359 }
8360
8361 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_excludes(App* app) {
8362 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_subcommands_), std::end(exclude_subcommands_), app);
8363 if (iterator == std::end(exclude_subcommands_)) {
8364 return false;
8365 }
8366 auto* other_app = *iterator;
8367 exclude_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
8368 other_app->remove_excludes(this);
8369 return true;
8370 }
8371
8372 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_needs(Option* opt) {
8373 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_options_), std::end(need_options_), opt);
8374 if (iterator == std::end(need_options_)) {
8375 return false;
8376 }
8377 need_options_.erase(iterator);
8378 return true;
8379 }
8380
8381 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_needs(App* app) {
8382 auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_subcommands_), std::end(need_subcommands_), app);
8383 if (iterator == std::end(need_subcommands_)) {
8384 return false;
8385 }
8386 need_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
8387 return true;
8388 }
8389
8390 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string App::help(std::string prev, AppFormatMode mode) const {
8391 if (prev.empty())
8392 prev = get_name();
8393 else
8394 prev += " " + get_name();
8395
8396 // Delegate to subcommand if needed
8397 auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
8398 if (!selected_subcommands.empty()) {
8399 return selected_subcommands.back()->help(prev, mode);
8400 }
8401 return formatter_->make_help(this, prev, mode);
8402 }
8403
8404 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string App::version() const {
8405 std::string val;
8406 if (version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
8407 auto rv = version_ptr_->results();
8408 version_ptr_->clear();
8409 version_ptr_->add_result("true");
8410 try {
8411 version_ptr_->run_callback();
8412 } catch (const CLI::CallForVersion& cfv) {
8413 val = cfv.what();
8414 }
8415 version_ptr_->clear();
8416 version_ptr_->add_result(rv);
8417 }
8418 return val;
8419 }
8420
8421 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<const Option*> App::get_options(const std::function<bool(const Option*)> filter) const {
8422 std::vector<const Option*> options(options_.size());
8423 std::transform(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), std::begin(options), [](const Option_p& val) {
8424 return val.get();
8425 });
8426
8427 if (filter) {
8428 options.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(options),
8429 std::end(options),
8430 [&filter](const Option* opt) {
8431 return !filter(opt);
8432 }),
8433 std::end(options));
8434 }
8435
8436 return options;
8437 }
8438
8439 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<Option*> App::get_options(const std::function<bool(Option*)> filter) {
8440 std::vector<Option*> options(options_.size());
8441 std::transform(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), std::begin(options), [](const Option_p& val) {
8442 return val.get();
8443 });
8444
8445 if (filter) {
8446 options.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(options),
8447 std::end(options),
8448 [&filter](Option* opt) {
8449 return !filter(opt);
8450 }),
8451 std::end(options));
8452 }
8453
8454 return options;
8455 }
8456
8457 CLI11_INLINE Option* App::get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) noexcept {
8458 for (Option_p& opt : options_) {
8459 if (opt->check_name(option_name)) {
8460 return opt.get();
8461 }
8462 }
8463 for (auto& subc : subcommands_) {
8464 // also check down into nameless subcommands
8465 if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
8466 auto* opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
8467 if (opt != nullptr) {
8468 return opt;
8469 }
8470 }
8471 }
8472 return nullptr;
8473 }
8474
8475 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const Option* App::get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) const noexcept {
8476 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
8477 if (opt->check_name(option_name)) {
8478 return opt.get();
8479 }
8480 }
8481 for (const auto& subc : subcommands_) {
8482 // also check down into nameless subcommands
8483 if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
8484 auto* opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
8485 if (opt != nullptr) {
8486 return opt;
8487 }
8488 }
8489 }
8490 return nullptr;
8491 }
8492
8493 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string App::get_display_name(bool with_aliases) const {
8494 if (name_.empty()) {
8495 return std::string("[Option Group: ") + get_group() + "]";
8496 }
8497 if (aliases_.empty() || !with_aliases) {
8498 return name_;
8499 }
8500 std::string dispname = name_;
8501 for (const auto& lalias : aliases_) {
8502 dispname.push_back(',');
8503 dispname.push_back(' ');
8504 dispname.append(lalias);
8505 }
8506 return dispname;
8507 }
8508
8509 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool App::check_name(std::string name_to_check) const {
8510 std::string local_name = name_;
8511 if (ignore_underscore_) {
8512 local_name = detail::remove_underscore(name_);
8513 name_to_check = detail::remove_underscore(name_to_check);
8514 }
8515 if (ignore_case_) {
8516 local_name = detail::to_lower(name_);
8517 name_to_check = detail::to_lower(name_to_check);
8518 }
8519
8520 if (local_name == name_to_check) {
8521 return true;
8522 }
8523 for (auto les : aliases_) { // NOLINT(performance-for-range-copy)
8524 if (ignore_underscore_) {
8525 les = detail::remove_underscore(les);
8526 }
8527 if (ignore_case_) {
8528 les = detail::to_lower(les);
8529 }
8530 if (les == name_to_check) {
8531 return true;
8532 }
8533 }
8534 return false;
8535 }
8536
8537 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> App::get_groups() const {
8538 std::vector<std::string> groups;
8539
8540 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
8541 // Add group if it is not already in there
8542 if (std::find(groups.begin(), groups.end(), opt->get_group()) == groups.end()) {
8543 groups.push_back(opt->get_group());
8544 }
8545 }
8546
8547 return groups;
8548 }
8549
8550 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> App::remaining(bool recurse) const {
8551 std::vector<std::string> miss_list;
8552 for (const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>& miss : missing_) {
8553 miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
8554 }
8555 // Get from a subcommand that may allow extras
8556 if (recurse) {
8557 if (!allow_extras_) {
8558 for (const auto& sub : subcommands_) {
8559 if (sub->name_.empty() && !sub->missing_.empty()) {
8560 for (const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>& miss : sub->missing_) {
8561 miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
8562 }
8563 }
8564 }
8565 }
8566 // Recurse into subcommands
8567
8568 for (const App* sub : parsed_subcommands_) {
8569 std::vector<std::string> output = sub->remaining(recurse);
8570 std::copy(std::begin(output), std::end(output), std::back_inserter(miss_list));
8571 }
8572 }
8573 return miss_list;
8574 }
8575
8576 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> App::remaining_for_passthrough(bool recurse) const {
8577 std::vector<std::string> miss_list = remaining(recurse);
8578 std::reverse(std::begin(miss_list), std::end(miss_list));
8579 return miss_list;
8580 }
8581
8582 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::size_t App::remaining_size(bool recurse) const {
8583 auto remaining_options = static_cast<std::size_t>(
8584 std::count_if(std::begin(missing_), std::end(missing_), [](const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string>& val) {
8585 return val.first != detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
8586 }));
8587
8588 if (recurse) {
8589 for (const App_p& sub : subcommands_) {
8590 remaining_options += sub->remaining_size(recurse);
8591 }
8592 }
8593 return remaining_options;
8594 }
8595
8596 CLI11_INLINE void App::_validate() const {
8597 // count the number of positional only args
8598 auto pcount = std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p& opt) {
8599 return opt->get_items_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size && !opt->nonpositional();
8600 });
8601 if (pcount > 1) {
8602 auto pcount_req = std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p& opt) {
8603 return opt->get_items_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size && !opt->nonpositional() && opt->get_required();
8604 });
8605 if (pcount - pcount_req > 1) {
8606 throw InvalidError(name_);
8607 }
8608 }
8609
8610 std::size_t nameless_subs{0};
8611 for (const App_p& app : subcommands_) {
8612 app->_validate();
8613 if (app->get_name().empty())
8614 ++nameless_subs;
8615 }
8616
8617 if (require_option_min_ > 0) {
8618 if (require_option_max_ > 0) {
8619 if (require_option_max_ < require_option_min_) {
8620 throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than required max options", ExitCodes::InvalidError));
8621 }
8622 }
8623 if (require_option_min_ > (options_.size() + nameless_subs)) {
8624 throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than number of available options", ExitCodes::InvalidError));
8625 }
8626 }
8627 }
8628
8629 CLI11_INLINE void App::_configure() {
8630 if (default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) {
8631 disabled_ = false;
8632 } else if (default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) {
8633 disabled_ = true;
8634 }
8635 for (const App_p& app : subcommands_) {
8636 if (app->has_automatic_name_) {
8637 app->name_.clear();
8638 }
8639 if (app->name_.empty()) {
8640 app->fallthrough_ = false; // make sure fallthrough_ is false to prevent infinite loop
8641 app->prefix_command_ = false;
8642 }
8643 // make sure the parent is set to be this object in preparation for parse
8644 app->parent_ = this;
8645 app->_configure();
8646 }
8647 }
8648
8649 CLI11_INLINE void App::run_callback(bool final_mode, bool suppress_final_callback) {
8650 pre_callback();
8651 // in the main app if immediate_callback_ is set it runs the main callback before the used subcommands
8652 if (!final_mode && parse_complete_callback_) {
8653 parse_complete_callback_();
8654 }
8655 // run the callbacks for the received subcommands
8656 for (App* subc : get_subcommands()) {
8657 if (subc->parent_ == this) {
8658 subc->run_callback(true, suppress_final_callback);
8659 }
8660 }
8661 // now run callbacks for option_groups
8662 for (auto& subc : subcommands_) {
8663 if (subc->name_.empty() && subc->count_all() > 0) {
8664 subc->run_callback(true, suppress_final_callback);
8665 }
8666 }
8667
8668 // finally run the main callback
8669 if (final_callback_ && (parsed_ > 0) && (!suppress_final_callback)) {
8670 if (!name_.empty() || count_all() > 0 || parent_ == nullptr) {
8671 final_callback_();
8672 }
8673 }
8674 }
8675
8676 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool App::_valid_subcommand(const std::string& current, bool ignore_used) const {
8677 // Don't match if max has been reached - but still check parents
8678 if (require_subcommand_max_ != 0 && parsed_subcommands_.size() >= require_subcommand_max_) {
8679 return parent_ != nullptr && parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
8680 }
8681 auto* com = _find_subcommand(current, true, ignore_used);
8682 if (com != nullptr) {
8683 return true;
8684 }
8685 // Check parent if exists, else return false
8686 return parent_ != nullptr && parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
8687 }
8688
8689 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE detail::Classifier App::_recognize(const std::string& current, bool ignore_used_subcommands) const {
8690 std::string dummy1, dummy2;
8691
8692 if (current == "--")
8693 return detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
8694 if (_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used_subcommands))
8695 return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND;
8696 if (detail::split_long(current, dummy1, dummy2))
8697 return detail::Classifier::LONG;
8698 if (detail::split_short(current, dummy1, dummy2)) {
8699 if (dummy1[0] >= '0' && dummy1[0] <= '9') {
8700 if (get_option_no_throw(std::string{'-', dummy1[0]}) == nullptr) {
8701 return detail::Classifier::NONE;
8702 }
8703 }
8704 return detail::Classifier::SHORT;
8705 }
8706 if ((allow_windows_style_options_) && (detail::split_windows_style(current, dummy1, dummy2)))
8707 return detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE;
8708 if ((current == "++") && !name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr)
8709 return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR;
8710 auto dotloc = current.find_first_of('.');
8711 if (dotloc != std::string::npos) {
8712 auto* cm = _find_subcommand(current.substr(0, dotloc), true, ignore_used_subcommands);
8713 if (cm != nullptr) {
8714 auto res = cm->_recognize(current.substr(dotloc + 1), ignore_used_subcommands);
8715 if (res == detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND) {
8716 return res;
8717 }
8718 }
8719 }
8720 return detail::Classifier::NONE;
8721 }
8722
8723 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_config_file() {
8724 if (config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
8725 bool const config_required = config_ptr_->get_required();
8726 auto file_given = config_ptr_->count() > 0;
8727 auto config_files = config_ptr_->as<std::vector<std::string>>();
8728 if (config_files.empty() || config_files.front().empty()) {
8729 if (config_required) {
8730 throw FileError::Missing("no specified config file");
8731 }
8732 return;
8733 }
8734 for (auto rit = config_files.rbegin(); rit != config_files.rend(); ++rit) {
8735 const auto& config_file = *rit;
8736 auto path_result = detail::check_path(config_file.c_str());
8737 if (path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
8738 try {
8739 std::vector<ConfigItem> const values = config_formatter_->from_file(config_file);
8740 _parse_config(values);
8741 if (!file_given) {
8742 config_ptr_->add_result(config_file);
8743 }
8744 } catch (const FileError&) {
8745 if (config_required || file_given)
8746 throw;
8747 }
8748 } else if (config_required || file_given) {
8749 throw FileError::Missing(config_file);
8750 }
8751 }
8752 }
8753 }
8754
8755 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_env() {
8756 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
8757 if (opt->count() == 0 && !opt->envname_.empty()) {
8758 char* buffer = nullptr;
8759 std::string ename_string;
8760
8761#ifdef _MSC_VER
8762 // Windows version
8763 std::size_t sz = 0;
8764 if (_dupenv_s(&buffer, &sz, opt->envname_.c_str()) == 0 && buffer != nullptr) {
8765 ename_string = std::string(buffer);
8766 free(buffer);
8767 }
8768#else
8769 // This also works on Windows, but gives a warning
8770 buffer = std::getenv(opt->envname_.c_str());
8771 if (buffer != nullptr)
8772 ename_string = std::string(buffer);
8773#endif
8774
8775 if (!ename_string.empty()) {
8776 opt->add_result(ename_string);
8777 }
8778 }
8779 }
8780
8781 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
8782 if (sub->get_name().empty() || !sub->parse_complete_callback_)
8783 sub->_process_env();
8784 }
8785 }
8786
