8787 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_callbacks() {
8788 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
8789 // process the priority option_groups first
8790 if (sub->get_name().empty() && sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
8791 if (sub->count_all() > 0) {
8792 sub->_process_callbacks();
8793 sub->run_callback();
8794 }
8795 }
8796 }
8797
8798 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
8799 if ((*opt) && !opt->get_callback_run()) {
8800 opt->run_callback();
8801 }
8802 }
8803 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
8804 if (!sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
8805 sub->_process_callbacks();
8806 }
8807 }
8808 }
8809
8810 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_help_flags(bool trigger_help, bool trigger_all_help) const {
8811 const Option* help_ptr = get_help_ptr();
8812 const Option* help_all_ptr = get_help_all_ptr();
8813
8814 if (help_ptr != nullptr && help_ptr->count() > 0)
8815 trigger_help = true;
8816 if (help_all_ptr != nullptr && help_all_ptr->count() > 0)
8817 trigger_all_help = true;
8818
8819 // If there were parsed subcommands, call those. First subcommand wins if there are multiple ones.
8820 if (!parsed_subcommands_.empty()) {
8821 for (const App* sub : parsed_subcommands_)
8822 sub->_process_help_flags(trigger_help, trigger_all_help);
8823
8824 // Only the final subcommand should call for help. All help wins over help.
8825 } else if (trigger_all_help) {
8826 throw CallForAllHelp();
8827 } else if (trigger_help) {
8828 throw CallForHelp();
8829 }
8830 }
8831
8832 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_requirements() {
8833 // check excludes
8834 bool excluded{false};
8835 std::string excluder;
8836 for (const auto& opt : exclude_options_) {
8837 if (opt->count() > 0) {
8838 excluded = true;
8839 excluder = opt->get_name();
8840 }
8841 }
8842 for (const auto& subc : exclude_subcommands_) {
8843 if (subc->count_all() > 0) {
8844 excluded = true;
8845 excluder = subc->get_display_name();
8846 }
8847 }
8848 if (excluded) {
8849 if (count_all() > 0) {
8850 throw ExcludesError(get_display_name(), excluder);
8851 }
8852 // if we are excluded but didn't receive anything, just return
8853 return;
8854 }
8855
8856 // check needs
8857 for (const auto& opt : need_options_) {
8858 if (opt->count() == 0) {
8859 if (count_all() > 0) {
8860 throw RequiresError(get_display_name(), opt->get_name());
8861 }
8862 // if we missing something but didn't have any options, just return
8863 return;
8864 }
8865 }
8866
8867 std::size_t used_options = 0;
8868 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
8869 if (opt->count() != 0) {
8870 ++used_options;
8871 }
8872 // Required but empty
8873 if (opt->get_required() && opt->count() == 0) {
8874 throw RequiredError(opt->get_name());
8875 }
8876 // Requires
8877 for (const Option* opt_req : opt->needs_)
8878 if (opt->count() > 0 && opt_req->count() == 0)
8879 throw RequiresError(opt->get_name(), opt_req->get_name());
8880 // Excludes
8881 for (const Option* opt_ex : opt->excludes_)
8882 if (opt->count() > 0 && opt_ex->count() != 0)
8883 throw ExcludesError(opt->get_name(), opt_ex->get_name());
8884 }
8885 // check for the required number of subcommands
8886 if (require_subcommand_min_ > 0) {
8887 auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
8888 if (require_subcommand_min_ > selected_subcommands.size())
8889 throw RequiredError::Subcommand(require_subcommand_min_);
8890 }
8891
8892 // Max error cannot occur, the extra subcommand will parse as an ExtrasError or a remaining item.
8893
8894 // run this loop to check how many unnamed subcommands were actually used since they are considered options
8895 // from the perspective of an App
8896 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
8897 if (sub->disabled_)
8898 continue;
8899 if (sub->name_.empty() && sub->count_all() > 0) {
8900 ++used_options;
8901 }
8902 }
8903
8904 if (require_option_min_ > used_options || (require_option_max_ > 0 && require_option_max_ < used_options)) {
8905 auto option_list = detail::join(options_, [this](const Option_p& ptr) {
8906 if (ptr.get() == help_ptr_ || ptr.get() == help_all_ptr_) {
8907 return std::string{};
8908 }
8909 return ptr->get_name(false, true);
8910 });
8911
8912 auto subc_list = get_subcommands([](App* app) {
8913 return ((app->get_name().empty()) && (!app->disabled_));
8914 });
8915 if (!subc_list.empty()) {
8916 option_list += "," + detail::join(subc_list, [](const App* app) {
8917 return app->get_display_name();
8918 });
8919 }
8920 throw RequiredError::Option(require_option_min_, require_option_max_, used_options, option_list);
8921 }
8922
8923 // now process the requirements for subcommands if needed
8924 for (const auto& sub : subcommands_) {
8925 if (sub->disabled_) // || !sub->required_)
8926 continue;
8927
8928 if (sub->count_all() == 0) {
8929 if (!sub->required_) {
8930 if (sub->name_.empty()) {
8931 if (require_option_min_ > 0 && require_option_min_ <= used_options) {
8932 continue;
8933 // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing in this option group skip checking
8934 // requirements
8935 }
8936 if (require_option_max_ > 0 && used_options >= require_option_min_) {
8937 continue;
8938 // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing in this option group skip checking
8939 // requirements
8940 }
8941 }
8942 } else {
8943 throw(CLI::RequiresError(get_display_name(), sub->get_display_name()));
8944 }
8945 }
8946
8947 sub->_process_requirements();
8948 }
8949
8950 // check needs
8951 for (const auto& subc : need_subcommands_) {
8952 if (subc->count_all() == 0) {
8953 if (count_all() > 0) {
8954 throw RequiresError(get_display_name(), subc->get_display_name());
8955 }
8956 // if we missing something but didn't have any options, just return
8957 break;
8958 }
8959 }
8960 }
8961
8962 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process() {
8963 try {
8964 // the config file might generate a FileError but that should not be processed until later in the process
8965 // to allow for help, version and other errors to generate first.
8966 _process_config_file();
8967
8968 // process env shouldn't throw but no reason to process it if config generated an error
8969 _process_env();
8970 } catch (const CLI::FileError&) {
8971 // callbacks and help_flags can generate exceptions which should take priority
8972 // over the config file error if one exists.
8973 _process_callbacks();
8974 _process_help_flags();
8975 throw;
8976 }
8977
8978 _process_callbacks();
8979 _process_help_flags();
8980
8981 _process_requirements();
8982 }
8983
8984 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_extras() {
8985 if (!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
8986 std::size_t const num_left_over = remaining_size();
8987 if (num_left_over > 0) {
8988 throw ExtrasError(name_, remaining(false));
8989 }
8990 }
8991
8992 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
8993 if (sub->count() > 0)
8994 sub->_process_extras();
8995 }
8996 }
8997
8998 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_extras(std::vector<std::string>& args) {
8999 if (!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
9000 std::size_t const num_left_over = remaining_size();
9001 if (num_left_over > 0) {
9002 args = remaining(false);
9003 throw ExtrasError(name_, args);
9004 }
9005 }
9006
9007 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
9008 if (sub->count() > 0)
9009 sub->_process_extras(args);
9010 }
9011 }
9012
9013 CLI11_INLINE void App::increment_parsed() {
9014 ++parsed_;
9015 for (App_p const& sub : subcommands_) {
9016 if (sub->get_name().empty())
9017 sub->increment_parsed();
9018 }
9019 }
9020
9021 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse(std::vector<std::string>& args) {
9022 increment_parsed();
9023 _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
9024 bool positional_only = false;
9025
9026 while (!args.empty()) {
9027 if (!_parse_single(args, positional_only)) {
9028 break;
9029 }
9030 }
9031
9032 if (parent_ == nullptr) {
9033 _process();
9034
9035 // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
9036 _process_extras(args);
9037
9038 // Convert missing (pairs) to extras (string only) ready for processing in another app
9039 args = remaining_for_passthrough(false);
9040 } else if (parse_complete_callback_) {
9041 _process_env();
9042 _process_callbacks();
9043 _process_help_flags();
9044 _process_requirements();
9045 run_callback(false, true);
9046 }
9047 }
9048
9049 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse(std::vector<std::string>&& args) {
9050 // this can only be called by the top level in which case parent == nullptr by definition
9051 // operation is simplified
9052 increment_parsed();
9053 _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
9054 bool positional_only = false;
9055
9056 while (!args.empty()) {
9057 _parse_single(args, positional_only);
9058 }
9059 _process();
9060
9061 // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
9062 _process_extras();
9063 }
9064
9065 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse_stream(std::istream& input) {
9066 auto values = config_formatter_->from_config(input);
9067 _parse_config(values);
9068 increment_parsed();
9069 _trigger_pre_parse(values.size());
9070 _process();
9071
9072 // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
9073 _process_extras();
9074 }
9075
9076 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse_config(const std::vector<ConfigItem>& args) {
9077 for (const ConfigItem& item : args) {
9078 if (!_parse_single_config(item) && allow_config_extras_ == config_extras_mode::error)
9079 throw ConfigError::Extras(item.fullname());
9080 }
9081 }
9082
9083 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_single_config(const ConfigItem& item, std::size_t level) {
9084 if (level < item.parents.size()) {
9085 try {
9086 auto* subcom = get_subcommand(item.parents.at(level));
9087 auto result = subcom->_parse_single_config(item, level + 1);
9088
9089 return result;
9090 } catch (const OptionNotFound&) {
9091 return false;
9092 }
9093 }
9094 // check for section open
9095 if (item.name == "++") {
9096 if (configurable_) {
9097 increment_parsed();
9098 _trigger_pre_parse(2);
9099 if (parent_ != nullptr) {
9100 parent_->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(this);
9101 }
9102 }
9103 return true;
9104 }
9105 // check for section close
9106 if (item.name == "--") {
9107 if (configurable_ && parse_complete_callback_) {
9108 _process_callbacks();
9109 _process_requirements();
9110 run_callback();
9111 }
9112 return true;
9113 }
9114 Option* op = get_option_no_throw("--" + item.name);
9115 if (op == nullptr) {
9116 if (item.name.size() == 1) {
9117 op = get_option_no_throw("-" + item.name);
9118 }
9119 }
9120 if (op == nullptr) {
9121 op = get_option_no_throw(item.name);
9122 }
9123 if (op == nullptr) {
9124 // If the option was not present
9125 if (get_allow_config_extras() == config_extras_mode::capture)
9126 // Should we worry about classifying the extras properly?
9127 missing_.emplace_back(detail::Classifier::NONE, item.fullname());
9128 for (const auto& input : item.inputs) {
9129 missing_.emplace_back(detail::Classifier::NONE, input);
9130 }
9131 return false;
9132 }
9133
9134 if (!op->get_configurable()) {
9135 if (get_allow_config_extras() == config_extras_mode::ignore_all) {
9136 return false;
9137 }
9138 throw ConfigError::NotConfigurable(item.fullname());
9139 }
9140
9141 if (op->empty()) {
9142 if (op->get_expected_min() == 0) {
9143 if (item.inputs.size() <= 1) {
9144 // Flag parsing
9145 auto res = config_formatter_->to_flag(item);
9146 bool converted{false};
9147 if (op->get_disable_flag_override()) {
9148 try {
9149 auto val = detail::to_flag_value(res);
9150 if (val == 1) {
9151 res = op->get_flag_value(item.name, "{}");
9152 converted = true;
9153 }
9154 } catch (...) {
9155 }
9156 }
9157
9158 if (!converted) {
9159 res = op->get_flag_value(item.name, res);
9160 }
9161
9162 op->add_result(res);
9163 return true;
9164 }
9165 if (static_cast<int>(item.inputs.size()) > op->get_items_expected_max()) {
9166 if (op->get_items_expected_max() > 1) {
9167 throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(item.fullname(), op->get_items_expected_max(), item.inputs.size());
9168 }
9169 throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname());
9170 }
9171 }
9172 op->add_result(item.inputs);
9173 op->run_callback();
9174 }
9175
9176 return true;
9177 }
9178
9179 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_single(std::vector<std::string>& args, bool& positional_only) {
9180 bool retval = true;
9181 detail::Classifier const classifier = positional_only ? detail::Classifier::NONE : _recognize(args.back());
9182 switch (classifier) {
9183 case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
9184 args.pop_back();
9185 positional_only = true;
9186 if ((!_has_remaining_positionals()) && (parent_ != nullptr)) {
9187 retval = false;
9188 } else {
9189 _move_to_missing(classifier, "--");
9190 }
9191 break;
9192 case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
9193 // treat this like a positional mark if in the parent app
9194 args.pop_back();
9195 retval = false;
9196 break;
9197 case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
9198 retval = _parse_subcommand(args);
9199 break;
9200 case detail::Classifier::LONG:
9201 case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
9202 case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
9203 // If already parsed a subcommand, don't accept options_
9204 _parse_arg(args, classifier, false);
9205 break;
9206 case detail::Classifier::NONE:
9207 // Probably a positional or something for a parent (sub)command
9208 retval = _parse_positional(args, false);
9209 if (retval && positionals_at_end_) {
9210 positional_only = true;
9211 }
9212 break;
9213 // LCOV_EXCL_START
9214 default:
9215 throw HorribleError("unrecognized classifier (you should not see this!)");
9216 // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9217 }
9218 return retval;
9219 }
9220
9221 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::size_t App::_count_remaining_positionals(bool required_only) const {
9222 std::size_t retval = 0;
9223 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
9224 if (opt->get_positional() && (!required_only || opt->get_required())) {
9225 if (opt->get_items_expected_min() > 0 && static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
9226 retval += static_cast<std::size_t>(opt->get_items_expected_min()) - opt->count();
9227 }
9228 }
9229 }
9230 return retval;
9231 }
9232
9233 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool App::_has_remaining_positionals() const {
9234 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
9235 if (opt->get_positional() && ((static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()))) {
9236 return true;
9237 }
9238 }
9239
9240 return false;
9241 }
9242
9243 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_positional(std::vector<std::string>& args, bool haltOnSubcommand) {
9244 const std::string& positional = args.back();
9245
9246 if (positionals_at_end_) {
9247 // deal with the case of required arguments at the end which should take precedence over other arguments
9248 auto arg_rem = args.size();
9249 auto remreq = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
9250 if (arg_rem <= remreq) {
9251 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
9252 if (opt->get_positional() && opt->required_) {
9253 if (static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
9254 if (validate_positionals_) {
9255 std::string pos = positional;
9256 pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
9257 if (!pos.empty()) {
9258 continue;
9259 }
9260 }
9261
9262 parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
9263 /// if we require a separator add it here
9264 if (opt->get_inject_separator()) {
9265 if (!opt->results().empty() && !opt->results().back().empty()) {
9266 opt->add_result(std::string{});
9267 }
9268 }
9269 if (opt->get_trigger_on_parse() && opt->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
9270 opt->clear();
9271 }
9272 opt->add_result(positional);
9273 if (opt->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
9274 opt->run_callback();
9275 }
9276 args.pop_back();
9277 return true;
9278 }
9279 }
9280 }
9281 }
9282 }
9283 for (const Option_p& opt : options_) {
9284 // Eat options, one by one, until done
9285 if (opt->get_positional() && (static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min() || opt->get_allow_extra_args())) {
9286 if (validate_positionals_) {
9287 std::string pos = positional;
9288 pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
9289 if (!pos.empty()) {
9290 continue;
9291 }
9292 }
9293 if (opt->get_inject_separator()) {
9294 if (!opt->results().empty() && !opt->results().back().empty()) {
9295 opt->add_result(std::string{});
9296 }
9297 }
9298 if (opt->get_trigger_on_parse() && opt->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
9299 opt->clear();
9300 }
9301 opt->add_result(positional);
9302 if (opt->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
9303 opt->run_callback();
9304 }
9305 parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
9306 args.pop_back();
9307 return true;
9308 }
9309 }
9310
9311 for (auto& subc : subcommands_) {
9312 if ((subc->name_.empty()) && (!subc->disabled_)) {
9313 if (subc->_parse_positional(args, false)) {
9314 if (!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
9315 subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
9316 }
9317 return true;
9318 }
9319 }
9320 }
9321 // let the parent deal with it if possible
9322 if (parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
9323 return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_positional(args, static_cast<bool>(parse_complete_callback_));
9324
9325 /// Try to find a local subcommand that is repeated
9326 auto* com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
9327 if (com != nullptr && (require_subcommand_max_ == 0 || require_subcommand_max_ > parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
9328 if (haltOnSubcommand) {
9329 return false;
9330 }
9331 args.pop_back();
9332 com->_parse(args);
9333 return true;
9334 }
9335 /// now try one last gasp at subcommands that have been executed before, go to root app and try to find a
9336 /// subcommand in a broader way, if one exists let the parent deal with it
9337 auto* parent_app = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
9338 com = parent_app->_find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
9339 if (com != nullptr && (com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ == 0 ||
9340 com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ > com->parent_->parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
9341 return false;
9342 }
9343
9344 if (positionals_at_end_) {
9345 throw CLI::ExtrasError(name_, args);
9346 }
9347 /// If this is an option group don't deal with it
9348 if (parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
9349 return false;
9350 }
9351 /// We are out of other options this goes to missing
9352 _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, positional);
9353 args.pop_back();
9354 if (prefix_command_) {
9355 while (!args.empty()) {
9356 _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, args.back());
9357 args.pop_back();
9358 }
9359 }
9360
9361 return true;
9362 }
9363
9364 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE App*
9365 App::_find_subcommand(const std::string& subc_name, bool ignore_disabled, bool ignore_used) const noexcept {
9366 for (const App_p& com : subcommands_) {
9367 if (com->disabled_ && ignore_disabled)
9368 continue;
9369 if (com->get_name().empty()) {
9370 auto* subc = com->_find_subcommand(subc_name, ignore_disabled, ignore_used);
9371 if (subc != nullptr) {
9372 return subc;
9373 }
9374 }
9375 if (com->check_name(subc_name)) {
9376 if ((!*com) || !ignore_used)
9377 return com.get();
9378 }
9379 }
9380 return nullptr;
9381 }
9382
9383 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_subcommand(std::vector<std::string>& args) {
9384 if (_count_remaining_positionals(/* required */ true) > 0) {
9385 _parse_positional(args, false);
9386 return true;
9387 }
9388 auto* com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, true);
9389 if (com == nullptr) {
9390 // the main way to get here is using .notation
9391 auto dotloc = args.back().find_first_of('.');
9392 if (dotloc != std::string::npos) {
9393 com = _find_subcommand(args.back().substr(0, dotloc), true, true);
9394 if (com != nullptr) {
9395 args.back() = args.back().substr(dotloc + 1);
9396 args.push_back(com->get_display_name());
9397 }
9398 }
9399 }
9400 if (com != nullptr) {
9401 args.pop_back();
9402 if (!com->silent_) {
9403 parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
9404 }
9405 com->_parse(args);
9406 auto* parent_app = com->parent_;
9407 while (parent_app != this) {
9408 parent_app->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
9409 if (!com->silent_) {
9410 parent_app->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
9411 }
9412 parent_app = parent_app->parent_;
9413 }
9414 return true;
9415 }
9416
9417 if (parent_ == nullptr)
9418 throw HorribleError("Subcommand " + args.back() + " missing");
9419 return false;
9420 }
9421
9422 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_arg(std::vector<std::string>& args, detail::Classifier current_type, bool local_processing_only) {
9423 std::string const current = args.back();
9424
9425 std::string arg_name;
9426 std::string value;
9427 std::string rest;
9428
9429 switch (current_type) {
9430 case detail::Classifier::LONG:
9431 if (!detail::split_long(current, arg_name, value))
9432 throw HorribleError("Long parsed but missing (you should not see this):" + args.back());
9433 break;
9434 case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
9435 if (!detail::split_short(current, arg_name, rest))
9436 throw HorribleError("Short parsed but missing! You should not see this");
9437 break;
9438 case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
9439 if (!detail::split_windows_style(current, arg_name, value))
9440 throw HorribleError("windows option parsed but missing! You should not see this");
9441 break;
9442 case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
9443 case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
9444 case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
9445 case detail::Classifier::NONE:
9446 default:
9447 throw HorribleError("parsing got called with invalid option! You should not see this");
9448 }
9449
9450 auto op_ptr = std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [arg_name, current_type](const Option_p& opt) {
9451 if (current_type == detail::Classifier::LONG)
9452 return opt->check_lname(arg_name);
9453 if (current_type == detail::Classifier::SHORT)
9454 return opt->check_sname(arg_name);
9455 // this will only get called for detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE
9456 return opt->check_lname(arg_name) || opt->check_sname(arg_name);
9457 });
9458
9459 // Option not found
9460 if (op_ptr == std::end(options_)) {
9461 for (auto& subc : subcommands_) {
9462 if (subc->name_.empty() && !subc->disabled_) {
9463 if (subc->_parse_arg(args, current_type, local_processing_only)) {
9464 if (!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
9465 subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
9466 }
9467 return true;
9468 }
9469 }
9470 }
9471
9472 // don't capture missing if this is a nameless subcommand and nameless subcommands can't fallthrough
9473 if (parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
9474 return false;
9475 }
9476
9477 // now check for '.' notation of subcommands
9478 auto dotloc = arg_name.find_first_of('.', 1);
9479 if (dotloc != std::string::npos) {
9480 // using dot notation is equivalent to single argument subcommand
9481 auto* sub = _find_subcommand(arg_name.substr(0, dotloc), true, false);
9482 if (sub != nullptr) {
9483 auto v = args.back();
9484 args.pop_back();
9485 arg_name = arg_name.substr(dotloc + 1);
9486 if (arg_name.size() > 1) {
9487 args.push_back(std::string("--") + v.substr(dotloc + 3));
9488 current_type = detail::Classifier::LONG;
9489 } else {
9490 auto nval = v.substr(dotloc + 2);
9491 nval.front() = '-';
9492 if (nval.size() > 2) {
9493 // '=' not allowed in short form arguments
9494 args.push_back(nval.substr(3));
9495 nval.resize(2);
9496 }
9497 args.push_back(nval);
9498 current_type = detail::Classifier::SHORT;
9499 }
9500 auto val = sub->_parse_arg(args, current_type, true);
9501 if (val) {
9502 if (!sub->silent_) {
9503 parsed_subcommands_.push_back(sub);
9504 }
9505 // deal with preparsing
9506 increment_parsed();
9507 _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
9508 // run the parse complete callback since the subcommand processing is now complete
9509 if (sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
9510 sub->_process_env();
9511 sub->_process_callbacks();
9512 sub->_process_help_flags();
9513 sub->_process_requirements();
9514 sub->run_callback(false, true);
9515 }
9516 return true;
9517 }
9518 args.pop_back();
9519 args.push_back(v);
9520 }
9521 }
9522 if (local_processing_only) {
9523 return false;
9524 }
9525 // If a subcommand, try the main command
9526 if (parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
9527 return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_arg(args, current_type, false);
9528
9529 // Otherwise, add to missing
9530 args.pop_back();
9531 _move_to_missing(current_type, current);
9532 return true;
9533 }
9534
9535 args.pop_back();
9536
9537 // Get a reference to the pointer to make syntax bearable
9538 Option_p& op = *op_ptr;
9539 /// if we require a separator add it here
9540 if (op->get_inject_separator()) {
9541 if (!op->results().empty() && !op->results().back().empty()) {
9542 op->add_result(std::string{});
9543 }
9544 }
9545 if (op->get_trigger_on_parse() && op->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
9546 op->clear();
9547 }
9548 int const min_num = (std::min)(op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_items_expected_min());
9549 int max_num = op->get_items_expected_max();
9550 // check container like options to limit the argument size to a single type if the allow_extra_flags argument is
9551 // set. 16 is somewhat arbitrary (needs to be at least 4)
9552 if (max_num >= detail::expected_max_vector_size / 16 && !op->get_allow_extra_args()) {
9553 auto tmax = op->get_type_size_max();
9554 max_num = detail::checked_multiply(tmax, op->get_expected_min()) ? tmax : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
9555 }
9556 // Make sure we always eat the minimum for unlimited vectors
9557 int collected = 0; // total number of arguments collected
9558 int result_count = 0; // local variable for number of results in a single arg string
9559 // deal with purely flag like things
9560 if (max_num == 0) {
9561 auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, value);
9562 op->add_result(res);
9563 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9564 } else if (!value.empty()) { // --this=value
9565 op->add_result(value, result_count);
9566 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9567 collected += result_count;
9568 // -Trest
9569 } else if (!rest.empty()) {
9570 op->add_result(rest, result_count);
9571 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9572 rest = "";
9573 collected += result_count;
9574 }
9575
9576 // gather the minimum number of arguments
9577 while (min_num > collected && !args.empty()) {
9578 std::string const current_ = args.back();
9579 args.pop_back();
9580 op->add_result(current_, result_count);
9581 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9582 collected += result_count;
9583 }
9584
9585 if (min_num > collected) { // if we have run out of arguments and the minimum was not met
9586 throw ArgumentMismatch::TypedAtLeast(op->get_name(), min_num, op->get_type_name());
9587 }
9588
9589 // now check for optional arguments
9590 if (max_num > collected || op->get_allow_extra_args()) { // we allow optional arguments
9591 auto remreqpos = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
9592 // we have met the minimum now optionally check up to the maximum
9593 while ((collected < max_num || op->get_allow_extra_args()) && !args.empty() &&
9594 _recognize(args.back(), false) == detail::Classifier::NONE) {
9595 // If any required positionals remain, don't keep eating
9596 if (remreqpos >= args.size()) {
9597 break;
9598 }
9599 if (validate_optional_arguments_) {
9600 std::string arg = args.back();
9601 arg = op->_validate(arg, 0);
9602 if (!arg.empty()) {
9603 break;
9604 }
9605 }
9606 op->add_result(args.back(), result_count);
9607 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9608 args.pop_back();
9609 collected += result_count;
9610 }
9611
9612 // Allow -- to end an unlimited list and "eat" it
9613 if (!args.empty() && _recognize(args.back()) == detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK)
9614 args.pop_back();
9615 // optional flag that didn't receive anything now get the default value
9616 if (min_num == 0 && max_num > 0 && collected == 0) {
9617 auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, std::string{});
9618 op->add_result(res);
9619 parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
9620 }
9621 }
9622 // if we only partially completed a type then add an empty string if allowed for later processing
9623 if (min_num > 0 && (collected % op->get_type_size_max()) != 0) {
9624 if (op->get_type_size_max() != op->get_type_size_min()) {
9625 op->add_result(std::string{});
9626 } else {
9627 throw ArgumentMismatch::PartialType(op->get_name(), op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_type_name());
9628 }
9629 }
9630 if (op->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
9631 op->run_callback();
9632 }
9633 if (!rest.empty()) {
9634 rest = "-" + rest;
9635 args.push_back(rest);
9636 }
9637 return true;
9638 }
9639
9640 CLI11_INLINE void App::_trigger_pre_parse(std::size_t remaining_args) {
9641 if (!pre_parse_called_) {
9642 pre_parse_called_ = true;
9643 if (pre_parse_callback_) {
9644 pre_parse_callback_(remaining_args);
9645 }
9646 } else if (immediate_callback_) {
9647 if (!name_.empty()) {
9648 auto pcnt = parsed_;
9649 auto extras = std::move(missing_);
9650 clear();
9651 parsed_ = pcnt;
9652 pre_parse_called_ = true;
9653 missing_ = std::move(extras);
9654 }
9655 }
9656 }
9657
9658 CLI11_INLINE App* App::_get_fallthrough_parent() {
9659 if (parent_ == nullptr) {
9660 throw(HorribleError("No Valid parent"));
9661 }
9662 auto* fallthrough_parent = parent_;
9663 while ((fallthrough_parent->parent_ != nullptr) && (fallthrough_parent->get_name().empty())) {
9664 fallthrough_parent = fallthrough_parent->parent_;
9665 }
9666 return fallthrough_parent;
9667 }
9668
9669 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const std::string& App::_compare_subcommand_names(const App& subcom, const App& base) const {
9670 static const std::string estring;
9671 if (subcom.disabled_) {
9672 return estring;
9673 }
9674 for (const auto& subc : base.subcommands_) {
9675 if (subc.get() != &subcom) {
9676 if (subc->disabled_) {
9677 continue;
9678 }
9679 if (!subcom.get_name().empty()) {
9680 if (subc->check_name(subcom.get_name())) {
9681 return subcom.get_name();
9682 }
9683 }
9684 if (!subc->get_name().empty()) {
9685 if (subcom.check_name(subc->get_name())) {
9686 return subc->get_name();
9687 }
9688 }
9689 for (const auto& les : subcom.aliases_) {
9690 if (subc->check_name(les)) {
9691 return les;
9692 }
9693 }
9694 // this loop is needed in case of ignore_underscore or ignore_case on one but not the other
9695 for (const auto& les : subc->aliases_) {
9696 if (subcom.check_name(les)) {
9697 return les;
9698 }
9699 }
9700 // if the subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
9701 if (subc->get_name().empty()) {
9702 const auto& cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(subcom, *subc);
9703 if (!cmpres.empty()) {
9704 return cmpres;
9705 }
9706 }
9707 // if the test subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
9708 if (subcom.get_name().empty()) {
9709 const auto& cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(*subc, subcom);
9710 if (!cmpres.empty()) {
9711 return cmpres;
9712 }
9713 }
9714 }
9715 }
9716 return estring;
9717 }
9718
9719 CLI11_INLINE void App::_move_to_missing(detail::Classifier val_type, const std::string& val) {
9720 if (allow_extras_ || subcommands_.empty()) {
9721 missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9722 return;
9723 }
9724 // allow extra arguments to be places in an option group if it is allowed there
9725 for (auto& subc : subcommands_) {
9726 if (subc->name_.empty() && subc->allow_extras_) {
9727 subc->missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9728 return;
9729 }
9730 }
9731 // if we haven't found any place to put them yet put them in missing
9732 missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
9733 }
9734
9735 CLI11_INLINE void App::_move_option(Option* opt, App* app) {
9736 if (opt == nullptr) {
9737 throw OptionNotFound("the option is NULL");
9738 }
9739 // verify that the give app is actually a subcommand
9740 bool found = false;
9741 for (auto& subc : subcommands_) {
9742 if (app == subc.get()) {
9743 found = true;
9744 }
9745 }
9746 if (!found) {
9747 throw OptionNotFound("The Given app is not a subcommand");
9748 }
9749
9750 if ((help_ptr_ == opt) || (help_all_ptr_ == opt))
9751 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move help options");
9752
9753 if (config_ptr_ == opt)
9754 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move config file options");
9755
9756 auto iterator = std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [opt](const Option_p& v) {
9757 return v.get() == opt;
9758 });
9759 if (iterator != std::end(options_)) {
9760 const auto& opt_p = *iterator;
9761 if (std::find_if(std::begin(app->options_), std::end(app->options_), [&opt_p](const Option_p& v) {
9762 return (*v == *opt_p);
9763 }) == std::end(app->options_)) {
9764 // only erase after the insertion was successful
9765 app->options_.push_back(std::move(*iterator));
9766 options_.erase(iterator);
9767 } else {
9768 throw OptionAlreadyAdded("option was not located: " + opt->get_name());
9769 }
9770 } else {
9771 throw OptionNotFound("could not locate the given Option");
9772 }
9773 }
9774
9775 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App* trigger_app, App* app_to_enable) {
9776 app_to_enable->enabled_by_default(false);
9777 app_to_enable->disabled_by_default();
9778 trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9779 app_to_enable->disabled(false);
9780 });
9781 }
9782
9783 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App* trigger_app, std::vector<App*> apps_to_enable) {
9784 for (auto& app : apps_to_enable) {
9785 app->enabled_by_default(false);
9786 app->disabled_by_default();
9787 }
9788
9789 trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9790 for (const auto& app : apps_to_enable) {
9791 app->disabled(false);
9792 }
9793 });
9794 }
9795
9796 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App* trigger_app, App* app_to_enable) {
9797 app_to_enable->disabled_by_default(false);
9798 app_to_enable->enabled_by_default();
9799 trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9800 app_to_enable->disabled();
9801 });
9802 }
9803
9804 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App* trigger_app, std::vector<App*> apps_to_enable) {
9805 for (auto& app : apps_to_enable) {
9806 app->disabled_by_default(false);
9807 app->enabled_by_default();
9808 }
9809
9810 trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
9811 for (const auto& app : apps_to_enable) {
9812 app->disabled();
9813 }
9814 });
9815 }
9816
9817 CLI11_INLINE void deprecate_option(Option* opt, const std::string& replacement) {
9818 Validator deprecate_warning{[opt, replacement](std::string&) {
9819 std::cout << opt->get_name() << " is deprecated please use '" << replacement << "' instead\n";
9820 return std::string();
9821 },
9822 "DEPRECATED"};
9823 deprecate_warning.application_index(0);
9824 opt->check(deprecate_warning);
9825 if (!replacement.empty()) {
9826 opt->description(opt->get_description() + " DEPRECATED: please use '" + replacement + "' instead");
9827 }
9828 }
9829
9830 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App* app, Option* opt) {
9831 App temp;
9832 auto* option_copy = temp.add_option(opt->get_name(false, true))
9833 ->type_size(opt->get_type_size_min(), opt->get_type_size_max())
9834 ->expected(opt->get_expected_min(), opt->get_expected_max())
9835 ->allow_extra_args(opt->get_allow_extra_args());
9836
9837 app->remove_option(opt);
9838 auto* opt2 = app->add_option(option_copy->get_name(false, true), "option has been retired and has no effect")
9839 ->type_name("RETIRED")
9840 ->default_str("RETIRED")
9841 ->type_size(option_copy->get_type_size_min(), option_copy->get_type_size_max())
9842 ->expected(option_copy->get_expected_min(), option_copy->get_expected_max())
9843 ->allow_extra_args(option_copy->get_allow_extra_args());
9844
9845 Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string&) {
9846 std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name() << " is retired and has no effect\n";
9847 return std::string();
9848 },
9849 ""};
9850 retired_warning.application_index(0);
9851 opt2->check(retired_warning);
9852 }
9853
9854 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App& app, Option* opt) {
9855 retire_option(&app, opt);
9856 }
9857
9858 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App* app, const std::string& option_name) {
9859 auto* opt = app->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
9860 if (opt != nullptr) {
9861 retire_option(app, opt);
9862 return;
9863 }
9864 auto* opt2 = app->add_option(option_name, "option has been retired and has no effect")
9865 ->type_name("RETIRED")
9866 ->expected(0, 1)
9867 ->default_str("RETIRED");
9868 Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string&) {
9869 std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name() << " is retired and has no effect\n";
9870 return std::string();
9871 },
9872 ""};
9873 retired_warning.application_index(0);
9874 opt2->check(retired_warning);
9875 }
9876
9877 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App& app, const std::string& option_name) {
9878 retire_option(&app, option_name);
9879 }
9880
9881 namespace FailureMessage {
9882
9883 CLI11_INLINE std::string simple(const App* app, const Error& e) {
9884 std::string header = std::string(e.what()) + "\n";
9885 std::vector<std::string> names;
9886
9887 // Collect names
9888 if (app->get_help_ptr() != nullptr)
9889 names.push_back(app->get_help_ptr()->get_name());
9890
9891 if (app->get_help_all_ptr() != nullptr)
9892 names.push_back(app->get_help_all_ptr()->get_name());
9893
9894 // If any names found, suggest those
9895 if (!names.empty())
9896 header += "Run with " + detail::join(names, " or ") + " for more information.\n";
9897
9898 return header;
9899 }
9900
9901 CLI11_INLINE std::string help(const App* app, const Error& e) {
9902 std::string header = std::string("ERROR: ") + e.get_name() + ": " + e.what() + "\n";
9903 header += app->help();
9904 return header;
9905 }
9906
9907 } // namespace FailureMessage
9908
9909 namespace detail {
9910
9911 std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string& arg, char stringQuote = '"', char characterQuote = '\'');
9912
9913 /// Comma separated join, adds quotes if needed
9914 std::string ini_join(const std::vector<std::string>& args,
9915 char sepChar = ',',
9916 char arrayStart = '[',
9917 char arrayEnd = ']',
9918 char stringQuote = '"',
9919 char characterQuote = '\'');
9920
9921 std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string& section, std::string& name, char parentSeparator);
9922
9923 /// assuming non default segments do a check on the close and open of the segments in a configItem structure
9924 void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem>& output, const std::string& currentSection, char parentSeparator);
9925 } // namespace detail
9926
9927 namespace detail {
9928
9929 CLI11_INLINE std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string& arg, char stringQuote, char characterQuote) {
9930 if (arg.empty()) {
9931 return std::string(2, stringQuote);
9932 }
9933 // some specifically supported strings
9934 if (arg == "true" || arg == "false" || arg == "nan" || arg == "inf") {
9935 return arg;
9936 }
9937 // floating point conversion can convert some hex codes, but don't try that here
9938 if (arg.compare(0, 2, "0x") != 0 && arg.compare(0, 2, "0X") != 0) {
9939 using CLI::detail::lexical_cast;
9940 double val = 0.0;
9941 if (lexical_cast(arg, val)) {
9942 return arg;
9943 }
9944 }
9945 // just quote a single non numeric character
9946 if (arg.size() == 1) {
9947 return std::string(1, characterQuote) + arg + characterQuote;
9948 }
9949 // handle hex, binary or octal arguments
9950 if (arg.front() == '0') {
9951 if (arg[1] == 'x') {
9952 if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
9953 return (x >= '0' && x <= '9') || (x >= 'A' && x <= 'F') || (x >= 'a' && x <= 'f');
9954 })) {
9955 return arg;
9956 }
9957 } else if (arg[1] == 'o') {
9958 if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
9959 return (x >= '0' && x <= '7');
9960 })) {
9961 return arg;
9962 }
9963 } else if (arg[1] == 'b') {
9964 if (std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
9965 return (x == '0' || x == '1');
9966 })) {
9967 return arg;
9968 }
9969 }
9970 }
9971 if (arg.find_first_of(stringQuote) == std::string::npos) {
9972 return std::string(1, stringQuote) + arg + stringQuote;
9973 }
9974 return characterQuote + arg + characterQuote;
9975 }
9976
9977 CLI11_INLINE std::string ini_join(
9978 const std::vector<std::string>& args, char sepChar, char arrayStart, char arrayEnd, char stringQuote, char characterQuote) {
9979 std::string joined;
9980 if (args.size() > 1 && arrayStart != '\0') {
9981 joined.push_back(arrayStart);
9982 }
9983 std::size_t start = 0;
9984 for (const auto& arg : args) {
9985 if (start++ > 0) {
9986 joined.push_back(sepChar);
9987 if (!std::isspace<char>(sepChar, std::locale())) {
9988 joined.push_back(' ');
9989 }
9990 }
9991 joined.append(convert_arg_for_ini(arg, stringQuote, characterQuote));
9992 }
9993 if (args.size() > 1 && arrayEnd != '\0') {
9994 joined.push_back(arrayEnd);
9995 }
9996 return joined;
9997 }
9998
9999 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string& section, std::string& name, char parentSeparator) {
10000 std::vector<std::string> parents;
10001 if (detail::to_lower(section) != "default") {
10002 if (section.find(parentSeparator) != std::string::npos) {
10003 parents = detail::split(section, parentSeparator);
10004 } else {
10005 parents = {section};
10006 }
10007 }
10008 if (name.find(parentSeparator) != std::string::npos) {
10009 std::vector<std::string> plist = detail::split(name, parentSeparator);
10010 name = plist.back();
10011 detail::remove_quotes(name);
10012 plist.pop_back();
10013 parents.insert(parents.end(), plist.begin(), plist.end());
10014 }
10015
10016 // clean up quotes on the parents
10017 for (auto& parent : parents) {
10018 detail::remove_quotes(parent);
10019 }
10020 return parents;
10021 }
10022
10023 CLI11_INLINE void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem>& output, const std::string& currentSection, char parentSeparator) {
10024 std::string estring;
10025 auto parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, estring, parentSeparator);
10026 if (!output.empty() && output.back().name == "--") {
10027 std::size_t const msize = (parents.size() > 1U) ? parents.size() : 2;
10028 while (output.back().parents.size() >= msize) {
10029 output.push_back(output.back());
10030 output.back().parents.pop_back();
10031 }
10032
10033 if (parents.size() > 1) {
10034 std::size_t common = 0;
10035 std::size_t const mpair = (std::min)(output.back().parents.size(), parents.size() - 1);
10036 for (std::size_t ii = 0; ii < mpair; ++ii) {
10037 if (output.back().parents[ii] != parents[ii]) {
10038 break;
10039 }
10040 ++common;
10041 }
10042 if (common == mpair) {
10043 output.pop_back();
10044 } else {
10045 while (output.back().parents.size() > common + 1) {
10046 output.push_back(output.back());
10047 output.back().parents.pop_back();
10048 }
10049 }
10050 for (std::size_t ii = common; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
10051 output.emplace_back();
10052 output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(), parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
10053 output.back().name = "++";
10054 }
10055 }
10056 } else if (parents.size() > 1) {
10057 for (std::size_t ii = 0; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
10058 output.emplace_back();
10059 output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(), parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
10060 output.back().name = "++";
10061 }
10062 }
10063
10064 // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
10065 output.emplace_back();
10066 output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
10067 output.back().name = "++";
10068 }
10069 } // namespace detail
10070
10071 inline std::vector<ConfigItem> ConfigBase::from_config(std::istream& input) const {
10072 std::string line;
10073 std::string currentSection = "default";
10074 std::string previousSection = "default";
10075 std::vector<ConfigItem> output;
10076 bool const isDefaultArray = (arrayStart == '[' && arrayEnd == ']' && arraySeparator == ',');
10077 bool const isINIArray = (arrayStart == '\0' || arrayStart == ' ') && arrayStart == arrayEnd;
10078 bool inSection{false};
10079 char const aStart = (isINIArray) ? '[' : arrayStart;
10080 char const aEnd = (isINIArray) ? ']' : arrayEnd;
10081 char const aSep = (isINIArray && arraySeparator == ' ') ? ',' : arraySeparator;
10082 int currentSectionIndex{0};
10083 while (getline(input, line)) {
10084 std::vector<std::string> items_buffer;
10085 std::string name;
10086
10087 detail::trim(line);
10088 std::size_t const len = line.length();
10089 // lines have to be at least 3 characters to have any meaning to CLI just skip the rest
10090 if (len < 3) {
10091 continue;
10092 }
10093 if (line.front() == '[' && line.back() == ']') {
10094 if (currentSection != "default") {
10095 // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
10096 output.emplace_back();
10097 output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, name, parentSeparatorChar);
10098 output.back().name = "--";
10099 }
10100 currentSection = line.substr(1, len - 2);
10101 // deal with double brackets for TOML
10102 if (currentSection.size() > 1 && currentSection.front() == '[' && currentSection.back() == ']') {
10103 currentSection = currentSection.substr(1, currentSection.size() - 2);
10104 }
10105 if (detail::to_lower(currentSection) == "default") {
10106 currentSection = "default";
10107 } else {
10108 detail::checkParentSegments(output, currentSection, parentSeparatorChar);
10109 }
10110 inSection = false;
10111 if (currentSection == previousSection) {
10112 ++currentSectionIndex;
10113 } else {
10114 currentSectionIndex = 0;
10115 previousSection = currentSection;
10116 }
10117 continue;
10118 }
10119
10120 // comment lines
10121 if (line.front() == ';' || line.front() == '#' || line.front() == commentChar) {
10122 continue;
10123 }
10124
10125 // Find = in string, split and recombine
10126 auto pos = line.find(valueDelimiter);
10127 if (pos != std::string::npos) {
10128 name = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(0, pos));
10129 std::string item = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(pos + 1));
10130 auto cloc = item.find(commentChar);
10131 if (cloc != std::string::npos) {
10132 item.erase(cloc, std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
10133 detail::trim(item);
10134 }
10135 if (item.size() > 1 && item.front() == aStart) {
10136 for (std::string multiline; item.back() != aEnd && std::getline(input, multiline);) {
10137 detail::trim(multiline);
10138 item += multiline;
10139 }
10140 items_buffer = detail::split_up(item.substr(1, item.length() - 2), aSep);
10141 } else if ((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) && item.find_first_of(aSep) != std::string::npos) {
10142 items_buffer = detail::split_up(item, aSep);
10143 } else if ((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) && item.find_first_of(' ') != std::string::npos) {
10144 items_buffer = detail::split_up(item);
10145 } else {
10146 items_buffer = {item};
10147 }
10148 } else {
10149 name = detail::trim_copy(line);
10150 auto cloc = name.find(commentChar);
10151 if (cloc != std::string::npos) {
10152 name.erase(cloc, std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
10153 detail::trim(name);
10154 }
10155
10156 items_buffer = {"true"};
10157 }
10158 if (name.find(parentSeparatorChar) == std::string::npos) {
10159 detail::remove_quotes(name);
10160 }
10161 // clean up quotes on the items
10162 for (auto& it : items_buffer) {
10163 detail::remove_quotes(it);
10164 }
10165
10166 std::vector<std::string> parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, name, parentSeparatorChar);
10167 if (parents.size() > maximumLayers) {
10168 continue;
10169 }
10170 if (!configSection.empty() && !inSection) {
10171 if (parents.empty() || parents.front() != configSection) {
10172 continue;
10173 }
10174 if (configIndex >= 0 && currentSectionIndex != configIndex) {
10175 continue;
10176 }
10177 parents.erase(parents.begin());
10178 inSection = true;
10179 }
10180 if (!output.empty() && name == output.back().name && parents == output.back().parents) {
10181 output.back().inputs.insert(output.back().inputs.end(), items_buffer.begin(), items_buffer.end());
10182 } else {
10183 output.emplace_back();
10184 output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
10185 output.back().name = std::move(name);
10186 output.back().inputs = std::move(items_buffer);
10187 }
10188 }
10189 if (currentSection != "default") {
10190 // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
10191 std::string ename;
10192 output.emplace_back();
10193 output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, ename, parentSeparatorChar);
10194 output.back().name = "--";
10195 while (output.back().parents.size() > 1) {
10196 output.push_back(output.back());
10197 output.back().parents.pop_back();
10198 }
10199 }
10200 return output;
10201 }
10202
10203 CLI11_INLINE std::string ConfigBase::to_config(const App* app, bool default_also, bool write_description, std::string prefix) const {
10204 std::stringstream out;
10205 std::string commentLead;
10206 commentLead.push_back(commentChar);
10207 commentLead.push_back(' ');
10208
10209 std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
10210 bool defaultUsed = false;
10211 groups.insert(groups.begin(), std::string("Options"));
10212 if (write_description && (app->get_configurable() || app->get_parent() == nullptr || app->get_name().empty())) {
10213 out << commentLead << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, app->get_description()) << '\n';
10214 }
10215 for (auto& group : groups) {
10216 if (group == "Options" || group.empty()) {
10217 if (defaultUsed) {
10218 continue;
10219 }
10220 defaultUsed = true;
10221 }
10222 if (write_description && group != "Options" && !group.empty()) {
10223 out << '\n' << commentLead << group << " Options\n";
10224 }
10225 for (const Option* opt : app->get_options({})) {
10226 // Only process options that are configurable
10227 if (opt->get_configurable()) {
10228 if (opt->get_group() != group) {
10229 if (!(group == "Options" && opt->get_group().empty())) {
10230 continue;
10231 }
10232 }
10233 std::string const name = prefix + opt->get_single_name();
10234 std::string value =
10235 detail::ini_join(opt->reduced_results(), arraySeparator, arrayStart, arrayEnd, stringQuote, characterQuote);
10236
10237 if (value.empty() && default_also) {
10238 if (!opt->get_default_str().empty()) {
10239 value = detail::convert_arg_for_ini(opt->get_default_str(), stringQuote, characterQuote);
10240 } else if (opt->get_expected_min() == 0) {
10241 value = "false";
10242 } else if (opt->get_run_callback_for_default()) {
10243 value = "\"\""; // empty string default value
10244 }
10245 }
10246
10247 if (!value.empty()) {
10248 if (!opt->get_fnames().empty()) {
10249 value = opt->get_flag_value(name, value);
10250 }
10251 if (write_description && opt->has_description()) {
10252 out << '\n';
10253 out << commentLead << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, opt->get_description()) << '\n';
10254 }
10255 out << name << valueDelimiter << value << '\n';
10256 }
10257 }
10258 }
10259 }
10260 auto subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
10261 for (const App* subcom : subcommands) {
10262 if (subcom->get_name().empty()) {
10263 if (write_description && !subcom->get_group().empty()) {
10264 out << '\n' << commentLead << subcom->get_group() << " Options\n";
10265 }
10266 out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix);
10267 }
10268 }
10269
10270 for (const App* subcom : subcommands) {
10271 if (!subcom->get_name().empty()) {
10272 if (subcom->get_configurable() && app->got_subcommand(subcom)) {
10273 if (!prefix.empty() || app->get_parent() == nullptr) {
10274 out << '[' << prefix << subcom->get_name() << "]\n";
10275 } else {
10276 std::string subname = app->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar + subcom->get_name();
10277 const auto* p = app->get_parent();
10278 while (p->get_parent() != nullptr) {
10279 subname = p->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar + subname;
10280 p = p->get_parent();
10281 }
10282 out << '[' << subname << "]\n";
10283 }
10284 out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, "");
10285 } else {
10286 out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix + subcom->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar);
10287 }
10288 }
10289 }
10290
10291 return out.str();
10292 }
10293
10294 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option*> opts) const {
10295 std::stringstream out;
10296
10297 out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
10298 for (const Option* opt : opts) {
10299 out << make_option(opt, is_positional);
10300 }
10301
10302 return out.str();
10303 }
10304
10305 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_positionals(const App* app) const {
10306 std::vector<const Option*> const opts = app->get_options([](const Option* opt) {
10307 return !opt->get_group().empty() && opt->get_positional();
10308 });
10309
10310 if (opts.empty())
10311 return {};
10312
10313 return make_group(get_label("Positionals"), true, opts);
10314 }
10315
10316 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_groups(const App* app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
10317 std::stringstream out;
10318 std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
10319
10320 // Options
10321 for (const std::string& group : groups) {
10322 std::vector<const Option*> const opts = app->get_options([app, mode, &group](const Option* opt) {
10323 return opt->get_group() == group // Must be in the right group
10324 && opt->nonpositional() // Must not be a positional
10325 && (mode != AppFormatMode::Sub // If mode is Sub, then
10326 || (app->get_help_ptr() != opt // Ignore help pointer
10327 && app->get_help_all_ptr() != opt)); // Ignore help all pointer
10328 });
10329 if (!group.empty() && !opts.empty()) {
10330 out << make_group(group, false, opts);
10331
10332 if (group != groups.back())
10333 out << "\n";
10334 }
10335 }
10336
10337 return out.str();
10338 }
10339
10340 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_description(const App* app) const {
10341 std::string desc = app->get_description();
10342 auto min_options = app->get_require_option_min();
10343 auto max_options = app->get_require_option_max();
10344 if (app->get_required()) {
10345 desc += " " + get_label("REQUIRED") + " ";
10346 }
10347 if ((max_options == min_options) && (min_options > 0)) {
10348 if (min_options == 1) {
10349 desc += " \n[Exactly 1 of the following options is required]";
10350 } else {
10351 desc += " \n[Exactly " + std::to_string(min_options) + " options from the following list are required]";
10352 }
10353 } else if (max_options > 0) {
10354 if (min_options > 0) {
10355 desc += " \n[Between " + std::to_string(min_options) + " and " + std::to_string(max_options) +
10356 " of the follow options are required]";
10357 } else {
10358 desc += " \n[At most " + std::to_string(max_options) + " of the following options are allowed]";
10359 }
10360 } else if (min_options > 0) {
10361 desc += " \n[At least " + std::to_string(min_options) + " of the following options are required]";
10362 }
10363 return (!desc.empty()) ? desc + "\n" : std::string{};
10364 }
10365
10366 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_usage(const App* app, std::string name) const {
10367 std::string const usage = app->get_usage();
10368 if (!usage.empty()) {
10369 return usage + "\n";
10370 }
10371
10372 std::stringstream out;
10373
10374 out << get_label("Usage") << ":" << (name.empty() ? "" : " ") << name;
10375
10376 std::vector<std::string> const groups = app->get_groups();
10377
10378 // Print an Options badge if any options exist
10379 std::vector<const Option*> const non_pos_options = app->get_options([](const Option* opt) {
10380 return opt->nonpositional();
10381 });
10382 if (!non_pos_options.empty())
10383 out << " [" << get_label("OPTIONS") << "]";
10384
10385 // Positionals need to be listed here
10386 std::vector<const Option*> positionals = app->get_options([](const Option* opt) {
10387 return opt->get_positional();
10388 });
10389
10390 // Print out positionals if any are left
10391 if (!positionals.empty()) {
10392 // Convert to help names
10393 std::vector<std::string> positional_names(positionals.size());
10394 std::transform(positionals.begin(), positionals.end(), positional_names.begin(), [this](const Option* opt) {
10395 return make_option_usage(opt);
10396 });
10397
10398 out << " " << detail::join(positional_names, " ");
10399 }
10400
10401 // Add a marker if subcommands are expected or optional
10402 if (!app->get_subcommands([](const CLI::App* subc) {
10403 return ((!subc->get_disabled()) && (!subc->get_name().empty()));
10404 })
10405 .empty()) {
10406 out << " " << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "[" : "")
10407 << get_label(app->get_require_subcommand_max() < 2 || app->get_require_subcommand_min() > 1 ? "SUBCOMMAND" : "SUBCOMMANDS")
10408 << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "]" : "");
10409 }
10410
10411 out << std::endl;
10412
10413 return out.str();
10414 }
10415
10416 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_footer(const App* app) const {
10417 std::string const footer = app->get_footer();
10418 if (footer.empty()) {
10419 return std::string{};
10420 }
10421 return "\n" + footer + "\n";
10422 }
10423
10424 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_help(const App* app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const {
10425 // This immediately forwards to the make_expanded method. This is done this way so that subcommands can
10426 // have overridden formatters
10427 if (mode == AppFormatMode::Sub)
10428 return make_expanded(app);
10429
10430 std::stringstream out;
10431 if ((app->get_name().empty()) && (app->get_parent() != nullptr)) {
10432 if (app->get_group() != "Subcommands") {
10433 out << app->get_group() << ':';
10434 }
10435 }
10436
10437 out << make_description(app);
10438 out << make_usage(app, name);
10439 out << make_positionals(app);
10440 out << make_groups(app, mode);
10441 out << make_subcommands(app, mode);
10442 out << make_footer(app);
10443
10444 return out.str();
10445 }
10446
10447 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_subcommands(const App* app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
10448 std::stringstream out;
10449
10450 std::vector<const App*> const subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
10451
10452 // Make a list in definition order of the groups seen
10453 std::vector<std::string> subcmd_groups_seen;
10454 for (const App* com : subcommands) {
10455 if (com->get_name().empty()) {
10456 if (!com->get_group().empty()) {
10457 out << make_expanded(com);
10458 }
10459 continue;
10460 }
10461 std::string group_key = com->get_group();
10462 if (!group_key.empty() && std::find_if(subcmd_groups_seen.begin(), subcmd_groups_seen.end(), [&group_key](std::string a) {
10463 return detail::to_lower(a) == detail::to_lower(group_key);
10464 }) == subcmd_groups_seen.end())
10465 subcmd_groups_seen.push_back(group_key);
10466 }
10467
10468 // For each group, filter out and print subcommands
10469 for (const std::string& group : subcmd_groups_seen) {
10470 out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
10471 std::vector<const App*> const subcommands_group = app->get_subcommands([&group](const App* sub_app) {
10472 return detail::to_lower(sub_app->get_group()) == detail::to_lower(group);
10473 });
10474 for (const App* new_com : subcommands_group) {
10475 if (new_com->get_name().empty())
10476 continue;
10477 if (mode != AppFormatMode::All) {
10478 out << make_subcommand(new_com);
10479 } else {
10480 out << new_com->help(new_com->get_name(), AppFormatMode::Sub);
10481 out << "\n";
10482 }
10483 }
10484 }
10485
10486 return out.str();
10487 }
10488
10489 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_subcommand(const App* sub) const {
10490 std::stringstream out;
10491 detail::format_help(out,
10492 sub->get_display_name(true) + (sub->get_required() ? " " + get_label("REQUIRED") : ""),
10493 sub->get_description(),
10494 column_width_);
10495 return out.str();
10496 }
10497
10498 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_expanded(const App* sub) const {
10499 std::stringstream out;
10500 out << sub->get_display_name(true) << "\n";
10501
10502 out << make_description(sub);
10503 if (sub->get_name().empty() && !sub->get_aliases().empty()) {
10504 detail::format_aliases(out, sub->get_aliases(), column_width_ + 2);
10505 }
10506 out << make_positionals(sub);
10507 out << make_groups(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
10508 out << make_subcommands(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
10509
10510 // Drop blank spaces
10511 std::string tmp = detail::find_and_replace(out.str(), "\n\n", "\n");
10512 tmp = tmp.substr(0, tmp.size() - 1); // Remove the final '\n'
10513
10514 // Indent all but the first line (the name)
10515 return detail::find_and_replace(tmp, "\n", "\n ") + "\n";
10516 }
10517
10518 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_name(const Option* opt, bool is_positional) const {
10519 if (is_positional)
10520 return opt->get_name(true, false);
10521
10522 return opt->get_name(false, true);
10523 }
10524
10525 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_opts(const Option* opt) const {
10526 std::stringstream out;
10527
10528 if (!opt->get_option_text().empty()) {
10529 out << " " << opt->get_option_text();
10530 } else {
10531 if (opt->get_type_size() != 0) {
10532 if (!opt->get_type_name().empty())
10533 out << " " << get_label(opt->get_type_name());
10534 if (!opt->get_default_str().empty())
10535 out << " [" << opt->get_default_str() << "] ";
10536 if (opt->get_expected_max() == detail::expected_max_vector_size)
10537 out << " ...";
10538 else if (opt->get_expected_min() > 1)
10539 out << " x " << opt->get_expected();
10540
10541 if (opt->get_required())
10542 out << " " << get_label("REQUIRED");
10543 }
10544 if (!opt->get_envname().empty())
10545 out << " (" << get_label("Env") << ":" << opt->get_envname() << ")";
10546 if (!opt->get_needs().empty()) {
10547 out << " " << get_label("Needs") << ":";
10548 for (const Option* op : opt->get_needs())
10549 out << " " << op->get_name();
10550 }
10551 if (!opt->get_excludes().empty()) {
10552 out << " " << get_label("Excludes") << ":";
10553 for (const Option* op : opt->get_excludes())
10554 out << " " << op->get_name();
10555 }
10556 }
10557 return out.str();
10558 }
10559
10560 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_desc(const Option* opt) const {
10561 return opt->get_description();
10562 }
10563
10564 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_usage(const Option* opt) const {
10565 // Note that these are positionals usages
10566 std::stringstream out;
10567 out << make_option_name(opt, true);
10568 if (opt->get_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size)
10569 out << "...";
10570 else if (opt->get_expected_max() > 1)
10571 out << "(" << opt->get_expected() << "x)";
10572
10573 return opt->get_required() ? out.str() : "[" + out.str() + "]";
10574 }
10575
10576} // namespace CLI

@ TakeAll

detail::integral_conversion
constexpr std::enable_if< I< type_count_base< T >::value, int >::type tuple_type_size() { return subtype_count< typename std::tuple_element< I, T >::type >::value+tuple_type_size< T, I+1 >();} template< typename T > struct type_count< T, typename std::enable_if< is_tuple_like< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size< T, 0 >()};};template< typename T > struct subtype_count { static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container< T >::value ? expected_max_vector_size :type_count< T >::value};};template< typename T, typename Enable=void > struct type_count_min { static const int value{0};};template< typename T > struct type_count_min< T, typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container< T >::value &&!is_tuple_like< T >::value &&!is_wrapper< T >::value &&!is_complex< T >::value &&!std::is_void< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{type_count< T >::value};};template< typename T > struct type_count_min< T, typename std::enable_if< is_complex< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{1};};template< typename T > struct type_count_min< T, typename std::enable_if< is_wrapper< T >::value &&!is_complex< T >::value &&!is_tuple_like< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{subtype_count_min< typename T::value_type >::value};};template< typename T, std::size_t I > constexpr typename std::enable_if< I==type_count_base< T >::value, int >::type tuple_type_size_min() { return 0;} template< typename T, std::size_t I > constexpr typename std::enable_if< I< type_count_base< T >::value, int >::type tuple_type_size_min() { return subtype_count_min< typename std::tuple_element< I, T >::type >::value+tuple_type_size_min< T, I+1 >();} template< typename T > struct type_count_min< T, typename std::enable_if< is_tuple_like< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size_min< T, 0 >()};};template< typename T > struct subtype_count_min { static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container< T >::value ?((type_count< T >::value< expected_max_vector_size) ? type_count< T >::value :0) :type_count_min< T >::value};};template< typename T, typename Enable=void > struct expected_count { static const int value{0};};template< typename T > struct expected_count< T, typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container< T >::value &&!is_wrapper< T >::value &&!std::is_void< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{1};};template< typename T > struct expected_count< T, typename std::enable_if< is_mutable_container< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};};template< typename T > struct expected_count< T, typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container< T >::value &&is_wrapper< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr int value{expected_count< typename T::value_type >::value};};enum class object_category :int { char_value=1, integral_value=2, unsigned_integral=4, enumeration=6, boolean_value=8, floating_point=10, number_constructible=12, double_constructible=14, integer_constructible=16, string_assignable=23, string_constructible=24, wstring_assignable=25, wstring_constructible=26, other=45, wrapper_value=50, complex_number=60, tuple_value=70, container_value=80, };template< typename T, typename Enable=void > struct classify_object { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_integral< T >::value &&!std::is_same< T, char >::value &&std::is_signed< T >::value &&!is_bool< T >::value &&!std::is_enum< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_integral< T >::value &&std::is_unsigned< T >::value &&!std::is_same< T, char >::value &&!is_bool< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_same< T, char >::value &&!std::is_enum< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::char_value};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< is_bool< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_floating_point< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point< T >::value &&!std::is_integral< T >::value &&std::is_assignable< T &, std::string >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::string >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_constructible};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point< T >::value &&!std::is_integral< T >::value &&!std::is_assignable< T &, std::string >::value &&!std::is_constructible< T, std::string >::value &&std::is_assignable< T &, std::wstring >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wstring_assignable};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point< T >::value &&!std::is_integral< T >::value &&!std::is_assignable< T &, std::string >::value &&!std::is_constructible< T, std::string >::value &&!std::is_assignable< T &, std::wstring >::value &&(type_count< T >::value==1) &&std::is_constructible< T, std::wstring >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wstring_constructible};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< std::is_enum< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< is_complex< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::complex_number};};template< typename T > struct uncommon_type { using type=typename std::conditional< !std::is_floating_point< T >::value &&!std::is_integral< T >::value &&!std::is_assignable< T &, std::string >::value &&!std::is_constructible< T, std::string >::value &&!std::is_assignable< T &, std::wstring >::value &&!std::is_constructible< T, std::wstring >::value &&!is_complex< T >::value &&!is_mutable_container< T >::value &&!std::is_enum< T >::value, std::true_type, std::false_type >::type;static constexpr bool value=type::value;};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if<(!is_mutable_container< T >::value &&is_wrapper< T >::value &&!is_tuple_like< T >::value &&uncommon_type< T >::value)>::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wrapper_value};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< uncommon_type< T >::value &&type_count< T >::value==1 &&!is_wrapper< T >::value &&is_direct_constructible< T, double >::value &&is_direct_constructible< T, int >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::number_constructible};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< uncommon_type< T >::value &&type_count< T >::value==1 &&!is_wrapper< T >::value &&!is_direct_constructible< T, double >::value &&is_direct_constructible< T, int >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integer_constructible};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< uncommon_type< T >::value &&type_count< T >::value==1 &&!is_wrapper< T >::value &&is_direct_constructible< T, double >::value &&!is_direct_constructible< T, int >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::double_constructible};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< is_tuple_like< T >::value &&((type_count< T >::value >=2 &&!is_wrapper< T >::value)||(uncommon_type< T >::value &&!is_direct_constructible< T, double >::value &&!is_direct_constructible< T, int >::value)||(uncommon_type< T >::value &&type_count< T >::value >=2))>::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};};template< typename T > struct classify_object< T, typename std::enable_if< is_mutable_container< T >::value >::type > { static constexpr object_category value{object_category::container_value};};template< typename T, enable_if_t< classify_object< T >::value==object_category::char_value, detail::enabler >=detail::dummy > constexpr const char *type_name() { return "CHAR";} template< typename T, enable_if_t< classify_object< T >::value==object_category::integral_value||classify_object< T >::value==object_category::integer_constructible, >=detail::dummy > constexpr const char *type_name() { return "UINT";} template< typename T, enable_if_t< classify_object< T >::value==object_category::floating_point||classify_object< T "FLOAT";} template< typename T, enable_if_t< classify_object< T >::value==object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler >=detail::dummy > constexpr const char *type_name() { return "ENUM";} template< >=detail::dummy > std::string type_name();template< typename T, enable_if_t< classify_object< T >::value==object_category::tuple_value &&type_count_base< T >::value==1, detail::enabler >=detail::dummy > inline std::string type_name() { return type_name< typename std::decay< typename std::tuple_element< 0, T >::type >::type >();} template< typename T, std::size_t I > inline typename std::enable_if< I==type_count_base< T >::value, std::string >::type tuple_name() { return std::string{};} template< typename T, std::size_t I > inline typename std::enable_if<(I< type_count_base< T >::value), >::value==object_category::container_value||classify_object< T >::value==object_category::wrapper_value, detail::enabler > > inline std::string type_name() { return type_name< typename T::value_type >();} template< typename T, enable_if_t< std::is_unsigned< T >::value, detail::enabler >=detail::dummy > bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept { if(input.empty()||input.front()=='-') { return false;} char *val=nullptr;errno=0;std::uint64_t const output_ll=std::strtoull(input.c_str(), &val, 0);if(errno==ERANGE) { return false;} output=static_cast< T >(output_ll);if(val==(input.c_str()+input.size()) &&static_cast< std::uint64_t >(output)==output_ll) { return true;} val=nullptr;std::int64_t const output_sll=std::strtoll(input.c_str(), &val, 0);if(val==(input.c_str()+input.size())) { output=(output_sll< 0) ? static_cast< T >(0) :static_cast< T >(output_sll);return(static_cast< std::int64_t >(output)==output_sll);} return false;} template< typename T, enable_if_t< std::is_signed< T >::value, detail::enabler >=detail::dummy > bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept
